Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is such a beautiful place to stay. It's very calm and peaceful as well especially compared to the sometimes frenetic pace of Marrakesh itself. I had a room on the roof that had it's own rooftop garden. Everyone who worked here was extremely helpful. I was able to arrange both airport pickup and drop off through the hotel and had dinner there my first night as well which was excellent. I only had two nights here which was definitely not enough. I would love to go back sometime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Flip Flop Wanderers wrote a review Mar 1
Review_Text: What a fantastic stay we had at this riad! The rooms are gorgeous and the TWO courtyard were the best! There were even two small swimming pools which were the best to take photos. Everything was also very comfortable and Pat (the owner) was super friendly. Definitely recommend!

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Jane M wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: An absolute gem tucked away in the Medina‚Ä¶..
Review_Text: My husband daughter and I spent 6 nights at Les Trois Palmiers last month and we would thoroughly recommend it. Patrick and his fantastic team looked after us wonderfully - truly nothing was too much trouble for them and there was always a really friendly and personal touch.  The riad is a real gem hidden away in the Medina and the story of how Patrick and Caroline found and renovated the two adjacent buildings is remarkable. It‚Äôs beautifully appointed with all the rooms very individual decorated.  The roof terrace and sunbeds were very welcome after hours of sightseeing.  There‚Äôs a small selection of alcohol on offer including a very nice local red wine. Breakfast was delicious but sad to say I‚Äôve been unable to recreate your delicious mint tea in England!  Thank you Patrick et al - we hope to return! Peter Jane and Georgie

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: mark h wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Text: What a fantastic 4 nights we have just enjoyed here. Everything was perfect beautiful place to stay quiet location but very central. The riad organised to pick us up from the airport Mustafa met us where the driver dropped us off and walked us to the riad. Would have been a bit daunting if we had to find it on our own.  The place is fantastic nothing was too much trouble. We were given tea on arrival and plenty of advice on what to see and do and how to get there. Room was excellent breakfast was great and the rooftop terrace after a long day in the souk was heavenly. Room was made up daily there is a bar drinks menu if you want it and everyone was so helpful and friendly.  On our last night we had a problem over the bill at a local restaurant which was unfortunate. On arriving back at the riad we explained to Ahmed what had happened he went straight to the restaurant called the manager and sorted everything out satisfactorily what an absolute gentleman. We cannot speak highly enough of all the staff brilliant.  Next time we are in Marrakesh we wouldn‚Äôt dream of staying anywhere else. Other tips we changed cash every day at the exchange 200 yards from the riad at very good rates far better than the airport and also on the corner as you come out of the riad is an excellent sandwich stall for a very good snack.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Dave F wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: AMAZING stay in a traditional Riad
Review_Text: Just arrived back home after 4 magical nights in this amazing riad located right in the heart of the city. It was our first time in Marrakech with our 11 year old daughter and we were a little nervous with not knowing what to expect but the staff went out of their way to make us feel welcome and safe. On our first morning after a delicious breakfast we were given lots of very helpful advice on how to navigate the maze of souks which proved to be so valuable but half the fun is exploring and getting lost. The riad is an oasis of calm in such a vibrant city - stunning rooms exemplary service and great location we loved our stay and would highly recommend discovering it for yourself :)

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Kathy D wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: Highly recommend, quiet, peaceful, nice rooms
Review_Text: The riad is a wonderful oasis in a busy city. Not the easiest to find but so fun trying. The staff is super friendly and helpful.  My room was spacious bed super comfortable and they even put chocolates on the pillow.  We had dinner and breakfast there and both were outstanding. The staff went above and beyond for our group of 9  Highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Patrick Weir wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Thank you to 'Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha' and its wonderful staff.
Review_Text: Thank you to 'Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha'.    Myself (Patrick) and Janine had the pleasure of staying at Patricks Riad in January 2023. I cannot praise highly enough how we were made to feel. We were totally welcomed at this wonderful place by *ALL* of the staff. Their help and support in recommending places to go eat and visit was greatly appreciated as well as their help in arranging of information and taxis to and from the airport (and assistance of our luggage). The rooms throughout are characterful and indeed are 'rammed to the hilt' with features that make you feel as if you have entered another era.    The two Riads (to be precise) were situated right in the heart of the Old Medina with wonderful access to the Zouks alleyways and larger trading squares as well as the ancient Palaces Mosques and other places of interest. You will love the interaction with vibrant locals who are only too willing to display their wares as they beckon you into their shops to demonstrate their age-old processes.    Highly recommended for the above as well as the experience of French Arab culture and their ways of doing things.    Thank you.  Patrick and Janine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Nicole F wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Title: Riad Les Trois Palmiers ‚Ä¶ Perfect in every way
Review_Text: Our first visit to Marrakesh Patrick and his team ensured a perfect stay for us assisting with booking a tour to the Atlas Mountains hamman spa restaurants their hospitality was filled with passion happiness and real care for their customers ( family ) . The Riad itself is stunning with a lovely ambience the breakfast and meals were superb . ‚ù§Ô∏è
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: An outstanding stay in the medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: What a beautiful gem in the medina of Marrakech! From the moment we arrived we were blown away by the service provided by this amazing Riad. We were picked up in a luxury van by driver Hamid then walked to the door by smiling Latifa who then gave us a tour of the Riad and welcomed us with some cookies and delicious tea. Our room was one of the most beautiful rooms we have stayed in on our travels. High ceiling and beautiful details. The whole place is stunning the rooftop terrace is perfect for having breakfast relaxing on the sun beds and the views of the city and the Atlas mountains are incredible. Everyone was friendly and helpful and went above and beyond to help us with anything we needed. Thank you so much for an outstanding stay.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Maxime D wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: I want to thank the staff but also Patrick and Caroline for making our stay so special.  We had an amazing experience and it was a pleasure to come back from a full day of visits in such a peaceful place.  They have an incredible view of the medina perfect to appreciate the sunset from the rooftop.  Make sure you try Khalid‚Äôs tea and Dalila‚Äôs tagine before you leave.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This Riad is an amazing place. We had a wonderful time there thanks to the team and the owners Patrick and Caroline who made us feel like home.  It‚Äôs an authentic home in one of the best locations of the medina the rooms are spacious and very comfortable.  The team was available full of advice and recommendations and they even planned a one day trip for us.  We also had the pleasure to have a dinner one night cooked by Dalila and it was truly the best food of the whole trip.  I can only recommend this place we will come back for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Jays travels wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: The most amazing place and people
Review_Text: I am only adding to the wonderful reviews from other guests but Ahmed Mustafa take a bow üòÅ‚≠êÔ∏è. Five star service in the most beautiful Riad . Now that the world is recovering do yourself a huge favour and visit  you will not be disappointed. Ahmed has even looked after my sick partner with a stomach soothing tea. You don‚Äôt get this level of service elsewhere anymore . It has been a wonderful experience staying in this fabulous Riad. We will return. Jacinta and John
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: G W wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights in this lovely place we wished to extend the trip but we had to go back to work. This is a real ‚ÄòRiad‚Äô inside the ‚ÄòMedina‚Äô very authentic but with all the modern amenities you wish for. The breakfast is delicious with warm local bread and freshly made goodies. We also had two diners you must try it the cook is local and attached to the riad for other 15years. The rooms are spacious and confortable with modern bedding. The staff members are very kind and always attentive. A/C in every rooms lovely terrace. Charming route thru the Medina to reach the place. Easily accessible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Matan Azulay wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Prime Location for having the best Moroccan experience.  its by far the best Riad we had on Morocco and more then the Food Beds great bathrooms the most important thing is the staff who made us feel at home and met our every demand.    big thanks for Ahmed who welcoming us at a very late hour was a pleasant and took care of everything we asked for.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: L√©a D wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: Excellent service and amenities we arrived late at night and when our riad was nowhere to be found and our host unresponsive Ahmed helped us a lot and we ended up staying here instead. The service kindness and beautiful room and spaces led us to have a nice stay in Marrakech when it started on the wrong foot. Thanks a lot Ahmed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Delighted to have returned to Les Trois Palmiers after an absence of two years. It felt like coming home! Patrick Caroline and the whole team are fantastic. The Riad the rooms the food - it is all faultless. I have been visiting Marrakech for almost 20 years and Trois Palmiers is the best Riad in Marrakech bar none.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My family and I stayed at the Riad for three nights. The staff were very friendly and helpful even drawing a map for us to get around the city! They also served tea as a welcome and delicious breakfasts daily. The room was comfortable and the upstairs terrace has the most beautiful views. We are extremely thankful for our very personal experience staying at Riad Les Trois Palmiers.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I have been in Marrakesh before also staying in a Riad. This one was booked by a member of my family who was celebrating his birthday.  I can‚Äôt recommend this Riad high enough.  Very well located in the middle of the souks. It takes no more than 5 minutes walking from the taxi rank.  We were welcome with the traditional mint tea and lovely little pastries  There are 12 rooms if I remember right and there are 3 terraces. The stunning overview on the M√©dina and the Atlas Mountains are a dream.  The rooms are amazing. Mine was just perfect on the top floor. Immaculate clean. The breakfast was amazing. I absolutely love their gorgeous home made yogurt with honey and the fantastic bread from next door bakery but the best of all is the staff every single one they make you feel more like family instead of guest. Caroline and Patrick should be very proud of what they have achieved.  On our last day we were leaving very early to the airport and we were very grateful that at 5 am we were offered a light breakfast and scorned to the Riad transfer taxi  Unfortunately due to the coronavirus we were the last guest staying at the Riad but I can‚Äôt wait to go back. Absolutely love it!! Thank you for everything you did for us
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A wonderful hotel with amazing staff.
Review_Text: We were met at the airport as requested and taken to the edge of the medina in comfort. The riad was a short walk away and we were escorted by a member of the team. Our room was excellent and the whole stay was delightful. We ate dinner in the hotel on one evening and in restaurants recommended by the team on the other nights. All our meals were excellent. We had a very nice time and would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Lovely stay at this wonderful Riad
Review_Text: From the momnet you arrive to the moment you leave the staff cannot pay enough attention. When you arrive you are treated to the customary mint tea with some nice small pastries. You are drawn a map as to how to get to the main square (Jemaa El Fna) from the riad as well as other notabel sites. The riad itself is very clean and looked after well. The breakfast served is great. A special note to Mustapah and Ahmed who helped me out a fair bit. The riad is about a ten minute walk from the main square and you have to walk through the souks. To see the way to the square I recorded a video of my walk from the riad to the square (can be found on my IG TV in instragram under ilyasayub1). I cannot fault the riad and would definitely recommend it if you are looking for the riad experience in the middle of the medina.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Great stay with super friendly staff
Review_Text: We had a great stay at this Riad. Very convenient location and easy to get to (once you follow the map that the hotel staff draws for you). The staff are very friendly and open to helping you with any questions or needs that you have. We had an early departure and they set out a small version of the breakfast for us which was very kind. I felt safe and comfortable in our room. The shower was hot and the water pressure was great. The only downside was that the door to the room did not quite meet the wall so with a little gap there you can pretty much hear everything that happens outside your room. Was only a bit of a bother one night when some guests came in late but we were fine. I would definitely recommend this Riad and I would stay here again.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Izabella Vest H wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Wonderfuld hidden treasure this Riad Hotel-  I will be thankful to return there.  Very nice and helpful staff.  Great location in the middle of the old Medina and very close to museums and shopping places.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed for four nights and were delighted with every aspect. The staff could not have been more helpful the room was comfortable and authentic and everywhere was clean and tidy. We had the tasting menu on the first night which was amazing; probably the best meal we had during our whole stay and thoroughly recommended. It's a great location to explore Marrakech; almost everything is on your doorstep or a short walk away. We would definitely stay there again.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Blond Y wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Riad Les trois Palmiers excellent stay
Review_Text: We came here for a 4 night trip. The way down to our hotel was daunting but once arrived very pleasant and friendly staff! We had a great stay and the staff Mustapha and Maruan made our stay very easy nice and pleasant. We will definitely come back!!!!  Lovely hotel lovely food great cocktails and even better service!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Excellent Riad, well located in the M√©dina.
Review_Text: Patrick and his staff do everything to ensure an enjoyable stay in this wonderful Riad which is well located for The M√©dina.  The food and hospitality were excellent and the rooms were comfortable and well appointed. We would definitely stay again.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Pedro R wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: Had a wonderful 2 nights stayed with family. The staff deserve the highest compliments for their service. They provided vehicle transportation from the airport to the entrance of the village and a personal escort from the drop off point to the Riad (2 min walk). They spoke clear English Spanish French and other languages. The facilities and ambient is indescribable. The area where is located seemed questionable at first but after an hour of walking around it felt very safe and secured. Free and FAST internet throughout the facilities.Great air conditioner.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Michael O wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad in Heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: Had wonderful stay in this Riad. Patrick and his staff offered us excellent welcome and 1st class service throughout our stay. Riad was lovely clean and exceeded our expectation. Mustapha was brilliat on our arrival so warm and friendly and the following morning he spent time with us giving advice on getting around Marrakech and things to see in the City. Make sure you get his map to get back to Riad as it is very easy to lose your way in the winding streets. The Riad is located in the old city and is walking distance to all the sights.  Highly recommend this Riad.  Tip: Book your airport transfer through Riad. They will pick you at Airport door and get you to Riad with no hassles. Reasonable price.  Tip: Book dinner at least 1 night in Riad. The food and service was amazing.    All in all if you going Marrakech and you want to experience the city and amazing Moroccan hospitality then this is the place! 100%
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is a wonderful Riad in the heart of the Medina. Patrick and Caroline (the Owners) were very helpful and hospitable and the day and evening staff were all friendly efficient and helped with every request. We ate at the Riad on two nights during our 4 night stay and both meals were traditional and tasty especially the soup and smoked aubergine. The room was clean and pleasant and the d√©cor traditional and interesting. All utilities worked perfectly except there was a power cut but this is something inherent to Marrakesh rather than the Riad and it did not effect us. Breakfast was excellent and the team booked us a Hamman airport transfers and helped with recommendations and directions. Perfectly spoken English French Arabic and Italian (possibly other languages) between the staff.  The location is great for the Medina (but you may need a good sense of direction and not be a travel novice). As a fellow traveller reviewed; it is an Oasis of Calm. The Riad is in complete contrast to the hustle and bustle of the medina but that is Marrakesh: The calm of the Riads Jardins Hammams and Terraces and every aspect of life in the streets outside.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Claudia Webster wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: An oasis of calm in the medina
Review_Text: I just returned from a three night stay at this riad with with my mother and I can‚Äôt recommend it highly enough. It was an absolute delight to stay here from the moment we arrived. We were served a lovely refreshing mint tea along with some little pastries we were talked through and given detailed maps on how to find our way round the warren of the souks. The staff really made us welcome and nothing was too much trouble for them.  We had dinner in the riad on our first evening and it was the best meal of our stay by far with a wonderful tagine among other courses it was a really enjoyable evening. I would highly recommend to eat here if you‚Äôre staying here.  The riad itself is very stylishly decorated it‚Äôs well maintained and feels very luxurious and has a lovely traditional feel too.  It is well placed about a 10-15 minute walk to the main Jenna el fna square (depending how many shops you look at in the souks on the way!) so was a perfect distance to get there and also it was pretty central to the other attractions like the Bahia palace Saardian tombs and majorelle gardens all of which we walked to from our riad.  After a day traipsing round the souks and sightseeing it was a real pleasure to return to the riad and all the lovely staff there they really made us feel so welcome.  Overall a thoroughly enjoyable stay made all the more so for having this stunning riad to stay in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Why? These people give a damm and make your stay feel like it matters to them more so than almost all other hotel stays I have ever done it‚Äôs not over the top just good quality experience all round and very fairly priced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We spent a week in this Riad and it was a wonderful week.  The whole place is kept clean and tidy.  After spending a day in the noisy vibrant city it‚Äôs was lovely getting back to the peace quite and tranquility of the Riad.  I can‚Äôt praise the staff enough nothing is to much for them and they are so polite and well mannered. We loved having a chat with them.  Please take time to have dinner at the Riad it was one of the best meals I‚Äôve had so beautifully cooked and expertly served.  Thank you to Patrick and his wonderful staff for making our stay so memorable.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: james c wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad right in the Medina. Staff made me feel like an invited guest. Do try their dinner it‚Äôs excellent. Only down side no elevators ( just like almost all of Morocco) aside from climbing the stairs (I‚Äôm 65) a very comfortable and pleasant experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Had a wonderful stay in Riad les Trois Palmiers! The staff was amazing Caroline and Patrick were super friendly and helped us with everything. The Riad is beautiful we had an amazing time there.  100% recommend it!

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Lauren T wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: I am so embarrassingly late writing this review (by almost a year) but I think about our time in Marrakech and at Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha at least weekly and I knew it was time to sit down and share how wonderful this place is.    My husband and I traveled to Marrakech in Nov 2018 to celebrate our 15th wedding anniversary. Our time there was magical - I don't know how else to express it. A huge part of that was our stay at this Riad. From the moment we arrived to the time we stepped out for the last time to leave everyone was so kind and giving of their time and information. As soon as we arrived Nour seated us and served us mint tea and cookies and took the time to hand-draw a map and explain the layout of the area for us. Although the alleys and twists and turns were confusing the map allowed us to strike out and explore. Although the hotel didn't have a restaurant per se there was an amazing and delicious breakfast served every morning and we special-requested dinner one night. I believe this was prepared by Dalila and it was beyond incredible. Chicken tagine with multiple side accompaniments and wine. I don't remember exactly how much this cost us but it was something unreal like the equivalent of $60 USD and should have been 3x that amount for what we received. It also happened that we were some of the only people around that night (I think everyone else staying there was out partying haha) and we had the entire open-air area of the Riad to ourselves. Nour created a very romantic atmosphere for us with lots of candles and dim lighting. It was truly one of the most memorable parts of our trip.    We were able to meet one of the owners Patrick on our way out who set up an airport transfer for us and gave us a lot of helpful tips about getting through customs at the airport so we wouldn't miss our flight.    The hotel nightly rate is very reasonable and even though the wifi was hit or miss who cares? I didn't want my nose buried in my phone or ipad while I was there anyhow.    Although we didn't take part I know they offer day tours and other options. One I wished I had done was a cooking class especially after eating Dalila's amazing food. Since I know we'll be back we'll for sure request that add-on.    Overall a lovely and wonderful Riad with genuinely kind and helpful people. I'm so sorry for the tardy review but you all made our time in Marrakech extra special and I sincerely thank you.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: If you visit Marrakesh, stay here!
Review_Text: I can't say enough good things about this Riad we loved every second we spent here. We wouldn't stay anywhere else the next time we come to Marrakesh and there WILL be a next time.    The staff are incredible everything is amazing but the staff make it perfect! They are so kind and helpful. Each day when we came in from sight seeing they were genuinely interested to hear how our day had been and couldn't do enough for us. Everyone made my husbands 40th birthday holiday very very special.    The breakfast is delicious the location is ideal it's peaceful and quiet after a busy day sightseeing. The building and all it's features are stunning. We also had dinner here one night which was outstanding when you stay here I recommend it! We stayed in 2 different bedrooms before and after our desert tour. Both where unique beautiful and comfortable we slept like babies every night!    I honestly could go on for hours about how good this place is. If we could give more than 5 stars to rate this place we would! I felt quite emotional leaving this wonderful place.    Thank you so much everyone we will see you again soon. Katy and Rob x

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is an absolute gem in Morocco. I stayed for three nights and couldn't have better things to stay. From the ambience to the staff to the sophistication and cleanliness of the place I can't recommend anywhere better than Riad. You're so close to everything but have such a much more personalized experience compared to staying at somewhere like La Mamounia. I don't even need to say more about this place - STAY HERE!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Amazing Riad the rooms are well equipped. Excellent breakfast on the terrace in the sun and the staff very friendly and kind. Excellent location near the city center and the souk. absolutely recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Elizabeth G wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay at this riad. We were met at the airport and driven to the medina as we had requested. Nour greeted us and walked us to the riad. He is very charming:). The riad is located down some alleyways but I liked that - made it interesting. Nour drew us a great map to get us to the square. The room was nice/clean and the beds were comfortable. The shower drain was clogged but we didn't mention it. The breakfast was good compared to the other riad where we stayed. I liked that they served yogurt for a protein and the bread was good quality. Nour arranged a walking tour for the next day. We only stayed two nights and since we were going on a tour to the desert and limited to what we could take we left most of our luggage and our newly bought rugs at the riad. Nour delivered all of this to our second riad in the pouring rain when we got back to Marrakech! Really exceptional customer service. In addition he set up a second walking tour for us at the last minute with the same guide we had the first day even though we had checked out of the riad! I wish we had stayed there the whole time but we wanted to try different riads. The other staff was also very good. I would say that the place needs some updating in the public areas such as the cushions but overall it was great!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: When we arrived here I was not impressed the driver of the hotel dropped us off and we had to walk through all these alleys to get to this place we arrived eventually we were greeted by the staff they were fine ask to sit and had to explained now to get back and for the time we had there we were lost every time going back you must remember the bakery and the mosque and the restaurant Medina on the corner I did not like the room no TV and very dull brown and the bathroom is a bit old and it did not open to see anywhere only a big palm tree in the middle of the floor looking down at the breakfast room you had to climb a lot of stairs to go to the top and also you had to order your dinner or lunch to be cooked for you so if you arrive late you will not have a evening meal do not know what it is like in the summer we did find a TV but that was not brilliant either the only best thing about it we were in the SUK. if I wait back I would stay in the new part they are hotels near the big square I did like the staff but not the alley ways.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I reviewed this Riad after staying there 4 years ago and have just returned home after a 4 night stay with my wife and 2 other couples. Patrick and his entire staff have not lost any of their enthusiasm for their Riad and Marrakech. Once again nny best advice is to place your trust in Patrick and his recommendations.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The first day as we got from Airport taxis try to scam you. Less than 3 miles- charged us ‚Ç¨15.00. Then we reached outside the Medina locals scam you. They pretend to help saying - ‚ÄúHotel sent me‚Äù ‚ÄúI‚Äôll take you to your hotel‚Äù ‚Äúyou do not have to pay anything‚Äù.. they pretend that they are helping and showing you the way. 1 min help costed us ‚Ç¨10. Please do not take help from local - who say ‚Äúyou are lost‚Äù ‚Äúway is closed‚Äù ‚Äúcome I‚Äôll show you the way‚Äù.. biggest scam in Marrakesh. They are all over Medina. Sad thing is they are young kids scamming you instead of progressing their life in a more meaningful way. Now if I were lost in Medina I would ask the shopkeeper. Please do not entertain discussion with the boys who will walk with you to show you way. Maps.me app helped us inside Medina. It works offline.    Praise God! For the two employees Noor and Mustafa who greeted us in the hotel. Noor gave us the best service. Very friendly and went out of his way to help us and make sure that our views of Marrakech was not based on the few bad people.    Hotel was real nice. Very conveniently located. I would recommend the hotel only because of Noor. Mustafa was nice too - but Noor was the best. He made a difference for our stay. Owner is blessed to have him serve his guests.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Agnes C wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Great stay really got to see the real Marrakech
Review_Text: Lovely long weekend spent at this beautiful Raid the staff were brilliant and so helpful made our stay great just what I always imagined it to be . Thank you Mustfa and all the staff for making our stay so good  Agnes Chapman
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect location, wonderful staff, atmosphere etc
Review_Text: The riad recommendations and suggestions made our stay in Marrakech easy and a pleasure; the building was fabulous and the staff equally so. The highlight - a fantastic in-house cooking course making our own tagine and served to us on the roof terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Stayed with a group of friends for 3 nights. Couldn‚Äôt recommend this Riad highly enough. The accommodation and location are great but what really makes it are the staff. We were made to feel so welcome and they couldn‚Äôt have been more hospitable or helpful. They organised a fantastic tour of the food market followed by a cookery lesson and lunch on the roof terrace. Just brilliant. This was my second trip to Marrakesh and when I go back I‚Äôll be staying here. Loved it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A perfect stay in the Medina
Review_Text: I had one of the small rooms off the roof terrace. It was perfect for a single traveler. Quiet comfortable friendly staff great breakfasts and close to so many things. I loved my stay in Marrakech and the Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha was one of the highlights.    I can't say enough about the staff so friendly and helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is located inside the Medina. Would definitely recommend staying here. Its in a very nice part of the Medina. Beautiful place with super friendly staff. They take great care of you and make you feel welcome. Overall experience was great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is a nice comfortable hotel  What we liked most was the attitude of staff was excellent. They were really helpful and weren‚Äôt trying to get tips. The desk manager went out of his way to get us a taxi to the airport at the local taxi price and not push for an inflated hotel price.  Marrakech is a great place and the taxi drivers generally don‚Äôt like going off the metered price so beware!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Julie Pries wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: The staff particularly Nour were wonderful at making us feel welcomed and showed great attention to detail. Their food and bedrooms were authentic to Morocco and it was a wonderful end to our 12 nights in the country.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This was by far the best Riad we stayed at in Morocco. From the moment we stepped through the door we were treated like family. The room was very traditional and beautifully decorated as well as the communal areas. The staff were amazing and the breakfast was divine. The Riad is located down a few alleyways from the street and quite safe. At night a security guard follows behind you to make sure you get back safely also.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: LogyBayTraveller, Newfoundland wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: An excellent oasis in the medina with excellent staff!
Review_Text: My wife and I and another couple from Newfoundland stayed at this Riad for 3 nights 25-27 Sept. The Riad is located in an alleyway off the souk about a 2-3 minute walk. We walked it several times including after dark and found it very safe. The reception staff consisting of Nour Mustapha and Ayoube welcomed us with open arms sought to meet our every need and were an invaluable source of knowledge about navigating the souk and medina. We ate a delicious dinner (lemon chicken tagine + mezze) first night at the Riad and had breakfast delivered each morning to the rooftop terrace. We signed up for a cooking course on the first morning given by Riad cook Dalila and were led through the souk by Nour to buy/bargain our ingredients for beef tagine with couscous cooked in traditional 7 steams ( ~ 140 minutes) and 3 appetizers (mezze) plus desert. Dalila speaks Arabic and French and with Nour's help as translator we thoroughly enjoyed the session. We also had the Riad book a private walking tour of Bahia Palace Saadian Tombs and Kasbah and learned a lot about the history of Marrakesh. The rooms were beautiful incorporating many features of traditional architecture and were clean and comfortable. Staff arranged and walked us to a private car to take us to the airport. Highly recommend this Riad for exceptionally caring staff wonderful setting and great food. Download Mapsme.com and use it offline to find your way through the souk - forget google or imaps because of slow updates in the alleyways. Wifi at Riad is strongest in the lobby. The owner Patrick helped us immensely in planning our visit before leaving home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: Logy Bay - Middle Cove - Outer Cove, Canada

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: What a wonderful place - exceptional standard of accommodation wonderful food outstanding service and friendly faces all round.  Lots of lovely nooks and crannies and terraces to sit and relax.  Nothing was too much for the wonderful staff who treated us like royalty!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: From the moment we were collected from the airport to when we were returned there we had the most amazing time in this gorgeous Riad. The staff could not have been more helpful courteous fun and accommodating. They went out of their way to help us and nothing was too much trouble. You genuinely felt like you were being welcomed as part of the family. If possible you should at least eat in the Riad once in the evening as the whole experience and food was wonderful. It's also worth doing a private trip from the Riad into the Atlas mountains which they will tailor to your needs. would recommend staying here without reservation and if we come back to Marrakech I would stay here again. Thank you for making our holiday so memorable
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: This was our first riad in Morocco, and we will always remember its wonderful hospitality and delici
Review_Text: This was our first riad in Morocco and we will always remember its wonderfully hospitable staff. The breakfasts and dinner served there were delicious. We stayed several days and viewed the recent eclipse from its lovely rooftop terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Vicki F wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Les Trois Palmiers for part of our honeymoon. We arranged to be picked up from the airport by their driver & from the moment we arrived we felt so welcome & cared for. Our luggage didn‚Äôt make it out of Spain & we were sure that would ruin our stay but the Tres Palmiers staff were so warm and helpful that it didn‚Äôt. Nour served us delicious mint tea upon our arrival and drew us a map to make sure we could find our way around. We loved how close the Riad was to everything in the Medina. Within a few hours we were comfortable roaming through the winding alleys thanks to Nour‚Äôs map.  Our room was magnificent. Friends of ours had contacted Patrick ahead of time to set up a little surprise for our arrival so when we entered we found our bed decorated with roses & petals & a beautiful spread of snacks & champagne. This was the perfect compliment to the already fabulous decor.  On our 2nd day we were served a delicious breakfast on the terrace outside our room & then walked to meet our driver for our private tour of the Atlas Mountains & Ourika valley. Our driver Hamed was very friendly & knowledgeable. He stopped at several picturesque points along our way. Our hiking guide Mohammed was absolutely incredible. I got pretty nervous on our way up to the waterfalls (fear of falling) & almost turned back but he was so calm & supportive the whole time. He literally held my hand the whole way to make sure I was safe & comfortable. I couldn‚Äôt thank him enough for helping make that experience possible.  I could go on & on but the bottom line is my husband & I were blown away by the warmth hospitality and beauty of the Tres Palmiers & their staff. We hope to come back some day & will definitely highly recommend it to anyone we know heading to Marrakech. It is a little slice of heaven amidst the hustle and bustle of the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This riad has a lovely atmosphere. The rooms we hired (superior I think) were well kitted out and the rooftop garden was superb particularly for having breakfast. Employees were helpful regarding getting the most out of our stay. The only (slight) quibbles were its location being a bit farther away and the wi-fi being a bit unreliable. Cleanliness was excellent and there nice little touches which enhanced the rooms.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Davide Scaccabarozzi wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: High quality hospitality elegance charm and comfort in the Medina.  The professionalality and the kindness of the staff are remarkable.  The traditional breakfast on the rooftop is lovable.  The suite is magic...  The Place to live at least one Night in Marrakech... And than another again.  High recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: With barbecue and children's play area, located in the timsiliti hotel in boumalne, Souss Massa Draa region, 19 kilometr
Review_Text: With barbecue and children's play area located in the timsiliti hotel in boumalne Souss Massa Draa region 19 kilometres from the point of view (bird Valley). The hotel offers views of the mountains and the terrace as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: 1st time in Marrakech and 1st time in a Riad
Review_Text: We spend 4 days in Marrakesh and didn't know what to expect with our selected lodging. We were picked up promptly at the airport by the Riad's driver (We booked that in advance) and after a 15min drive were brought to the Riad. Well...someone met us at the street and walked us to the Riad. People were friendly and our check in was quick and smooth. Our room was overlooking the center courtyard. It was all very quiet. It seemed like no one was staying there. Our room was nice and spacious but it was dark. I'm not a fan of dark rooms or bathrooms (Very hard to shave my face with limited light) but this is probably due to the small windows and limited light fixtures in the room.  We got an explanation from the person that opens the door on how to get to the square and we headed out. He also took the time to explained some of the private tours the hotels offers (Expensive) but once you tell him you prefer group tours he will stop with his pitch and move on.  There isn't an official front desk as a hotel would have but there was always someone near the front door that lets you in and out of the Riad.  The breakfast was decent. Bread a couple of pastries coffee tea and fruit.  So having a room in the courtyard has its drawbacks in my opinion. Whenever there are people hanging out there you can hear everything because the rooms are not fully sealed. There were a couple of nights in which people were there talking and laughing until late and we could hear everything clearly. So if you want more privacy.. ask for a room away from the courtyard.  Well...it was a good experience to stay at a Riad due to the proximity to the square but I realized that I'm more of a fan of the structure logistics and privacy a hotel can provide.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Liliana E wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: We got to Marrakech in the early evening and were greeted by two guys of the staff.  We had 2 double rooms and one double room with 2 single beds. They showed us the double rooms which were nicely decorated. One on the first floor of what I would say is the oldest riad and the other one on the second floor of the same side. The room that was supposed to be two single beds was a double bed. They apologized because the riad was in full occupancy and did not have availability for a two single bed room but they promised they would change that the next day and they surely did.  The rooms are so unique big with beautifully decoration details in a truly Moroccan style the linens and towels were high end.  The only thing was a bad smell that came from the bathroom like a humidity smell. As soon as I told them they brought me a oil diffuser and that helped somehow. And the first night was a kind of noisy.  All the spaces the stairs the rooftop are decorated top of the notch.  The staff was very nice but I believe the first day they were short in staff so the breakfast took a long time to be served the 2nd morning they had much more people helping so that went smoother.  I highly recommend this top of the notch riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed here in April (2 x couples) and can't thank the owners and staff enough for making our stay so special. The Riad is beautiful tranquil and has been wonderfully restored by the owner. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable. We thoroughly enjoyed our cookery class - exploring the markets and cooking with the Riad's amazing chef in her kitchen before enjoying our dinner on the rooftop. The owner and staff were so attentive and friendly and really made our stay special. They recommended some great sights to go and see an amazing restaurant and a local spa for a traditional hammam massage. The breakfast was fantastic and served in the Riad courtyard and the mint tea on arrival was a lovely touch. Overall our stay was exceptional value for money. Location is fantastic too and very good for exploring. We were sad to leave but hope to return one day! Thank you for making our holiday so special and leaving us with some wonderful memories of you all and your amazing home in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A good value for a solid riad
Review_Text: Our superior double room was spacious and well decorated. Towels were thick water pressure was good and bathroom was nice with dark green tile (see photos). The door has a sizable gap with the door frame allowing others to see in. Curtains in the room in front of the door provided privacy. The Trois Palmiers and El Bacha are physically connected and have the same owner. Location is quiet but due to door riad may not be. Service was good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Wow! What an amazing place to visit & stay!!!
Review_Text: This was my first time in Marrakech but went with a seasoned traveller. The city is incredible and the Riad we stayed in was equally brilliant. Traditional in both service and style but up to date and modern in amenities and customer service. The owner was there to meet and greet us and the friendly but professionals staff couldn't have done any more to make our stay enjoyable. There was no stuffy formality or over-familiarity the tone was perfect for our stay right in the heart of this magical Medina.  Thank you Patrick and colleagues for making our stay so memorable :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Sarah B wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: This was our first stop in Morocco and it was a great introduction. While there was a little delay with our airport pick-up - it was all figured out quickly. The staff at this Riad including Noor are very helpful and attentive. The room was great and breakfast was delicious! We were only here for a quick two day stay but we will certainly recommend it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Deborah S wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: My favourite place in the world
Review_Text: My 7th visit to this riad and beautiful city.  It never ceases to amaze and me.  The riad remains beautiful and peaceful in the middle of noise and hustle and bustle Patrick Caroline and the staff perfectly attentive as always.  The city both inside and outside the wall Full of charm and character and hidden secrets.  Perfect cannot wait to return.  xxxxxx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Great place to stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: A friend and I stayed at the riad for a few days the end of March. Can't say enough good things about it. Great location - safe & near the medina. Our room and the entire riad is clean and decorated beautifully in a traditional Moroccan style. The hosts could not be more welcoming or helpful. Especially nice touches were being greeted with mint tea and pastries when we arrived. One day we returned exhausted from a full day tour and before we could even get comfortable we were brought tea & pastries again. We were also given a hand drawn detailed map when we arrived of the surrounding area and how to get there. Everything aspect of our stay was perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This Riad comes with many advantages: a quiet classically beautiful building in the middle of bustling Marrakech delicious meals and a panoramic view of the Atlas Mountains from the rooftop terrace. But most of all it honestly has the loveliest staff in the world. Everyone was extremely nice welcoming helpful and always happy to help you to a Moroccan mint tea. Thanks for a lovely stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Colourful and in a great location
Review_Text: My friends and I stayed at this Riad for the last 2 days of our Marrakesh trip. I loved how colourful it is and its decor. Although a fairly large Riad it still had a cosy feel to it. The staff were amazing! Super helpful and kind. The location of the Riad is perfect for getting taxis and is also in good walking distance from tourist places to visit and local markets.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Terry F wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: We have just returned from staying at Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha in Marrakech.  I would like to say that this is a first class place to stay if visiting Marrakech.  The owner and staff are most friendly informative and helpful and do everything in their power to make you feel relaxed and at home.  After a few hours of exploring the souks it was great to escape the hustle and bustle and relax on the terrace with a beer or some mint tea.  Overall an excellent week away.  Terry and Yvonne
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Breeny L wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: This was the second Riad me and my friends stayed at when we were in Marrakech.    The building itself is lovely VERY quiet and relaxed. We were welcomed with a tour around the riad with information on its history and then was given some lovely Moroccan tea. Given drawn instructions for where to go and visit. The staff and owner were lovely. Me and my friend had a beautiful double bedroom which was on the rooftop. The rooftop was absolutely beautiful and was great to take some lovely photos out there which was the purpose of this trip. The staff were very nice including the cleaners and kitchen staff. I had a great night sleep and spent two nights here.    -  @breenylee
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Oghosa O wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: We stayed in this Riad in the middle of March. We arrived and the owner-Patrick was kind enough to greet us and arrange for our things to be taken to our rooms. We were on the first floor of the riad and the bathroom in particular was stunning. The staff were so helpful and gave us detailed descriptions of the area so as to not get lost when exploring El Bacha and the surrounding areas-on our own. We had two nights stay there and slept incredibly well through the night o comfortable beds. The breakfast was great and the staff were always very attentive. Perfect location-only a few minutes away from Le Jardin Secret 10 minutes or so walk away from Jenna el Fna and the surrounding souks. Great location for hitting prime tourist spots and most restaurants we loved were very close by. Very safe area-you can walk out and in at night and feel totally safe there's also a security guard for the area to make sure you get to your riad safe at night too. Absolutely perfect!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: You can't go wrong with Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha!
Review_Text: From the first contact till out leave it was personal attention all the way.  Great reception at the airport easy ride and 4 min walk to the Riad.  We arrived late around 23.00 Nour made us some nice food before we went to bed. Next day the breakfast at the rooftop was brilliant wonderfull to listen as they city comes alive. Marrakech is easy to discover as the Riad is central so easy walk to all major attrations. The crew goes the extra step for their customers. The city map hand made by Nour was our guide. Would stay again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I spent three perfect nights here recently. Patrick reached out before my arrival to offer airport transfers which I thankfully accepted. Having never visited Marrakech and not speaking either Arabic or French I was apprehensive about securing a taxi. A staff member met our transfer and escorted us through the Medina to the Riad which was inaccessible by car. This made the decision to accept the transfer offer even more important. For first time visitors to Marrakech navigating around the Medina is tricky even in the age of Google maps. Upon arrival at the Riad itself guests are served their choice of water soda or mint tea along with an assortment of Moroccan desserts.    The location was ideal - adjacent to the souk and an easy walk to the Jemaa el-Fna (square) the Bahia Palace the Saadian Tombs and the Koutoubia Mosque. There are multiple restaurants nearby.    The rooms were good sized and had all necessary amenities including robes.    Complimentary breakfast could be served on the rooftop terrace with views across the city or in any of the dining areas within the Riad. Breakfast included an assortment of breads fresh yogurt and fruit.    As an added bonus we were able to take a cooking class with the Riad's cook with delicious results.    All of the staff was courteous and attentive. Patrick the owner was helpful with suggestions.    Can't wait for my return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Loved our stay, amazing riad with excellent service!
Review_Text: We were very pleased with our stay here. The staff is excellent our rooms was spacious our bed slept very well and the breakfast was good. The riad itself is very pretty and you have enough places in the riad to rest in the crowded medina. The rooftop is very pretty and you have a these little places where you can just sit relax and enjoy the beautiful view of Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Laura N wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Stayed with 2 friends in a triple room for 1 night. We arrived late and were met at our taxi by the Riad staff. The room was clean beds comfortable and a good bathroom. Check in was a little disorganised but we were made to feel welcome and warm! Wifi is patchy and the stairs up to the rooms have a short tread but there are downstairs rooms available. Breakfast was good the usual bread jams and pancake things. We met the owner in the morning and he gave us some good suggestions of where to go. The only complaint is it takes them a long time to open the door (There are 2 doors) and the Riad is down a quiet alley so don't be scared to knock very loudly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The riad is so beautiful and clean; location is great as well. The service of Anas Mustafa and Ahmid exceeded our expectation.  We enjoyed the cooking class. Their attention patience service are very personal and sincere.  My son and I enjoyed our stay. It is the highlight of our vacation where we experience the Moroccan culture as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Spent 4 nights - staff and owners made you feel at home in this ornately decorated riad. An amazing location within walking distance to the souk. A peaceful and homely atmosphere after a long day of discovering the city. Quiet and relaxing roof terrace with a good 360 view of the Medina and the Koutoubia mosque.  Azad
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Booked literally 10 hrs before landing and airport pick-up was arranged when booked through the hotel's website directly. Free of charge. The drive spoke good English and explained the city en route to the hotel. Extremely helpful.    Wonderful location in the heart of the tourist attractions. It's in the alleyways but the driver and the hotel staff communicated in advance so the hotel staff picked me up from the drop off point. He took care to explain the location very thoroughly so I won't get lost. He was very detailed w maps and pointed out the attractions around the riad. Super helpful.  All the staff had warm wonderful hospitality.  They booked the hamam brought up the tea to my room etc.    Downside are the room and wifi. Take time to read comments from guests who gave a poor rating. They were justified in hind sight. I booked the cheapest room on the top floor with a balcony Bahia. While the private balcony is great to enjoy the sunset that's the only nice thing about the room I'm afraid.    No WIFI reception from inside Bahia room. A reviewer commented on it a couple of yrs ago on this very site and it was still NOT fixed in 2017. When I brought up the poor reception to the owner and staff they mentioned internet connection itself is unstable in the old part of town. No it's a router problem. Wifi works very well downstairs but not in Bahia room. They placed in the router diagonal from Bahia in the farthest corner outside. Do NOT book Bahia if you need WiFi from the room. Wish they'd fix it or at least put a disclaimer for Bahia room so guests know what they're signing up to. Instead of chasing the owners for Wifi.    Bahia room was tiny and I would not return to stay in the same room. Not a good value of money. Can't comment on other rooms.    Check-out procedure: would recommend settling the bill the night before if you're catching an early morning flight.    The place would have received five stars for the attentive service except for neglecting the Wifi issue and the tiny room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Adam D wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: Service & comfort are first-class at the "Three Palms"
Review_Text: Stayed in multiple accommodations in Marrakesh during our visit and the "Three Palms" riad was by far the cosiest most hospitable and well-appointed of them. The ambience inside the riad is very relaxed and the rooms are beautiful and private. When we booked we paid very slightly extra for a larger room which was worth it; the bathroom was large and impressive. The service provided by Patrick and the staff is friendly and thoughtful and there is always a personal touch. Would not hesitate to recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Oliver L wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Truly beautiful Riad in heart of Medina
Review_Text: Recently visited Marrakesh with two other friends from the UK this Riad is truly beautiful and the staff were exceptional.    Patrick the owner is a resourceful and welcoming host. The staff cannot do enough for you! 5* +++
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Isabel C wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: This is a great place in a very good location. The rooms are very nice - it is peaceful and quiet at night. The staff is fantastic - they are kind and make you feel at home right away. We booked the transport from the airport directly with them and they also sent somebody to wait for you by the main street. The riad is not accessible by car and you will need to walk through a maze like dark alleys but it is very safe. I traveled with my sisters and mother. We will come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: ŒïœÖŒ≥ŒµŒΩŒπŒ± Œ£ wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: This riad is amazing! Great location - 5 min on foot from Jamal El Fna. The staff is so great here! Always smiling and willing to help you. The room is clean and well- decorated. The bathroom was amazing. The view from the terrace also beautiful. The riad organizes some excursions that are worth attending!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Having never been to Marrakesh before the stories of the maze like dark alleys made me a bit nervous about staying in a riad such as this one. However I am so glad I took the plunge because it is such a gem! The staff were so welcoming the rooms are beautiful and the whole riad has been designed with a huge amount of care and attention to detail. Can't recommend it highly enough and we will return. Thank-you so much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Great location great decor great staff great spot to explore the city.  The roof terrace is ideal for a slow breakfast to start your day and the riad is well placed to disapear in the souk or head to other parts of the city. We will be back for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Michelle J wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: The staff were so great here. At first we were worried about how to get back since it‚Äôs in the alley but the staff provided us with a super handy map. Didn‚Äôt get lost once! The room was really nice and I loved staying at a riad. We had breakfast on the terrace which was so nice. Would definitely return here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Ian H wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Excellent, Beautiful with High Standards and Good Value
Review_Text: This is a real Gem if you want to stay at central location within the Medina. The Riad passionately and beautifully renovated by the owner Patrick is a marvel filled with Moroccan delights. The staff were very helpful friendly and courteous. The air conditioned double room we had with stain-glass windows were very spacious comfortable and mesmerising. The bathroom was pure Moroccan dream. I cannot imagine anyone have anything negative to say about this magical place and its staff. My partner and I are planning to return soon with a longer stay at the Riad Les Trois Palmiers. 5 Stars for excellent value for such a beautiful and high standard accommodation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Fantastic Boutique Riad in the Medina
Review_Text: I stayed here for a long weekend with a group of 15 friends to celebrate my best friend's 60th birthday. It was a totally memorable experience thanks to the owner Patrick and his wonderful dedicated team of staff. We were looked after incredibly well. The staff are very attentive friendly and hospitable. The owner is delightful and gives you a full tour of the riad explaining all the restoration work that has taken place. It has been a labour of love. The rooms are very individual and quite amazing. My room was a suite and had the most incredible bathroom. I can't fault my time at the riad. It was perfect in a brilliant location and I would definitely return and stay again with other friends. Thank you to Patrick and his team for such high a fabulous time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Pierre J wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: A gem: perfect location, superb riad and the friendliest staff
Review_Text: I stayed 3 nights at Riad Trois Palmiers El Bacha. In the heart of the Medina it is very easily accessible after being dropped off. Going into the Riad and you step into a different world an oasis of calm. Patrick and Caroline the owners will make you feel very welcome and the kindness of their staff is truly remarkable.  The Riad is a short walk to the main sights in the Medina and you will be given a little map which will allow you et where you want to go with no hassle.  I will go back without the shadow of a doubt.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Third Visit and counting, Amazing Place.The very best.
Review_Text: Spent another 4 nights here which was again incredible. Pick up up from airport was spot on Room on ground floor was a good size and bed especially comfy. Breakfast on the terrace was delicious with fresh bread homemade yogurt omelettes on request were lovely delicious preservesamazing views across Marrakech. Short walk to the square.  10 mins maximum spent a day at the villa (available on special request) this was amazing ask Patrick or Caroline for more info.Fantastic staff and very polite and helpful this is NO1 PLACE TO STAY IN MARRAKECH. cant wait for the next visit 2018. incredible hospitality from all concerned...Special mention to Khalid who always makes us laugh and is always happy. Clean tidy and close to the main square. Stick this on your bucket list.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Sybiel S wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: At ariving we felt very welcomed by Patrick and his wife Caroline. Entering the Riad felt as entering a fairy tale. I have never seen a Riad and i found it so much nicer than a usual hotel. There are no windows but we didn't miss that at all.The sky in the middle of the Riad is wonderful. Patrick and Caroline are such nice people! And their staff is dedicated to please every wish of the guests and they are so friendly as well. There are several places where you can enjoy your breakfast. Our first two days the sun was lacking unfortunately. But later we could enjoy breakfast on the roof terras which is lovely. I read in a review that someone forgot the lower entrance of the Riad entree. Every time we went out the staff reminded us to bent a little bit. Patrick took time to tell us about the realisation of the Riad. They spent so much time and effort in creating this lovely place. Also the Riad is located superb in the Medina. No cars just donkeys so nice. Moroccans are very fond of mopeds which i found annoying. I should suggest the government to stimulate bicycles. More quiet cheeper cleaner and healthier.  Patrick and Caroline helped us to arrange all kinds of visits to go to. The Hamman Atlas mountains nice restaurant and even to have a relax moment in their garden near the swimming pool. We got a lovely lunch there of Latifa. Super afternoon surrounded by 50 olive trees.  i can advise everybody to go and visit this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Heidi S wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: We spent here 5 nights and reallyreally enjoyed it. First impression of the tunnel to riad can give you little bit creepy feeling and the front door would've been impossible to find without help from the riad (we had ride from the airport by riad) but when we got there it's absolutely amazing. So peaceful and beatiful and staff is the best. They helped us with everything and anyway they could and it was always with a smile and a welcome feeling. Choose this one Patrick will take care of you. THANK YOU!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Dani√´l P wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: Ideal visit to Marrakech and the Medina
Review_Text: The Riad is nicely hidden in the Medinawhich gives it an authentic atmosphere. And it feels really authentic quiet and very beautiful. The rooms are very comfortable including the nice bathroom. The staff is sincerely friendly and helpful. Patrick also arranged a very beautiful tour through the atlas and the Sahara. Ali the guide took very good care of us during the trip. Thank you very much for our stay and your hospitality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Good service but poor value for money
Review_Text: Immediately prior to our 2 night stay at the Riad les Trois Palmiers we stayed at a marginally cheaper riad nearby which provided a good point of comparison. Patrick and his staff were very welcoming and kind enough to allow us to keep our room until 6pm on our day of departure. Riad les Trois Palmiers deserves its good service awards however the standard of the accommodation and value for money fell well short of expectations. I booked one of the lower priced rooms and on arrival Patrick kindly gave us a free upgrade to a ‚Äòlarger‚Äô one which measured approx. 12 x 9 feet (Idrisside). This was less than half the size of the room at our previous riad in which we also had very nice banquet seating area. The room had been rearranged since the website photos were taken; there was no TV or seating corner the two chairs were jammed in the small space between the bed and the side wall and the wall light switches were no longer next to the bed. There was very little space in which to put our suitcases without falling over them. The bed was comfortable the linen good quality and the internet worked but whereas our previous riad had been freshly and tastefully decorated at Riad les Trios Palmiers the d√©cor and furnishings were dull and tired. In the bathroom the tiling and taps looked like they needed a good deep clean. Some of the dispensers for the toiletries were broken and there was an unwrapped (used?) bar of soap left on the shelf in the shower. The cracked shower head worked well but the water drained very slowly despite removing the plughole grill as suggested by one of the staff.  The homemade yoghurt was delicious but we avoided the pancakes because there were a number of hairs on them and the French pastries were rather dry. Our previous riad offered a much wider choice and a far better quality breakfast; needless to say we didn‚Äôt opt to eat dinner!  Because Riad les Trois Palmiers is two joined properties it has the feel of a small hotel and the larger number of guests means more potential for noise. We were disturbed by loud talking and laughing late at night and the close proximity to a mosque meant that we were woken before daybreak by the call to prayer. Additionally our sleep was disturbed by something mechanical cutting in and out through the night for which a staff member could give no explanation. The riad organised an airport transfer for which we were charged 150dhs (less than advertised) but instead of using one of their drivers as suggested on their website they hailed us a taxi. When we arrived at the airport the driver seemed concerned that we may have been overcharged and asked what we had paid; he told us that he had been given just 70dhs for the journey.  Given how pleasant Patrick and his staff were I‚Äôm sorry to post a poor review but based on my experience there are other cheaper raids nearby which offer a significantly higher standard of accommodation and better value for money than the Riad les Trois Palmiers.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We spent three nights in this Riad. The Riad is so nice and location is good.    Breakfast is good and we can have breakfast in the terrace that is so nice.    Service is excellent and all the staff and the owner are great and friendly people.    We like to spend the time in terrace that is so relax.    We would definitely recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My sister and I stayed at the Riad Les Trois Palmiers for 4 nights and had a brilliant time. The host Patrick was extremely welcoming and laid on some traditional mint tea and pastries on arrival told us about the history of the riad and gave us some maps to get us back out the warren of Marrakesh's little streets!    Our room was lovely with everything you would need we had breakfast every morning and the staff were all delightful and would do anything to help.    The location of the riad is right next to the souks and just a short 10 minute walk to the main square (unless you get lost in the souks in which case it's about 3 hours!)    I would highly recommend using the airport transfer service that the hotel provides and also the Atlas Mountains day trip was a real highlight of our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We spent three nights in this riad and had a lovely time. The interior is amazing with three floors and an open aired middle. the view from the top floor was great and you can get a great view of the city.    Location is good. It is in a a quiet part of the medina but with only 10 min walking distance to the main square. they have a security guard who will walk you home the last few blocks if needed (just to be safe).    Breakfast is good but simple with some croissants fresh orange juice jam fruit and yoghurt and coffee. although having breakfast up on the terrace with birds chirpibg around you is a great way to start the day.    Service is excellent and all the staff and the owner are great and friendly people.    The only down side was that the wifi was working quite poorly and sometimes we didn't have any signal in our room on the top floor.    The beds were also a bit hard for my taste but guess that's a matter of preference.    All in all a great stay. and would definitely recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A Wonderful Riad with a Magical Setting
Review_Text: After a 12 day trip throughout Morocco staying in humble places this luscious Riad with exquisite staff and amenities was a balm for my soul. It is beautiful it is tucked away off the crazy alleyways of the Medina and it is a trip into the past. The food outstanding (best homemade yogurt ever!) the sheets and towels divine and the d√©cor delightful. I would return to Marrakech just to stay here again. Thank you Patrick!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed at the Riad for 6 nights and found it an oasis of calm amongst the hustle and bustle of the souks. We pre booked airport transfers with Patrick so that Ali was waiting for us as we exited the airport. We were met from the drop off point by another member of staff who walked us to the Riad. Patrick was there and offered us mint tea and checked us in early which was incredibly kind. He had maps drawn up for us too and talked us through them so that we wouldn't get lost.  The staff at this Riad were fantastic there was nothing too much for them. They served us breakfast everyday on the terrace served us wine in the evening on the terrace and brought us mint tea whenever we were about.  The rooms were spacious with ensuite bathrooms and king size beds ( 1st floor)  Patrick arranged trips for us which was better than going through an agent. The Riad was a great place to relax and close enough to the souks and square that no other transport was needed.  Highly recommended and would stay again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect Marrakech riad experience - live the fantasy!
Review_Text: This place blew us away - first of all it is in a quiet part of the medina down small alleys and then you walk through a nondescript door into a beautiful riad (there are actually two riads connected by a passageway). Patrick the owner gave us a tour showing how the original house was renovated and the addition of the house next door. Everything is done with such great taste and comfort retaining the essence of Morocco but with the modern comforts (eg air conditioning tv plunge pools). The rooms are nicely appointed with luxurious sheets and towels.
