Staff could not have been more helpful/nice (they bend over backwards to help you) they serve wine and beer (yay!) and the dinner we ate there one night was the best meal I had in my two weeks in country. I just can't imagine how our stay in the medina could have been any better. Make sure you contact them about directions for the first time you go there - they met us at a nearby taxi location and guided us to the riad. I just hope I can get a room there the next time I visit Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: There Are Better Options For Value
Review_Text: The riad is tucked away behind the Bacha. When my airport transfer had to drop me off at the end of the road due to narrow alleyways the riad's owner refused to send someone to walk with me to the riad for the first time and hung up on the driver asking for directions even though it would only take 2 mins from the road intersection to the front door of the riad. I'm a young and well traveled person and getting lost is no big deal but this lack of common courtesy left me with a bad taste in my mouth.    My room was on the top floor and it was fine but not worth $85 / night (the rate I paid via Travelocity). The A/C didn't cool the room below 80 degrees the wifi was spotty and the shower in the bathroom is literally next to the sink and toilet. I'm a small framed person and it was even cramped for me! The breakfast is good but I would get twice as much food and twice the quality in another riad 10 minutes away. The other riad was also cheaper and more luxurious than this one and they offered to pick me up and walk me from the Bacha! I found pricing for amenities and activities ridiculous - at the time of writing this the riad charges 22 euros for airport transfer. You can get the same thing for 10 dirham. This riad runs on European prices for moroccan standards.    I like you dear reader assumed I would be getting my money's worth according to all the reviews and high ratings but I must say I got ripped off on this one. The breakfast and housekeeping staff were nice and kind people however I would think twice about paying premium for an average riad with limited customer service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Alejandro A wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Great and helpful staff amazing breakfast beautiful room and bathroom with a terrace great location safe area ( guard scorting us to the riad at night). Beautiful riad. Great service. Nothing to complain.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Food and service at this Riad was wonderful in everyway.very reasonably priced laundry service staff was so helpful. The Riad itself is very beautiful it provided us with a peaceful respite from th busy-ness of Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We arrived on the festival of Eid and Patrick the owner kindly came to pick us up. On our arrival at the Riad Amin drew a map of where the Riad was in the Medina and how to find the attractions. We always found our way back through the many winding alley ways. In the evening there is also a security man who always came with us back to the Riad with his torch light which we found very kind. We went a few times to the square Jemaa el fna in the evening and walking back to the Riad is no problem and is safe.  We loved the style and decor of the Riad as it was very traditional with their different rooms for relaxing and the roof top.  Our room was both spacious and met all our needs. We ate one night at the Riad and was very good. The staff are all very friendly.  We stayed a week and loved our stay many thanks Patrick.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Paola S wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: I travelled to Marrakech with a group of 4 friends and booked two rooms at Les Trois Palmiers el Bacha. Just as we arrived to the airport we were greeted by Patrick who drove us to the el Bacha and handed us over to Halid who walked us to the Riad. Upon arriving to the Riad Halid offered us some mint tea and drew us a map of Marrakech. We were then led to our rooms (we were pleasantly surprised when we were upgraded to two suites) which were filled with beautiful Moroccan art. After spending two days walking through Marrakech each time we returned to the Riad we warmly greeted by Halid and the rest of the staff at Les Trois Palmiers and relaxed by the pool and rooftop. Before check out I asked Patrick if one of my friends would be able to leave her bags after checking out since her flight didn't leave until nighttime. Patrick simply told us she could stay in the room and check out at a later time. Thanks for the excellent service and attention Patrick and Halid! We will surely return to Les Trois Palmiers on our next trip to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Marian T wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: A wonderful place to relax after the visit to Marrakech
Review_Text: A charming riad a very friendly and thoughtful owner (French) with our needs. The services were exceptional extremely friendly and attentive with a smile on every hour excellent food that combines French refinement with Moroccan tradition excellent airport-riad transit arrangements as well as the three excursions with a van at our disposal and excellent guides cults and speakers of French and English. Thank you Patrik!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: What a wonderful stay we had - it was magical! I'm so glad I spent hours searching through hundreds of riads to find Les Trois Palmiers! From the moment we arrived until we left we were treated like honored guests. We had trouble with our flight & arrived about 8 hours late and had already ordered dinner from them. They kept it warm for us & served it at midnight which we were so thankful for! Dalila the house chef made such delicious meals Hamid & Ali were friendly & informative drivers while Amine & Youssef were very sweet and helpful with anything we needed. The owner Patrick was on site often and was very friendly and helpful with recommendations. The riad itself is absolutely gorgeous with so many areas to hang out & relax when you're back from day trips & shopping. They made our stay in Marrakech so wonderful - this riad is a gem!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Amanda R wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: After searching through what seems like hundreds of riads in Marrakech we decided on Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha. And we couldn't be happier with our decision. Patrick was most welcoming and gave us the a very private suite on the top floor. The decor was most beautiful and you can tell the care they took to renovate this property.    We did not have a transfer from the train station to the riad but wished we had. Not being familiar with the alleyways of the medina it is easy to get lost and taken advantage of by locals wanting to give you direction. So be sure to arrange with Patrick your transfer to the hotel.    We also loved the location as it was in a more quiet part of the medina but still very central to all the attractions. Definitely would recommend this riad to all those travelling to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Travelling can sometimes be challenging especially in a new environment but not with the immediate warm welcome you get from the airport pick up from the team of the Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha!! You feel at home with 10 minutes leaving the airport. The location of the Riad is just fabulous especially if you want to live Marrakesh experience to its full potential (medina shopping the delicious room terrace restaurants. late nights..). You always come back to the Riad with someone to welcome you back and always ready to be helpful.  With the experience of both Patrick and Caroline I can certainly recommend this little jewel in the heart on the Medina. I will treasure the 4 amazing days spent there. I will definitely be back there!  Thierry London
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Sophie C wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: All one could wish for , felt like home .
Review_Text: My business partner and i came for a short stay pleasure / business and we loved our time in the Riad  a hidden jewell . Yes the airport pick up is a must Ali who picked us up ia utterly charming and helpful  you need any thing and he is there .  The rooms are lovely calming and very clean .  Patrick and all the staff also couldn't be more charming and helpful . I got back to the uk this afternoon and am all ready thinking of my next trip out there . Thank you to all at Riad les Trois Palmiers El Bacha  see you soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We spent four nights here in late March. The airport pickup is a must - no idea how we would have found it ourselves! We had requested dinner in the Riad on the first night as we were arriving during the evening and couldn't face the souk. Lovely meal that set the tone for our stay. Breakfast each morning was generous with a different option each day - omelette or crepes etc. The roof terrace is lovely for breakfast - although the bees were out when we visited and were a bit of a menace (but not dangerous).    We had the Saadienne Room on the first floor which was beautiful. The staff were proficient friendly and always willing to help - even if to reassure you that "yes you will find your way back to the Riad"! The series of laneways to the Riad are a bit daunting at first but a night security guard is on hand after dark - although we never felt the slightest bit concerned.    A trip to the Atlas Mountains with Ali the driver was a highlight. We did the Three Valleys tour. Stunning scenery and a wonderful break from the craziness of the Medina. Had beautiful meals at Cafe Arabe - just a street away - and Riad Idra - in the same lane-way off Dar El Bacha (near the bakery with the wonderful smell of baking bread all day).    Will certainly return (with a spare empty suitcase!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Lovely stay, can't wait to return
Review_Text: Patrick and his staff are the best. They made sure we had everything we needed and on short notice ensured that our whole family had everything we needed --- Patrick even provided a stroller for our baby. The riad is beautiful and we had a fantastic time enjoying the many sitting areas with our tea. Breakfast on the roof was always my favorite time of day. The location is fantastic in the heart of Medina --- I cannot recommend this enough I hope our family will return someday soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A wonderful Riad full of original character and a perfect escape from the craziness of the medina which is only a short walk away as is the Souk and the big square. A big thank you to Patrick Catherine Hameed Amin and all the staff for making us feel like family and for taking such great care of us. We especially loved the mint teas and sitting in the sun on the terraces. I would definitely recommend this Riad. We loved our visit to Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Elaine H wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Two female friends traveling together. We were very comfortable! A gorgeous setting in the nicest and safest area of the souk. Patrick and his staff were amazing! Lovely breakfast each morning beautiful room and excellent excursion planning. We were very happy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Stayed here 4 nights in Superior Alaouite room and very well looked after. Loved the huge room double sinks heater over toilet bowl. Only issue is breakfast is only served from 830am. Thus out of 4 days we only had 1 breakfast as we left early the other 3 days. Amine the night staff was very helpful to try and arrange something for us the other days so we would not be too hungry to start the day. The different housekeeping ladies were so sweet especially one of them (didn't manage to get her name). Kept the room so very neat and tidy! Nice views from rooftop terrace. Owner Pat was very helpful to arrange a hot air balloon trip for us. Even a last minute cancellation of Essaouira day trip. A big thank you! :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Family-like atmosphere. Excellent and courteous service. First class staff. Management very helpful and friendly. Very well furnished in good taste. Breakfast plentiful. Meals are first class you don't need to go to nearby restaurants. Overall a very experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We have just returned from staying at this very well located riad in the medina we spent five lovely nights with breakfast included which was served daily between 8.30-11.00. These times were to ensure noise levels did not wake those who wished to have a longer sleep.  If noise is an issue I would advise anyone to stay in a hotel far out of town and not in any riads they are an oasis of calm from the busy souks and hidden away down an alley however the rooms are all located off of a communal courtyard in the centre so lights sleepers will be woken by the slightest of noises alongside the calls to mosque.  The staff are amazing and friendly and will go out of their way to help us whether it be from a nice mint tea upon our return or with rose petals on the bed. We felt very at home and they all expressed a family home welcoming.  The rooms are exactly as described and shown in the pictures and any help is available of which we chose to book a day trip to the Atlas Mountains they helped arrange our airport transfers and made evening meals available if you pre booked.  All in all it was a lovely stay on a traditional style riad and we were very glad we chose it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I would like to thank you Caroline and Pat for their kind help to cancel my booking 3 days before the trip without any additional cost.They were also very fast on answering all my questions about the hotel and airport transportation .  I hope to be there as soon as I get my new passport.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Dawn M wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: We recently spent four nights at this amazing place from the manager Patrick and his wife Caroline and all the staff the service we received was first class nothing was to much trouble and we felt like part of the family .The rooms were beautiful and the food amazingI cannot recommend this place enough and would definitely stay again .Thank you all for making our stay so memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Tara T wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: We went for a friends birthday and it was just perfect from start to finish!  Beautiful place lovely staff we didn't want to leave !  The rooms are spacious and the design is traditional but very modern.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Just returned from a four night trip with friends to Riad Les Trois Palmiers. We chose this Riad because of its location and 5 star reviews and we were not disappointed! It was a wonderful oasis within the madness of the medina. We stayed in excellent authentic Moroccan rooms on the first floor with lovely bathrooms and windows opening onto the central courtyard. On our arrival we were met at the airport by a driver sent from the Riad ( we arranged in advance direct with Patrick the owner) who then handed us over to Halid who met us at the edge of the Medina ( cars not allowed into medina) who then walked us to the Riad giving us information on the way. Nice personal touch. All the staff treated us like family nothing was too much trouble so helpful and added wonderful thoughtful touches like tea and pastrys when you returned from days out shopping sightseeing etc.weary and sore footed! Another great touch was a security guard to walk you back through the rabbit warren of alleyways when you came back after dark not that we ever felt threatened but not a lot of lighting so glad of the escort with torch. Breakfast is great and we eat dinner in on 2 nights and both times food was excellent ambience was perfect it felt like you were having a private dinner party and after a few glasses of wine we didn't have far to get to bed üòä. Patrick and Caroline the owners are lovely full of local information helpful friendly and made us so welcome thank you for a wonderful stay. Can't recommend enough go you will not be disappointed !.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: David S wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: Top notch service and a really really beautiful Riad. We were very pleased with the breakfast and the accommodations were wonderful too. The Riad is located down a few narrow alleyways but security is available to guide you if necessary. They went out of their way to make sure we were happy with our stay. Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Klaus L wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Looking forward to our next stay!
Review_Text: We spent 5 nights in the Riad - and for sure this was a pleasant and nice stay! Quality in all services indeed. Nice room splendid and for us Norwegian an exotic architecture helpful and nice staff and...... We highly recommend the hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I really enjoyed my 4-night stay in Riad Les Trois Palmiers in the heart of the medina of Marrakech. I stayed in a lovely bright room on the first floor with spacious bathroom staff were all very friendly breakfast was tasty local knowledge was helpful and all with an excellent location. Travelling on one's own is never easy and I felt safe walking through the little alleyways from the riad around the medina and back. Recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Jane C wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Stunningly beautiful and comfortable Riad in the Medina with genuinely considerate and jolly staff.
Review_Text: A calm retreat from the heat and hustle and bustle of the souks and convenient for walking anywhere within the Medina. Taxis available at end of road if you want to go further afield. Two connected riads beautifully renovated. Stylish and very comfortable room on first floor overlooking courtyard with the 3 palms. Gorgeous bathroom for the often needed shower. Wonderful roof terrace with panoramic views of Marrakech full of plants and luxurious shaded seating areas lit at night by the Moroccan lamps. Watch the sun go down whilst listening to many simultaneous calls to Mosque - quite stunning. Patrick has a wonderful team of staff who make you feel completely at home. Great building great food great staff great experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I was so happy to return to Les Trois Palmiers. It was my second visit and I cannot recommend it highly enough! Still as gorgeous as ever the riad is in a fantastic situation on the edge of the souk and a ten minute walk from Jemaa el-Fnaa.    Les Trois Palmiers is hidden away down atmospheric twisting turning alleyways that you will end up happily navigating like a local! Leaving the hectic street life behind you knock on a beautiful studded door and enter a calm comfortable and beautiful space.    The riad has been renovated beautifully. Our room was spacious and spotlessly clean. The bed was great extremely comfortable. The bathroom was beautiful too and there was always plenty of hot water. The wifi coverage was good and speedy throughout the building. Breakfast is delicious (I still think about the bread and homemade yoghurt...!) We asked to have dinner in the riad on the night of our arrival and it was so good! I would actually very much recommend doing that.    So that's all he practicalities... But these are not the things that make this place so special. It is the personal help attention to detail and harmonious atmosphere that made our stay. Patrick Caroline and their team are great! They are always happy to help whether it is drawing you a map making restaurant recommendations or helping you to find the best tiles in the whole of Marrakesh!    I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Marrakesh and I'm already planning my next visit! Thank you Patrick and Caroline!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Great Riad hotel with rooftop terrace and amazing staff
Review_Text: We stayed in Riad Les Trois Palmiers for a week as we wanted somewhere fairly central but away from the crowds. The hotel is accessed via narrow lanes - tricky to find the for first time so make sure you have arrangements made with the hotel in advance.    Nothing is too much trouble for Patrick and the team at the hotel - they are always on hand day and night. We had a meal there the first night we arrived and the Night Manager Amine made sure we had everything we needed.    We stayed in the Almohade Room on the first floor which was spacious with its own shower/toilet and air conditioning. The rooms on the roof terrace afford more privacy. Have a look at the rooms and the great team on their website.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Wonderful Riad with an even Better Staff
Review_Text: beautiful and clean property but the real gem is the loving and kind staff. the rooftop terrace is beautiful along with the pools and gorgeous tile work. the food was outstanding and mint tea delightful! I cannot wait to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: An amazing oasis in the old Medina
Review_Text: Five nights enjoying excellent friendly attention exquisite food gorgeous architecture and the most amazing staff ever. All by being in the historic Medina in Marrakesh. I will definitely recommend this riad to friends and family!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This was my first trip to Morocco and I was lucky to have booked our stay here. As soon as we got to the airport somebody was already waiting for us. This service is free if you stay with them for at least two nights. I suggest to get this service because there is no way you can find this place in the medina. The riad is designed/decorated with the typical moroccan facade and interiors. They will coordinate trips for you and we were able to get our camel rides and trip to the atlas mountain. The employees are all extra nice and hospitable and made our stay memorable. I would love to come back here in the near future...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: In√™s M wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Title: A calm Oasis in the middle of the pulsing Medina
Review_Text: What I liked most was Mr. Khalid who made us feel welcome and calm right from the beggining after our first incursion in the Medina which was a bit stressful. The breakfast is great and we chose where we wanted to take it - there are several places to sit and relax in the groundfloor first and second floors. The riad is very beautiful and so are the rooms. They have two pools which is amazing if you're travelling in July or August. Mr. Patrick the owner was very friendly and helpful as well.  By the end there was a little problem since they had tried to reached us through booking regarding the payment methods but we didn't receive any email or notification. Because of this although we had 3 reservations for two couples and one single they only let us pay in two transactions which forced the couples to pay their part plus half of the single. This was a bit awkward.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Helen B wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: The whole experience was beautiful and magical. Better yet staying in the riad  inside the Medina. The boys... Amen Amed Rahim and Pat were always eager to answer my so many questions. Even help me to book excursions like riding a camel. The food in the riad is awesome fresh just coming from local markets. The tea and sweets the roof the girls in the kitchen the pools the people the rooms the rates...everything and everybody were magical.  Thank you Pat for having such a magical place available
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My teenage daughter and I visited this riad for 4 nights. We specifically chose it knowing that Marrakech is VERY hot in July so we wanted a riad with a swimming pool. The 2 pools are small but large enough to have a relaxing cool down after the stress and sweat of traipsing around busy hot Marrakech. The staff and owners were all very kind and helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed for two nights. A beautiful riad nicely renovated of the owners Patrick and his wife. I forgot a dress and with sms I managed to get in contact and they delivered the dress to another riad where my friends still were. Very good service!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Courtney G wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived the staff at the riad made us feel like part of the family. Not only is Trois Palmiers beautiful (amazing courtyard huge complimentary breakfast pool and rooftop terraces) but the service is above and beyond. They helped us with every possible need or want and are just good kind people. Would 100% stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: When I say I love this place I mean it. First the staff is beyond friendly. Everyone is so helpful and they really know how to make you feel at home. The riad is beautiful and gives you the complete Moroccan experience. The photos don't do this place justice! Simply put its tranquil relaxing and beautiful. After walking the streets and souks of Marrakech it was a pleasure calling Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Made a BIG mistake and tried another riad.Poor location and photos to advertise it 4 years out of date.  I rang Patrick who immediately sent staff to collect us and within half an hour we were in luxury with friends and again enjoying our short break.  There will never be another place in Marrakech like this  unless Caroline and Patrick own it.  Thanks to you both and all your staff old and new.  Hope to see you in the future for the Safari.  Regards to all Heather & Malcolm
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Katie M wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Absolutely sensational! Best place you'll ever stay!
Review_Text: Upon arrival we were a little daunted by all the dark alleys leading to the Riad but when you get there it is absolutely amazing. A lovely lady came to meet us so we didn't get lost and it really is such an experience! They waited on us hand and foot - nothing was ever too much trouble and we were very close to extending our stay for another week but unfortunately work dragged us home! The food the decor the staff - everything was absolutely perfect. The place is incredibly authentic and helped us plan a tour one morning hamman experience as well time in the desert with a local young guy. We will definitely be returning and telling everyone about this place. Thank you so much Mr Patrick and everyone there! We really felt like part of your family!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Gemma S wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: As a first time traveller to Morocco I did not really know what to expect... After a bit of research we decided we wanted to embrace the culture and atmosphere of the city rather than laze by a pool in a big hotel but were a little anxious of what we would find. It could not have been more wonderful. From the moment we were met from the taxi to being waved goodbye at the end of our stay we were made to feel so welcome and felt like we were visiting family.  The hotel itself is nestled away down narrow streets and as we are told like all Riads you could not expect what awaits behind the front door set on a stone wall. It opens up to the most beautiful home decorated so tastefully yet restored to its traditional former glory. We are shown to the serene courtyard where we are greeted by Patrick and served traditional mint tea and small delicious pastries. Patricks ethos is that you are a guest in his home and you are treat just like that by himself and all the staff. They really could not do enough for you and are so kind and helpful. Patrick advised us on what to see where to eat how to barter what price we should be paying as well as encouraging us to explore for ourselves. On an evening there is a security man who will escort you down the narrow paths to the hotel as it is not particularly lit and can be a bit daunting. There are a number of restaurants close by - I would recommend Cafe Arabe for its delicious food reasonably priced (2 courses and a bottle of wine approx ¬£35-45) and then up on terrace for drinks where the staff again are so lovely and good for some banter!  At the hotel we were served a feast of a breakfast on the terrace and sunbeds set up if we wanted to relax - which we did about an hour of!  You can get lost wandering around the Souks looking at all the jewellery spices scarves crockery... if you go far I would advise getting a taxi back for the sake of ¬£2-3. For 2 girls on our own it's not ideal to be without bearings after dark. You will be approached by everyone and of course will get the token "nice girls I like" comments and the henna ladies trying everything to get that henna on you! ("My gift to you" does not mean free!!)  But on the whole everyone is so friendly and welcoming and there is so much to see! We only saw a fraction and cannot wait to return and discover the rest.  We visited Le Jardin Majorelle (designed by YSL) absolutely beautiful and a must see.  I have definitely found a new place in my heart. Marakesh is a gem and the Palmiers is the most perfect home to discover it from.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Steve J wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Great hospitality - perfect for first visit to Marrakech
Review_Text: All the staff at the riad went above and beyond in making sure that our visit to Marrakech was great from the delicious breakfast on the patio giving directions and recommendations and coordinating transportation. They can also plan day excursions and we did a trip to the Atlas Mountains that was really unique. Without their help we would have been a bit lost in Marrakech. All in all they were just stellar people!    The riad is at the end of a winding set of streets and alleys in the Medina so it's removed from the noise on the street. Because it's more remote the riad and others on the street have actually pooled resources for a security guard that can escort you from the main street to the riad at night. That was great peace of mind.    It's a beautiful building as you can see from some other tripadvisor pics. It seems that typically riads are designed for the room windows to open up to the main building atrium rather than outside so the air got a little stuffy at times when we wanted to close the windows. That would be my only con about our experience though minimal and likely a design issue with other riads too.    Thank you again for making our visit to Morocco so enjoyable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Second Visit and Trois Palmiers does not disappoint
Review_Text: Patick and his team excelled once again as we returned or our second visit to his charming Riad. Located in the Medina of Marrakech it is a short walk from the Dar El Bacha Palace and 5-10 minutes to the Jemaa el Fna square.    Beautiful rooms excellent dinner great service from Khalid Emir and all the team. If you are looking for an authentic Riad carefully restored and renovated this is for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: What a great memory our stay in this riad! We couldn't have asked for more! Patrick and his staff were amazing! So friendly and helpfull! They were explaining they're all family and that's what it felt like! We had a very delicoius dinner at Arrival completed with champagne and every morning a lovely breakfast at the rooftop of this wonderfull and well decorated riad! You couldn't start your day a better way! Also this riad is perfectly located in the medina close to all kind of sightseeing places el fna square and very nice restaurants. We really want to recommand this place to everyone who visits Marrakech! It made our trip complete! Thanks Patrick and staff (Azin Mohammed Abdul and others....) We really like to come back some day with our two daughters!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Kayleigh M wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: We just want to thank Patrick and his staff for our lovely relaxing stay in March. We stayed for 4 nights which was just the right amount of time. From being met at the airport to being welcomed into his Riad Patrick couldn't be more helpful and made us feel at home. I would recommend having a meal cooked by the wonderful chef at least once as it was the best meal of our holiday.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This Riad is located on long a narrow quiet street. As you open the large brass door entrance you slip back into centuries past. Beautiful tile and intricate iron work surround the courtyard. Actually this was once two separate residences until the owner Patrick and his wife blended the two into one extraordinary Riad. The section that we stayed had old wooden doors with ancient ironwork locks. The room was beautiful with a oversized tiled tub.  The help was amazing. I had a very bad cold during our stay and we had such a wonderful housekeeper who would bring me mint tea to the room. She was a very special person. She made me feel like this was my home and not merely a guest.  My only complaint and it is minor is that if there are noisy guests on the first floor the sound carries into the room.  If I ever visit Morocco again this will definitely be a place I will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This Riad is positively perfect! The staff was excellent. The food was out-standing and the attention to detail in every single room was MAGNIFICENT!! There was wonderful decorations paintings plants furniture and tables in every corner for your comfort. We also enjoy the spa while we were there. That was also excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Deb K wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: 6th time back to Marrakech. Patrick was fully booked at Les Trois Palmiers but we stayed at his other Riad Epices for 2 nights. Just as lovely and the staff just as attentive. Our last night was back at Les Trois Palmiers and we weren't disappointed.  Thank you as always. Debs
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Paul W wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Title: Great Riad to stay, great and helpful staff and owner. Awesome location
Review_Text: At the edge (or really just inside) the old town. Staff are super friendly and having breakfast at the top floor is a great start of the day. Patrick the owner takes a lot of time to help with your navigation in the old city. And if you are lost in the Medina just walk to the "big square" and follow the old city walls on the outside and you can't miss the place. Do drink the orange juice anywhere in the old city. It's the best I've ever had!    The first time it is a little tricky to find the place. Ask the cab driver to call the the Riad and they will tell the taxi where to wait and they will come pick you up to guide you through a few of the characteristic narrow "streets". Give them the full name because there is another Les Trois Palmiers far away from the old town they might otherwise be confused with. As a bonus the location is very close to a guarded palace so you actually have the advantage of lots of guards being around you when you return home to your hotel. The riad has a person stationed near the palace that will walk with you through the 3 narrow streets you need to take to prevent you getting lost (I have a special talent for losing my way so this was perfect for me. It also means you don't have to walk through the narrow streets in the dark all alone). I never felt unsafe and the owner Patrick even gave me his cellphone number in case I got lost. Also ask Patrick about the history of his riad.    I wouldn't consider staying elsewhere if I was going to return to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We had a great time spending 4 nights at this beautiful riad.  The staff is very friendly helpful and welcoming.  The riad has a great location close to markets restaurants and transport.  Private driver to the Atlas Mountains and other attractions.    We have no problem recommending staying here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Overall our room was clean comfortable and well-equipped upon arrival. The Riad breakfast service was delicious. Great location: peaceful quiet and comfortable.  Overall we were satisfied with your Riad and reccomend it.  A special feedback to Khalid as staff member extremely polite helpful and professional!  Thank you again for your friendly hospitality and see you soon.  Claudia & Diego
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Nicholas C wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha - a hidden paradise within the city walls.
Review_Text: Patrick Caroline and their team are truly wonderful people and we can't thank them enough for their help and hospitality. From the moment we were met at the airport to the time we sadly left Marrakech we were completely looked after. We'd also like to say a very special thank you to Halid and Amin for entertaining us so well on my wife's 50th birthday she will cherish the memories of her birthday meal for a long long time thanks to them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This Riad is fantastic amazing building elegant decoration excellent service. Patrick and Amin will do everything to make you feel at home. the location is also great with easy access to all the main tourist attractions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Stayed here for 3 nights our room for 3 was on the ground floor and was spacious and very clean. It's about a 10 - 15 minute walk to the square and we did get lost a few times but just added to the fun in Marrakech. This is the third Riad we have stayed in and this is the one we will definitely return to. Patrick (owner) and the staff were all so helpful and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. Highly recommend the cookery class very enjoyable you get taken to the market to buy the ingredients for the dishes then you get shown how to cook you then are served on the terrace with your dishes for lunch. The breakfast on the terrace was lovely and plentiful. We had an amazing time here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Good option to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: We spent 3 nights in Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha. Starting with the positive opinion: the staff and the guy running it Patrick made all the efforts to make our stay very confortable. The Riad is very nicely decorated. We stayed in two different rooms. The first room on the roof terrace was very small dark and claustrophobic. Fortunately Patrick upgraded us and changed us after I complained to a much nicer room located on the 1st floor. This one was stunning: large very nice bathroom with a huge bath nicely decorated. What was a bad experience when we arrived because we were accommodated in the tiny room it changed from the second day.  We had dinner in the Riad and it was excellent. Highly recommended.  A con: the Riad is not easily found in the Medina and transport arranged by the Riad is strongly recommended. The transfer to the airport for 10 euros is highly recommended.  In summary: a very good option to stay in Marrakech. Make sure you choose the right bedroom in the Riad since it seems it has two different types the small ones are not confortable at all. In contrast the large ones are extremely nice.  Very positive: the staff who made all the efforts to make us a very pleasant nice stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Nice hidden and clean Riad in walking distance to the main attractions.
Review_Text: Nice hidden Riad in walking distance to the main attractions. Rooms are very clean and the stuff is super friendly and helpful. The room a decorated with love and lots of details.  We booked the dinner menu which was very good and also took the tour to A√Øt Ben Haddou which was a bit touristic but a great trip at all.    Breakfast could have be a varied.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Wow!! Thank you to Patrick and his staff!! A truly wonderful break in Marrakech  The Riad is a perfect haven and retreat within Marrakech!! Loved the mint tea on returning after shopping in the souks!! Thank you Patrick  Also to mention the great walking tour that Patrick arranged!! It was perfect :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Second visit this year once again Patrick and his staff were on hand to make this another fantastic stay.  Extra heaters and blankets were made available for the drop in evening temperature.  Breakfast was served on the terrace as we asked and again was of a very high standard.  Given the ability of all at this Riad it was nice to pass on the phone number of the only genuinely honest female taxi driver Hanane mobile:06 26 35 81 10 Marrakech.  Thanks again from us both.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We had a truly fantastic stay at Riad Les Trois Palmiers last week!    First of all this Riad is in the perfect location - it's a 5-30 minute walk from everything we wanted to see including sights in the Medina and Ville Nouvelle.    The Riad's driver Ali was prompt clear and friendly when he met us at the airport. He gave us our first mini-tour from the car on the drive to the Medina.    When we pulled up at Dar El Bacha we met Deeba (a complete angel) who helped us with our bags and showed us the way to the Riad. This was absolutely 100% necessary as it's tucked away (and hence very quiet). Deeba served us some tasty Moroccan mint tea and pastries upon our arrival and then brought us to our room.    Our room was on the terrace which was BEAUTIFUL and has a 360 degree view of the Medina and Atlas Mountains. Our room was perfectly comfortable and immaculate. There was a small closet night stands with outlets and a safe (which we weren't expecting but appreciated). There were plush robes in the bathroom and our fluffy towels were replaced daily.    Patrick was unavailable (which I hear is rare!) around the time of our first adventure outside the Riad we were oriented by Youness who gave us a couple maps and very clear directions on how to get to/from Jma El Fnaa (about a 15 minute walk) as well as a few other highlights nearby. Youness is a delight - incredibly friendly and a super hard worker. We saw him the most out of any staff member because he was around in the evening and he really made our stay wonderful.    We highly HIGHLY recommend the half-board - we ate in the Riad every night of our one week stay. Dalila's cuisine is out of this world. Each night we wished we had more room in our tummies for her delicious 5-course (!) meals. Breakfast is killer too. Khaled served us a breakfast of homemade yogurt fresh OJ and a variety of fruits spreads pastries and hot beverages every morning with a big smile.    We booked a handful of activities while in Marrakech:    -Half-day walking tour with Moustafa. Moustafa was excellent. He brought us all around the Medina (Jma El Fnaa The Bahia Palace Ben Yousef Medersa the Mellah and the souks) and shared a wealth of information with us. Sightseeing on our own wouldn't have been nearly as informative or enjoyable. It also really helped us to get our bearings doing this on the first day of our visit.    -Hot Air Balloon ride at sunrise - totally worth getting up at 5:00AM. This doesn't need much explanation (just a heads up that you pay the operator in cash not the Riad).    - Moroccan cooking class - definitely do this if you can. Before the class the very kind Youssef brought us on a grocery shopping trip around the Medina. Patrick follows up with recipes so you can keep it up at home and you'll never have been so proud of yourself in the kitchen.    Finally Patrick and Caroline's hospitality goes above and beyond any hosts we've had before. The personal attention and warm welcome they give each guest stands out and you leave feeling like part of the family. The entire staff of the Riad is warm kind and ready to help you with any request.    We can't recommend Les Trois Palmiers enough - you'd be a fool not to stay here!    Thank you a million times! We hope to come back again someday!  Scott & Jessye
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Phenomenal start and finish to a week away.
Review_Text: On my recent visit to Morocco as a group of 10 we travelled from Marrakech to the Sahara and back. Riad Les Trois Palmiers was both out first and last stop of the trip setting standards for the week very high.    Upon arrival all the staff were incredibly welcoming and accommodating including the owners - Patrick and Caroline - who were always on hand for advice and guidance being extremely helpful.    The Raid itself featured some amazing decor with free wifi in communal areas. The luxurious rooms were all well maintained and kept clean throughout both of our stays. Once again they were beautifully decorated with air con and even the luxury of bath robes at no extra cost!    The whole atmosphere of the Riad was chilled peaceful and safe - out of the main rush of the city a perfect place to retreat to after a day in Jemaa-El-Fnaa and he souks.    Breakfast here was possibly one of my favourites of the whole trip - with the most delicious yoghurt recipe and freshly squeezed orange juice every morning. On our final night we ate our evening meal at the Riad too which was again a devine selection of food. There was so much to eat bringing out course after course. It seemed never ending! Again the waiter and chefs remained lovely throughout and we're all up for a good laugh with out crazy group!    Highly recommend this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: joanna p wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: a relaxing place to stay in marrakesh
Review_Text: A beautiful riad fantastic service lovely rooms and amazing d√©cor. The staff were super friendly and helpful couldn't have been nicer. The whole atmosphere of the place was chilled away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. Definitely worth a visit!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Peter R wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Patrick and his team are great hosts who run a excellent Riad in the Medina.    Generally the food in Marrakech was excellent but the daily breakfast provided by Les Trois Palmiers was one of the best hotel breakfasts I have had. The Moroccan crepes are next level.    Great Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: chantal l wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Looking for a beautiful quiet well located Riad you found the right one!  To top it off You will be welcome by the nicest team in Marrakech.  Walking distance to the souk and to the place Jemaa el-Fnaa.  A great place to stay we will be back for sure!!  Thank you to the owners they were always there to answer our questions and to make sure our vacation was memorable . 10/10
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Why is this Riad not No. 1 in Marrakech?
Review_Text: This Riad is an oasis of peace and tranquility in the midst of the mayhem that is Marrrakech. It is a family-run Riad led by Patrick who is the best ambassador for any city that I have visited. His enthusiasm and love of Marrakech and it's people is infectious. All I can say is trust him. His recommendations are not driven by profit. He wants you to enjoy your visit in the most genuine way I have ever experienced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Emily C wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Truly beautiful and authentic riad in a great location. Owners Pat and Caroline and their staff were all so lovely and incredibly helpful. They all made our trip to Marrakech hassle free and gave the best tips on where to eat and what to see. We had a magical stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: It took me two whole days to decide upon where to stay in Marrakech as there are sooo many hotels and riads...  I finally decided on Les Trois Palmiers and my goodness how right I was!  The actual riad is absolutely stunning decorated in the best of tastes with two beautiful pools and many sitting rooms where one can always find a private corner.  Our room was beautiful one of the best rooms we have ever stayed in......I mean including rooms in very expensive hotels!  The whole riad was spotlessly clean cleaner than a "normal hotel" which fact contributed to the comfort of our stay....even the bed linen was what one would expect in a far superior (meaning much more expensive) establishment!  But what actually made our holiday so great and unforgettable was the staff! How attentive and kind they are making us feel really "at home".....we did not even lock our room on going out which says it all.  Dalila the main cook fed us no I shall be vulgar and say: "stuffed us" on the most wonderful food we could have expected. We actually had to beg her not to cook any more for us (we chose half board after sampling dinner the first night).  We shall definitely be returning hopefully with friends and family.  I would not dream of staying anywhere else in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Sam E wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed at this Riad for a long weekend. We were met at the airport by their driver Ali who also drove us on a trip to the Altas Mountains he was very friendly and informative. When we got as far as the taxi could go we were met by the wonderful Eunice and let to the Riad which was not far at all. Dinner was ready for us and was lovely although far too much for us to eat it all! An added bonus was that we had been given an upgrade our room was beautiful and felt very traditional. The breakfast the following morning was fantastic with homemade pancakes perfectly ripe fruit and the most delicious homemade yogurt I've ever tasted! Along with other breads pastries and freshly squeezed orange juice. The 3.15am Call to Prayer was not always very welcome but all part if the experience! We had arranged a trip to the Atlas Mountains through the Riad which was great. It was a welcome change to get out of the city heat and our guide Mohamed was excellent... I would definitely recommend doing the trip the only very slight negative was that the lunch was included was not brilliant but sometimes that's to be expected on day trips and was still very good value for money.  I would definitely recommend this Riad it is beautiful and peaceful yet not far at all from the madness of the Soukes and the main square... We only got lost a couple of times on the first day but once we'd got our heads around it we were fine! Thank you for a much needed break!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Siobhan K wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: We had a fantastic stay in this lovely riad during our visit to Marrakech in June. The staff were so pleasant and helpful. We left a bag behind us on the bus travelling from Essaouira to Marrakech and we were flying home the next day. Pat and his staff kindly arranged to collect the bag from the station and post it over to us. The riad is within walking distance to the main square and day trips can be organised directly with the riad. Highly recommend a stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Margot H wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: I visited Marrakech with a friend the first weekend of July and we stayed at Riad Les Trois Palmiers. We were picked up by the driver from the airport and taken to the Riad. All the staff were very friendly and helpful!    We stayed in a lovely and clean room that opened up on to the balcony overlooking the courtyard. We had breakfast on the gorgeous terrace each morning over looking the Medina.    The Riad is in a fantastic location with plenty of little shops nearby. The main square and souks are also very close and as two girls we felt very safe in the area even late at night.    We would definitely reccommend staying here during your stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Adam C wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: Pleasant Riad close to the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: A 3 star rating seems a little harsh as overall the hotel was pleasant and the staff were generally helpful however there were a few points that deserve a mention.    1) On our arrival night we were shown to a very small room on the roof terrace we knew this to be an error as we had specifically booked the large room when we finally got onto the internet to confirm our booking the staff were unwilling to move us as their system did not reflect this. The larger room was empty and we had provided evidence of our booking. We did finally get moved to the room we had booked but it took an hour of arguing.    2) The breakfast is a very basic traditional Moroccan affair with pastries fruit and yoghurt. Whilst this is perfectly acceptable the service of it wasn't indeed there was one day that after waiting 30 minutes we were presented with one croissant and an over ripe banana. When we complained it was rapidly put right with lots of apologies however it doesn't change the fact that it took them 30 minutes to deliver a croissant and a banana (we did remind them many times)    3) The rooms are nicely appointed and typically Moroccan however our room was in the middle of the Riad on the ground floor and it could probably be more properly described as a corridor with a bed at one end and 30cm of floor space either side of the bed. The room was also very dark.    The plus points of this hotel are its location about 5 minutes from the Main square and the roof top terrace with its superb views.    With an improvement in the check in procedure especially when dealing with problems and and improvement in breakfast offering and service I would probably justify a four circle rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This really is a hidden gem.  Behind an insignificant door in a wall in a maze of passages but not difficult to find when you know the way lies a real treasure. Les Trois Palmiers is one of two merchants houses converted into one unit each consisting of a ground floor with plunge pool deep and refreshingly cold and various spaces to relax in. there is a mezzanine with bedrooms around it and above this a roof terrace with sunbeds and another room. our room was on the mezzanine and was cool and quiet with an air conditioning unit we never needed to use despite outside temperatures well into the 30s there was also a safe. The bed was perfect and the d√©cor was also sumptuous. the en-suite unit was also excellent with toiletries and a hair dryer provided.  The staff kept the Riad in beautiful condition and the whole place was decorated with examples of Moroccan artefacts and ample seating with reading matter and a TV/DVD player also provided.  The breakfast included in the price was also high standard more than just a continental breakfast including bread croissants pain chocolat local items fresh fruit and coffee or English tea. Mint tea was available throughout the day.  The evening meal available on request at an reasonable price was an authentic local meal cooked and served by the staff.  The staff could not do enough for us and were extremely caring  one of our group was unwell one day and stayed in her room and the staff checked on her throughout the day bringing mint tea and sweetmeats and yoghurt.  Monsieur Patrick the owner could not do enough for us either and arranged for his driver to collect us and our luggage from our previous accommodation and transport us to the airport at the end of our stay. His stated aim to make us like part of the family during our stay was achieved perfectly. I would not have any hesitation in recommending Les Trois Palmiers to anybody.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Paula E wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: Palacial sorroundings and a staff fit for a king!
Review_Text: This riad was recommended to me by a classmate in my Summer in Spain law school program. I'm so glad I asked someone who had just been to Marrakech. I booked the riad the day before my trip and was a little nervous since I did not hear directly from the riad regarding my taxi pick up time from the airport which is included in your rate. Be that as it may the driver was waiting for me in the airport with a sign which was a huge relief. The taxis cannot go into the part of the city where the riad is located so I was handed off to Enuss the host/receptionist who welcomed me and walked me to the riad. I cannot say enough about this man and his graciousness wealth of knowlege and accomodating demeanor. Another employee who's name eludes me serves breakfast in the morning where ever you wish to take it. Homemade yogurt is served everyday and I've never tasted anything like it. You basically will have your own private outdoor dining area depending on which floor you're on. Make sure to go up to the roof around sunset the view is stunning and you can see the entire city. Patrick the owner drew a map for me the next day and explained the history of the riad and some don't miss attractions. You will be just a 10 minute walk from the main square. If you come back after dark a nice man named Omar will meet you in the main street and escort you back through the labyrinth of walled in streets and alert the receptionist that you are back. This is like stepping back into another time even though the wifi is better than any in Europe where I've stayed this summer. For the value location quality of service I don't know how you could do better than this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I can't praise this lovely Riad highly enough. It was spotlessly clean tastefully appointed and simply beautiful. The owner Patrick and concierge Khalid give this very special place it's unique charm. I highly recommend the practical airport pickup service. The elegant and very dignified Khalid drew us a map from the Riad to Jemaa el Fna plaza which allowed us to navigate the medina with very little trouble. Pay no attention to the cheeky teenagers who delight in pointing you the wrong way -- just stick to Khalid's map. The Riad is perfectly located for all the main sights yet is hidden away in a perfectly quiet location that is absolutely relaxing and simply beautiful. The rooftop terrace was an added feature that we thoroughly enjoyed. I had dinner every evening in the Riad and chef Dalila outdid herself every time with wonderfully delicious dishes especially the typical vegetarian starters made with some form of aubergine. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it without hesitation. In fact just writing this review makes me yearn to go back soon. Many many thanks to Patrick and his staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I loved it here. A beautiful building peaceful well appointed tastefully decorated. A great location near enough to the hustle and bustle but quiet and relaxing inside. An abundance of helpfulness available from the hand drawn map to advice and care when I was poorly. But most importantly the service from everyone is second to none you are welcomed and made to feel welcome and thoroughly looked after. I personally could not have asked for more. Thank you to Patrick and his great team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Location, location, location plus beautiful surroundings and hospitality
Review_Text: I had a week at Les Trois Palmiers and found it hard to fault! The medina especially in and around the square is all noisy hustle and bustle so being a little away turned out to be quite perfect. Les Trois Palmiers (which is actually two raids joined together) is located down a dead-end alley off the street with only riads and private residents as immediate neighbours ensuring it was a peaceful retreat. From the street there was quick access to taxis in one direction and souks in the other which was very convenient and being a single female traveller having a private security guard throughout the night to provide escort to your door a bonus.  The owners have created a sophisticated environment with a quiet and friendly ambiance. All the staff especially Khalid and Unais were efficient and considerate and thought to offer before I had a chance to ask!  Breakfasts were lovely served wherever you choose; I found the roof terrace quite perfect in the cooler morning air.  Other little touches like fresh roses in my room homemade pastries on arrival chilled music in the courtyard and personalised advice on Marrakech made this a much nicer stay than I imagined before arriving.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We went for a four day break and at the end felt that we now had extended family in Marrakech.  Nothing was to much trouble for Patrick the owner with his informative introduction and personally drawn map.  Our thanks to Khalid who made every day he was working a joyand all the rest of the very family orientated hard working staff.  Situated in the old town this is a truly quiet 5 star oasis offering more than just B & B great breakfasts and evening meals. Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha offers visitors the chance to experience the real Marrakech with just a short walk.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We have just returned from two days in this Riad. It was an oasis from the bustle of the medina. The house(s) are spectacular and worth taking the time to explore the terraces are peaceful and a wonderful spot to take a book on a lovely afternoon. The food is exceptional and the staff so welcoming that you feel as if you are visiting family. Nothing was ever too much trouble. If you have the time take a cooking lesson ...worth every minute!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Stayed for two nights in April 2015. Beautiful riad around tow courtyards of 18c original buildings. Small plunge pools roof terraces air con in rooms wi fi and super friendly staff. Nice traditional Moroccan breakfast with fresh pastries juice etc. Patrick Le partron and his team are great helpful with transfers maps and advice. Didn't dine here but also looked good. Will stay again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Daniel M wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: We booked after reading a review stating 'an oasis of calm'... So true. Lovely room peaceful roof terrace and staff that couldn't be more helpful. They helped with every aspect with a smile regardless of how many questions we asked. The hand drawn street map was a saviour. When we had a minor mistake the staff and owner went above and beyond to make things right. We would book again and highly recommend it!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Delightful Riad hidden away in the medina.
Review_Text: The riad is an oasis of calm in the midst of the bustling medina area. The design and decor are lovely - each room has it's own character. We stayed in the Saadienne Suite which has a huge bath tub that you have to climb into! The doors creak a bit and the wi-fi reception is a bit erratic but it all adds to the charm!  The central courtyard is a comfortable place to relax in at any time and we were served a wonderful evening meal there which we had pre-ordered for the first night of our stay - this was all beautifully prepared and cooked by the resident chef and the chicken tagine was the best we had during our stay in Marrakech. The rooftop terrace is perfect for relaxing when the weather is warm and it was a great start to the day having the delicious breakfast served there whilst listening to the birdsong and sounds of the city.  It's definitely worth booking the return airport transfer which is currently included in the cost if you stay for 4 nights or more then you don't have to haggle with local taxi drivers and you are escorted from the drop off area to the riad by their staff. (Cars can't enter the central medina area). We also pre-booked a day trip to the Atlas mountains which was organised via the riad and had a wonderful day out allowing us to see the surrounding countryside.  Patrick (the owner) and his staff are very welcoming - they treated us more like family than paying guests! We really felt as though they cared that we enjoyed our stay - taking the trouble to give us detailed directions to various areas that we wanted to visit in the city and giving advice to us about local customs and traditions.  It was a very memorable stay - thank you to Patrick Khalid and Yussef and to Ali the driver.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Sarah K wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Lovely Riad in the old town
Review_Text: This is a beautiful riad offered us exactly what we wanted to experience in Marrakesh and more! All of the staff are amazing nothing is too much trouble it really is a home from home. The terrace was great for relaxing and sunbathing the breakfast is delicious free airport transfers and perfect location. Thank you for a lovely week!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Kristina B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Marrahech falvour on top of the surfing trip
Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakech - and Riad Les Trois Palmiers has every feature to sense real medina lifestyle...I will not say anything more to avoid spoilers - this city is and adventure and Riad Les Trois Palmiers gives you perfect oasis after exhausting walks around the souks and medina...fantastic staff and charming owner!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My holiday in Marrakech was organised by my other half and her decision to book this Riad was one of her best by far. We were collected from the airport by a driver pre arranged by the Riad- which bypasses the whole hassle of haggling with taxi driver to get to the medina.    I must admit - was a little concerned at first having to navigate down various back alleys to get to the Riad but once inside was amazed at how spacious/ bright and stylish the riad was. Just to mention that although it is a little disconcerting at first to navigate these alleyways- we never felt any danger at all and it was perfectly safe.    The Riad is divided into 2 separate buildings with a large open central courtyard in both one of them has the aforementioned 3 palm trees which gives rise to its name. There are some very picturesque pools in each courtyard- probably suitable for bathing only. The roof is dotted with sofa's and little enclaves - perfect for sunbathing and relaxing when the weather is good.    We booked the Sardienne suite- which was equipped with a small flatscreen + dvd player and satellite channels (mainly continental you do get sky news in english though). The highlight is the bathroom which has a very luxurious mosaic tiled bath tub big enough probably for 4-5 ppl. Just a small tip- you may have to ask the staff when the best time to attempt a bath might be- as the hot water will run out way before you are close to filling the tub.    The Riad has a good on site cook and they are happy to take requests prices are good value for money and was just as good as any of the local restaurants. They also serve alcohol and prices are keeping with local bars. since we were only one of 2/3 sets of guests staying there we definitely felt well attended to Staff are very friendly.    Wifi is free a big plus but is very erratic with the connection. The best places to get connections are in the courtyard unfortunately getting wifi in our room was hit and miss.    Breakfast is standard continental pastries/ bread juice with tea/ coffee. A freshly made flat bread. You can request an omelette which some guests were not aware of.    Patrick who runs the Riad is an excellent source of local knowledge and gave us some good recommendations for local bars/ restaurants.    I'd wholeheartedly recommend this Riad to friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Colin W wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Hard to find, harder to leave
Review_Text: Tucked away in the heart of the old city at the end of an alley through a half door you enter a spacious and exotic hotel with so much charm it is hard to take it all in. Comfortable great food and a wonderful introduction to the richly ornate Moroccan Riad hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I'm a little late posting this review but better late than never. I stayed at this beautiful Riad in Feb 2013 for my boyfriends birthday. I like to take him somewhere different every year but this was just beyond perfection. I booked 3 nights at the Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha however it wasn't until a few weeks later I realised the terrible mistake I had made. I had only gone and booked a hotel with a similar name downtown which had awful reviews. It wasn't until I had emailed Patrick the owner of the Les Trois Palmiers who alerted me to my mistake and told me I had booked the wrong hotel. I was quickly able to correct my mistake and reserve the nights I wanted thankfully in the right Riad.    I emailed Patrick who very kindly sent a driver to collect us from the airport. Although our driver was stuck in traffic and running late Patrick reassured us that he was on his way and that we hadn't been forgotten. We were driven to the centre of Marrakesh where we then pulled over and our luggage was transferred onto a little wooden cart and we were escorted by 2 local men down some very narrow alleyways. So narrow that you had to bend down so that you didn't hit your head on the roof. Thankfully without the help of these locals we would not have found this Riad that was hidden away. We stopped at a large wooden door down one of these alleys. I could not begin to imagine what was behind it and even if we had come to the right place. I was preparing myself for an utter nightmare and was beginning to think I had been scammed. But to my amazement when the door opened it revealed an absolute piece of paradise. A stunning Moroccan Riad surrounded by Palm trees pools stunning decor and friendly faces. I was gobsmacked. Even my partner did not say a word and that is a first. You would not believe that this Riad is located only a 5 min walk away from the main square.    We were greeted by Patrick the owner who welcomed us to his Riad and gave us a cup on mint tea. We had a little natter and then were shown up to our room 'Iddrisside' which was on the roof!! A stunning little room on the roof of this Riad decorated perfectly surrounded by flowers and a view over the entire city. Patrick took us up some steps which led to a sun trap. We were able to lounge out on the sun lounger. Although it was still quite breezy this time of year the sun was still shining. Patrick pointed out the Mosques and explained the call to prayer. It was fascinating to listen to and from all angles.    We had a wonderful nights sleep. Did not hear a sound apart from the call to prayer which starts very early in the morning but if you can't cope with this then don't go to Morrocco. Breakfast was an absolute delight. So much so that we actually looked forward to it in the morning. Staff came in with fresh breads from the local bakeries home made yogurt was absolutely delishious fresh orange juice just wonderful. Birds singing and tweeting and flying around the palm trees.    As it was my boyfriends birthday we were looking for an activity to do. Patrick recommended some quad biking. He even phoned up and organised it for us. We were collected from our Riad and returned again later on. Fantastic!    I had booked a three night stay and then had plans to check out for two nights in order to go on a 3 day tour around Morocco and then booked a further 2 nights here on our return back to Marrakesh. The lovely owner Patrick allowed us to leave our luggage here during the 3 days we were gone so that we didn't have to drag our suitcases around with us in the 4x4.    On our return and to our suprise Patrick had put us in an upgraded room 'Almohade' for the same price. Absolutely stunning room. You have to open a tiny wooden door and bend down to go in. The whole stay here was absolutely fantastic. I can't fault it. Even when we wanted to sit in after a long walk around the Medina we could just sit and relax anywhere in the Riad. It was so quiet and peaceful and staff were always asking if there was anything we need.    We ate dinner here on one night. It was a tagine of some sort of sausage. I have to say I was not a massive fan but that is just down to personal taste. The staff even offered to cook me something else because I did not eat it.    On our departure Patrick gave me a lovely bracelet made from Orange rope. Stunning. A really lovely touch. I definitely miss this Riad and I would return again should I ever go back to Marrakesh. I would without a doubt recommend this Riad to family and friends but at the same time I hope it does not become too popular else the price will go up for our return.    Thank you Patrick for a really wonderful memorable and unforgettable stay.    Lynsey and Martin.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: There is an air of calm and relaxation about this space which provides a welcome retreat from the hassle and mania which can be experienced in Marrakesh. The roof terrace which looks out over the city is spellbinding on a sunny day.    It's actually two 300 year old riads knocked together and lovingly renovated by the French owner Patrick and his wife. As it's tucked away down a labyrinth of alleyways which are inaccessible to vehicles donkeys had to be used to transport building materials over the 18 month period it took for the renovation. On first arrival it is almost impossible to find without the help of someone with local knowledge so be prepared to pay a Marrakshi for guidance. Once you've got your bearings it's a 10 minute stroll through the souk to the Jemaa El Fna.    Breakfast is substantial omelette on request freshly squeezed orange juice Moroccan pastries with the deliciously creamy home made yoghurt the star attraction.
