The real star turns in the riad though are the effusively attentive staff Khaled in the daytime and Yusuf the night porter who will make you as much mint tea as you can drink and ensure you have a heater to keep you warm in the chilly wintertime.    The place is traditionally decorated with three real palm trees the centre piece. Bedrooms are large and comfortable - there was a slight smell of drains in our bathroom but that was a small price to pay for the privilege of staying in such a fascinating authentic well located riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: ...All these good reviews came from. Seems that majority of clients were pleased so we may have had the one of not great time.    Due to weather in the mountains we got stuck in Marrakech for another night and I only booked this place at about 7.30 pm once we failed to cross the mountains and returned to Marrakech... using an app on my phone. When we arrived to the Riad maybe 30 mins after the booking they didn't seem to have any idea. Which is partially fair enough maybe didn't check their emails every 30 mins so no trouble. We were sat and asked to wait till the receptionist guy manages to get hold of the owner to see which room we can have. (I thought I booked a specific twin room so I fail to understand why this suddenly needed clarifying. It was on my confirmation email as well.) As this clarification was taking quite a while we were offered tea & biscuits which was good. After some pacing around the floors by the receptionist we eventually got into the room at about 9 pm. It was fairly simple and nice room no thrill but absolutely fine. We however noticed a strange smell as if from blocked drain or something similar. Air con needed to be on "heating" setting as it wasn't exactly warm in the room and it was like having a dying tractor in the room with you. Despite having an extension wifi router right next to my head/pillow I could never connect to it. I had to leave the room to get wifi reception from the original router (not extension one). This worked ok in the evening didn't work at all next morning. When having a shower in the morning there wasn't too much warm water left it seemed and the drain looked blocked I stood in a puddle way above my ankles. There was an "industrial" padlock on our door that we weren't given keys to so couldn't lock our room at any point. Breakfast in morning was more food than I've had in an another Riad we stayed at. Couldn't not notice that the receptionist always wore his puffy winter coat indicating how warm it was in this area.    On the overall we paid just under 50 euros for the night which isn't expensive. But compared to the Riad we staid at the other nights where we also spent 50 euros a night this didn't look like a good deal at all. See my other review to compare these two Riads.    Forgot to mention that it wasn't too easy to find this Riad which however isn't anything unusual. You more less struggle to find anything in Marrakech. There was a security guard who always walked you from the main road to the Riad door which was nice but the need of a security guy indicates certain things.    But as I said there must be something good about this Riad as it wouldn't have got so many good reviews. We just possibly didn't seem to have that luck to experience the same. Unfortunately.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Beautiful authentic Riad with lovely owner and staff!
Review_Text: I stayed at the Riad Les Trois Palmiers for two nights with my boyfriend in January.  We had the "Alaouite" double bedroom with a beautiful mosaic tiled bathroom and big window opening up to the courtyard. The room has a traditional Moroccan d√©cor is spacious and very clean. In the evening it could get quite cold but we had a plug in fan heater in the room so it was never a problem.  The French owner and staff at the Riad are all extremely helpful and accommodating.  They all speak excellent English as well as French.  Service is always delivered with a smile!    The location is not bad but you have to walk down a few back alleys to get there. HOWEVER they did have a security guard who walked us from the road to the Riad ever night shining his torch and making sure we were safe and got in properly. (he didn't want money just a great service they provided to make us tourists feel more comfortable)    One possible negative would be that you don't get a key to the front door but that seem pretty standard for Riads in Morocco...  We had to knock on the door or phone up the reception to be let in which if you arrive late can feel a bit uncomfortable. But as mentioned we always had the guard waiting with us to make sure we got in ok.    The Breakfast is lovely with Fresh orange juice traditional Moroccan crepes bread jams Vache Qui Rit cheese pastries and choice of eggs (we had omelet)    Internet was high speed in communal areas but a bit slower in our room.    As it was quite cold and cloudy during our stay we didn't get to enjoy the sun terrace but it looked lovely!    All in all we were very happy with our stay at Riad Les Trois Palmier. This Riad is finished to an extremely high standard with very authentic and high quality furnitures and fittings. The service is exceptional and we were very grateful for all the advice pick up from the airport and drop off at the bus station all free of charge.    Would love to stay here again in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: There are probably nicer riads in Medina but you won't find more friendly and helpful staff anywhere. They took care of everything we asked for and we were very happy with their recommendations. They certainly understand what hospitality means and we appreciated their service very much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is one amazingly beautiful place to stay. The staff are absolutely fantastic nothing is too much trouble for them. We will definitely be going back. One tip! Take the airport transfer offered by the hotel as it will be very tricky to find by yourself the first time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Kathrine K wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: A highly recommended place to stay
Review_Text: This was my second visit in Marrakech and at the riad. As for the first time we were charmed by the hospitality and friendliness of the staff. Patrick Khalid and Abdul did all they could to make us feel at home. The breakfast was varied and delicious and so was our dinner at the riad. And we had a beautiful trip to the Atlas Mountains arranged by the riad.    The interior and the location of the riad is excellent. We would love to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Lovely Staff, Great Location, Recommended Riad Experience
Review_Text: This is a great example of a classic Riad the rooms are good and so are the group areas. Decor is traditional and definitely has a luxury feel to it. Staff are really helpful and you're in a good place in the Medina to visit all the sights without getting too confused. Only 10 mins walk from the main square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A delightful Riad with excellent staff and charming host
Review_Text: I began my trip to Morocco in Marrakech. I traveled from Madrid with an old school friend so we were to share a room but with 2 single beds. We were met at the airport by Ali and escorted from the drop off just outside the city walls by Yussef to this most delightful Riad. The room was perfect and so beautifully appointed. The next day we met our charming host Patrick who not only provided us with recommendations for Marrakech but also organized our five day trip into the desert. We discussed at length with Patrick what we wanted to see what kind of travelers we are and what our interests were. Together with Ali Patrick put together a perfect itinerary for us that was well beyond what we could have hoped for. Ali was a TERRIFIC guide and travel companion. Discovering the Morocco Ali showed us was the highlight of our trip. Ali spoke Spanish with my friend English and French with me. Ali went out of his way to accommodate our every interest and easily went with the flow when we changed our minds which was often. My friend is a photographer and I I am very interested in meeting folks and chatting and getting a glimpse of how every day people live. We also love coffee :) and Ali went out of his way to stop at some great spots so we could just watch the world go by. I highly recommend Patrick's Riad Les Trois Palmieres and a trip with Ali.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: hira s wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: Stayed at this hotel from 16th dec to 20th. was a good hotel but nothing what like I expected located in a good area. Walking distance to markets etc but wouldn't class this as a 5 star property it was clean and safe to stay in but nothing really special the pools were not in use as the water was freezing breakfast was simple just hot drinks and bread rolls. Me and the misses stayed in the sardine room which was Suspose to be the best room in the riad it was nice but cold after the 1st night we had to change rooms because there was a water issue but we went to a similar room and was charged a lower rate which was a good thing. The staff in the riad was really good anything you need day or night they will help as much as possible. Take a phone and torch with you hard to find during the night. Had 1 bad issue with the riad around 12 45 at night some other couple was staying at the riad as they arrived back to it the night porter was either sleeping or didn't hear the door but I did and I was a at the top floor they was banging for 15 mins until they woke me up and then i opened the door for them wouldn't class this holiday for a lads more of a family holiday was really expensive out there like ¬£3.50 for a small beer on average if you are going for a meal it's going to work out ¬£50 for two. weather was good t shirt and jeans was hot around 22 degrees.I expected more from this riad from reading the other reviews overall was an ok place to stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Emily J wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: We booked a double room but when we arrived we were given a room with twin singles beds. We went back to reception to switch and the receptionist then showed us two more twin rooms. It seems that they don't have many/any double rooms?    Apart from that it was clean and nicely decorated nice location etc.  Staff were friendly
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Deb K wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: 5th visit back to this wonderful city and amazing Riad and neither ever disappoint.  A small incident even turned itself around by the wonderful community spirit of the locals.  And I'm still finding areas of the Medina I've never seen before.  Thank you to Patrick and his lovely staff as always it felt like coming home :-) x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We have just got back from the Riad Les Trois Palmiers and overall we had a lovely time. You will receive a very warm welcome from Patrick and the staff will bend over backwards to give you everything you need for your stay.    The Riad itself was refurbished a few years ago by the owners very tastefully- the bedrooms situated around two courtyards each with a plunge pool.    The area in which the Riad is situated is perfect for a long weekend in Marrakesh - it's 15 minutes walk to the main square and is right next to the souqs and for anything else its 5 minute walk to a taxi rank.    Our group had two bedrooms on the lovely roof terrace which we had all to ourselves and where we had a very nice breakfast every morning - thanks to the guys for bringing it up so many flights of stairs to us.    There were just a few niggles. The rooms are very small and the beds not that comfy- and they all look like they could do with a bit of updating. Also we had dinner here one night - there was no red wine available the food was average and the tagine served was cold and dry.    So overall a pleasant but not perfect stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My very first trip to Marrakesh and so happy we stayed here. The riad itself was stunning with lots of character and the staff were absolutely amazing. so attentive and friendly!    We were picked up at the airport however our driver arrived late which left us a bit panicked as had no idea how to direct taxi if we needed one. The driver turned up and all was ok in the end. The raid is located through some dark lanes which we thought at first would be tricky to navigate and scary to walk through but we felt very safe and after a few trips knew the route like the back of our hands. We had the room at the bottom of the riad off the court and it was perfect for 3 people as we wanted to have our own beds due it being far too hot too share and it was a good size with a large bathroom and all the things e needed to help get ready daily. The only thing is you could hear the noise of the people speaking outside the room but this didn‚Äôt bother us as we were pretty chilled out. The rooftop was perfect fro topping up our tan and when it got too hot we laid in the shaded room on the roof top.    Breakfast was yummy. Pastries and home made yoghurt which was delicious!! I would recommend the Berber eggs which is an omelette style tagine egg with tomatoes onions and spices YUM!!!    The staff were helpful and gave us advice on where to go and directions and just made you feel at home. We would definitely go back to this riad and highly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: kenneth b wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: arrived late at night and was met and escorted down a series of dark lanes a tunnels and wondered where on earth we were on opening the door to the riad we were transported into a fantastic riad that has been totally restored by the owner patrick.  after being shown around the many leisure areas and balconies all decorated to a high standard we were taken to our room once again excellent standard with very comfortable beds and good quality bath room   breakfast is served on the balcony terrace and was extremely good  take some time to explore and listen to the history of the riad  fascinating.  my main praise is reserved for the staff  nothing was to much trouble what ever you requested was meet with a smile and yes sir it may be unfair to pick anybody but khalid dose deserve a special mention he drew us maps so as we would not get lost and advised where the loclas shopped and ate so as we good get the best deals we had a most enjoyable stay and would highly recommend this riad to other t a travellers
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: 2nd Time Around and loved every minute of it.Lush
Review_Text: This is the second time at this RiadGreat hospitality and very very friendly and courteous staff especially khalid who is always happy and blessed with great and welcoming skills. The weather was fantastic and extremely hot on the terrace and the Breakfasts were lush in the morning sun.We had one meal on the first night which was a Chicken Tagine with a nice array of Moroccan Starters.This time having done all the Cultural things we decided to have a Hammam on Monday morning which was arranged by Patrick and was amazing with full body massage and scrub @ 45 pounds and we went Quad biking on Wednesday which was amazing and very very good value for money@ 45 pound. The riad is close to the bustling square and souks. and is peaceful and tranquil on arrival...One tip (make sure you have cold beers available all the time for us greedy English)...We all loved it and we love Morocco...will it be a third time again soon I am sure. Great 4-5 day break 100% recommend it. Special thanks to Khalid and the ladies who were working in the kitchen and in the rooms.See again some time soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Mark S wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Luxury riad hidden away in the old medina. The decor is exquisite and the ambiance is calming. A great place to lose 5 bpm off your heart rate - and at a fair price. The hosts and their staff seem to have a professional comprehension of what 'luxury' actually means.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Katja A wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Riad Trois Palmiers is a beautiful riad with a very tasteful and well-chosen interior and decoration! The owners Patrick and Caroline were very welcoming and helpful and you can certainly feel their passion for their riad! We booked half-board since we were travelling with 3 kids under 3 and a pregnant friend: I am still dreaming about the breakfast today! The dinner was also wonderful every single time local food originally prepared and guaranteed no stomach bugs-very recommendable! The staff was superfriendly and polite especially our server Khalid and the kitchen staff! The location could not be better right at the edge of the busy Medina streets and only a short walk from the souks main square and attractions! I would highly recommend this riad and its 'cuisine' without any hesitation to everyone especially when travelling with children (you can even borrow the owner's stroller)!!

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: John B wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: We had a great weeks stay at this beautiful Riad. After being collected from the airport we were welcomed by the very friendly staff who gave us some mint tea and pastries before being shown around by Pat the owner. He described and showed pictures of the history of the Riad which he is rightfully very proud of.    Pat was always willing to help with very useful hand drawn maps of the medina advice on where to eat and the numerous excursions he provides. We went to the foothills of the Atlas Mountains and had a great day out. We also ate twice at the riad the food was excellent and plentiful with the price being extremely reasonable.    The most memorable thing though was the peace and quiet the Riad provided. This is really needed after a day in the medina. The sun terrace was great for sunbathing and also for breakfast and lunch in the sun. A really great stay! Thanks
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Richard L wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Title: I loved this place but hated the driver
Review_Text: I had to think about this post a few times before I actually decided to sit down to write it.    I requested a pick up as I had a very short trip and didn't want to waste time getting to the Medina. I was surprised when I presented myself to the driver and he just turned around and started walking away. I didn't need any help with my bag and would have said no but the least I expected was an offer. When we got to his taxi he started shouting with someone else (for about 15 minutes) and I obviously couldn't understand him but he was "fighting" with someone who should have cleaned the car. I didn't think this was very professional as I was just sitting there watching this. When I arrived at the Riad I was so impressed that I totally forgot this bad experience.    Patrick the owner is a GREAT host and very kindly gave me great tips and suggestions and sat patiently with me drawing a map for me to know what to do.    I decided to take the cooking lessons and Samira and Dalila where fantastic teachers and a pleasure to be with. All the staff was very kind and always helpful. I was having a fantastic experience.    But then again when I had to return to the airport the last day I was accompanied by on of the staff to the taxi and my things were placed in the car and I sat down and the driver is talking to the hotel staff. A couple of minute later he gets in the car and starts complaining to me that the ride to the airport costs at least 100 dirham (just short of 10 euros) and that the staff had just given him 60 and that I had to pay the difference. I had actually paid 15 euros in other words at least 50% more than what he wanted and therefore wasn't going to give him one cent but all I said was I had already paid at the Riad and he would have to settle that with Patrick. All upset he starts driving away and then all of a sudden stops the car in the middle of the street close to another taxi get out and talks to the other driver and comes back to the car and says "get out he is going to take you". I was really upset and if I didn't have a flight would probably have wanted to go back to the Riad to clear this mess up but I just checked with the other driver that I wasn't going to pay anything as I had already paid and he said ok and turned on the meter. I was actually shocked because when I go to the airport the meter was at 32 dirhams...    I wrote to the Riad and have waited for 5 days and received no reply and thus and making this bad review. I am sure that Patrick will change the driver so please check this if you do book the transfer. But except for that I had a fantastic experience at the Riad and strongly recommend it to all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I recently spent 5 nights at this Riad - Patrick Caroline and their staff could not have been more helpful hospitable or friendly. The hotel is in a 300 year old building right in the centre of the medina but off the beaten track. The rooms are characterful the food is good and the whole experience from start to finish was excellent. Thoroughly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A touch of calm in frantic Marrakech
Review_Text: I booked for a large group to stay for 3 nights via email with Patrick the proprietor and all my subsequent requests for information etc were replied to very quickly and efficiently. I believe all guests have an included pick-up at the airport which is necessary as otherwise you would not find this riad in the maze of small alleyways. Don't be daunted by this it is part of the character of Marrakech but I would suggest taking photos of the turns as you first arrive so that when you head out on your own you can find your way back.    When we arrived at the airport we were stuck in passport control queues for 2 hours which was miserable but fortunately our drivers waited for us. When we arrived at the riad we were greeted with mint tea and small pastries served in one of the lovely courtyard areas - a nice touch.    All of our rooms were fine some a bit larger than others. If you want to have a bit more space it is worth doing an upgrade to one of the larger rooms. Some other guests have commented about the drains - I agree a bit about this but you are in the middle of a very old part of the city and a certain amount of this sort of thing must be expected. Similarly other reviews mention the prayer calls from the mosques - we were aware of this but it wasn't something that spoiled our stay - if that sort of thing bothers you then remember your ear plugs or stay in the modern city.    Make sure that you explore the riad fully - there are little sitting areas tucked away around the riad and the roof area is wonderful all different levels and areas from which to look over the city or just sit and relax.    The staff are very nice and helpful breakfast was good and all in all we had a great stay. They do serve a limited selection of alcohol if you are that way inclined most restaurants etc in the city do not.    Thanks Patrick and all your staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: There are three main pitfalls to this Riad. The first is that there is no separation between the shower toilet and sink in the bathroom. Furthermore the drain in the bathroom was clogged and the water wouldn't drain which then overflowed into the rest of the room. Second after booking the Riad I received an email saying please pay in cash. I then responded and asked if they would take my credit card (considering I booked the reservation with the credit card) and they said that would be fine. However when I checked out they wouldn't take a credit card and I ended up having to pay cash. Given that I specifically asked if they would take a credit card I found this unreasonable and inconvienient. Lastly for the price you can find a much better Riad in the same area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A great riad and very nice staff khalid abraham and not forgetting mohammed and all the girls who all helped my wife and i to have a fabulous time the riad is full of character and so very clean it is a bit daunting when you first get there with having to go down semi dark passage ways but when you arrive at the riad it is like stepping into another world and all the staff bend over backwards to make your stay an enjoyable one you are about a 15 minute walk to the main square (WHAT AN EXPERIENCE ) enjoy yourselves
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Very enjoyable stay in a traditional Riad
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad. We stayed in the room named Khouba - great size quiet and full of character. Very attentive kind and courteous staff - drew us maps provided great restaurant recommendations and always willing to chat. Superb food both breakfast and in the evening. Would definitely recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Very underwhelming when you first arrive but the Riad is lovely (although a bit cold in the evening in February) and the staff couldn't be more attentive and friendly. Bit of a drain smell in the bathroom. Breakfast was good. Probably we would try somewhere else next time but enjoyed our stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I have to thanks again Patrick and all the people working in the Riad... They make sure you don't need anything are very helpful and so kind. The location is perfect very close to couple of restaurants street animation and shops and walking distance from the center of the Medina and souck. I love the fact that it is located in a quiet backstreet (in El Bacha) so we can enjoy the vue and a peaceful tea time on the top garden/roof of the riad. This time Marrakesh was a dream in the Trois Palmiers
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Louise A wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: Let's start by saying that this is Marrakech. Things aren't always going to go smoothly. But that being the case what you want is a Riad where the staff can't do enough to help and whose main aim is to make sure you have the best stay you can. This is what you will get here and the riad has been restored with oodles of charm and character. If you want to stay somewhere with no character and where little breakdowns or power short circuits don't happen from time to time then book a big expensive chain and have an unreal experience. Nothing is too much trouble for these guys. They will make you feel at home.    The breakfasts are plentiful and delicious. The main evening meal will feed about 3 people (rather than 1) with serveral courses and is fantastic meals served wherever you desire. But bear in mind if you do the cookery course you will likely learn how to make what you ate the night before so I suggest you choose to do one or the other to avoid eating the same thing twice.  The double room was small but for one person just perfect and I always holiday on the principle that the room is really just somewhere to sleep between explorations. That said as a single female traveller who will be up and out early exploring and tucked up in my room safe at night what is really important to me is internet in the room (which is what this riad advertises) so that I can report back home that I am safe and well and keep in touch in my own relaxed space. Sadly this is not the case here. My room was on the top floor (also very cold at this time of year so maybe ask to be lower if you are visiting off-season) and there was no internet there. So I would have to come all the way down to the lounge to use it (once in my pyjamas!) and even then it was intermittent. Given I made my booking choice partly based on knowing there is internet in the rooms I don't think this riad should be advertising that they have it as they know they don't. You may be luckier in lower rooms. On the flip side I felt so at home that I didn't really care about sitting around in my pyjamas (no I'm not a total weirdo) but you really will feel at home here and there are lots of nooks and crannies to hide away in downstairs.    The location is great. Half way between the souks to the east and the bus station to the west (10 mins walk approx each in a straight line). And Hammam de la Rose right around the corner which I shall review separately (DO IT!) as well as the bus to Essaouira.    DO get picked up from the airport as said before re finding this place initially) and DO take a compass (on your phone?) to save you walking miles in the wrong direction when you emerge from the souks with no concept of where you are. Maps won't help and you'll likely have to pay for directions which may or may not be correct. Don't expect landmarks or road signs to help you either.    All in all a lovely Riad and an interesting visit to Marrakech but I can't give 5* due to the misadvertising. If accommodation says internet in the rooms I expect that to mean ALL rooms. Otherwise I don't think you would be disappointed if you booked here. (NB if anyone makes reference to the call to prayer at 5.30 in the morning you will hear this EVERYWHERE over town even with ear plugs in and it is very atmospheric. Just make the most of the cultural experience if you can).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: James C wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: This was our second time visiting Les Trois Palmiers and our visit this time was as wonderful as it was when we first came back in 2011. The riad itself is beautiful and provides a calming environment in which to relax and really get in to holiday 'mode'. We loved lazing on the terrace in the afternoons with some mint tea alternating between cushions in the sun and shady corners.    The location of the riad is perfect for exploring the Medina being about a 15 minute walk from the main square Djema el Fna which is the hub of the action. It's equally easy to go the other way and grab a taxi if you want to go further afield or you could simply walk to the Nouvelle Ville as we did to visit some of the attractions there like the Majorelle Gardens.    The staff at the riad could not do any more to make your stay as relaxing and memorable as possible. That was our main recollection from 2011 and one of the reasons for going back again; they did not disappoint this time around. Nothing was too much trouble and there was always advice and suggestions if and when we wanted them.    This time we also took advantage of some of the excursions on offer going in to the Atlas mountains one day and doing a cookery class in the riad one morning. Both were fantastic experiences again made all the better by the friendliness of the staff as well as their flexibility to adjust plans to suit our preferences.    Patrick Caroline and all of their staff make any holiday here a wonderful experience. I would have no hesitation in recommending Les Trois Palmiers to anyone who asked.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The service in the Riat was very good. Everybody speaks English and they are very willing to help you. Everytime we came home they offered as a cup of mint tea.    The riat is very close to the center of Marrakech everything can be done by foot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This was a fantatastic experience. The staff were extremely friendly the food was excellent and it had a very unique feel. Patrick the owner was very helpful and we were right in the heart of Marrakech - a 10 minute walk to the main Place. Highly recommended and will hoepfully return in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: robyn r wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: I cannot say enough about this hotel and their staff. They were absolutely wonderful. From picking us up at the train station giving us directions to navigate the souks and organizing a day trip everyone was so nice and overly accommodating. The riad itself is gorgeous and is equivalent to a five star hotel. The pictures do not do it justice. We stayed in a rooftop room and it had a nice view of the city and plenty of lounge spaces to relax. The room and bathroom were very beautiful and clean. We also had breakfast and dinner at the hotel and both were fantastic. I have always wanted to go to Morocco and had visions of indoor pools beautiful tiles and traditional Moroccan details. This hotel has all of this with modern amenities and is just steps from the souks. We researched a lot of riads while planning for this trip and many were considerably more expensive. I honestly think this hotel is a terrific value and really does feel like a luxury hotel. If I am ever back in Morocco I will definitely be staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Patrick has developed a beautiful haven within the craziness of Marrakech. The rooms are well designed and spacious and there is a lot of room in the riad to relax including a huge roof terrace.    Easy to find after a couple of attempts it is easy to walk into the main square plus you can find taxis easily by Dar El Bacha palace.    Highly recommend a stay at this beautiful riad and Patrick and his staff are wonderful hosts thank you Patrick we hope to be back soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Sue P wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Title: Fantastic service always with a smile
Review_Text: From the original pick up from the airport by Ali their driver to the return to the airport after 3 days we couldn't fault the hospitality of this Riad. After a walk through the small alleys of Marrakech we arrived at the door of the Riad which opened to reveal a fantastic 12 room full of character right in the middle of the medina. Well decorated clean and very welcoming. Patrick the owner welcomed us and introduced us to the staff. All of them were brilliant and gave us all the assistance we needed from providing maps to help us find our way out to organising a Guide to take us round Marrakech. Breakfast and lunch on the terrace was lovely and they even explained how to cook a tangine and their breakfast pancakes. A return is a must. Thank you  Sue and Eddie.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: An absolute hidden gem- tucked away to the north of the souks- this riad is beautifully decorated-and equipped to a 5 star standard.  We only ate lunch whilst here but it was very good.  Clean beautiful affordable and very helpful staff- highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Deb K wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Our 4th trip back to this wonderful Riad and City. Patrick and his staff are so welcoming you feel like you are part of the family. Its just perfect and we discover something new everytime. Thank you for such a lovely break. Debs and Andrzej
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A 12room riad in the medina ( old town) full of charm and character. You will have to walk the last part since cars can not enter the Medina but staff will help you by picking up at airport and see you delivered to the Riad.  The Riad is a mix of old moorish style wood and carvings set in two houses connected by courtyards and terraces. Staff will serve the included breakfast wherever you want it and it includes a nice homemade youghurt as well as bread and fruit.  The rooms are nice appointed with nice towels and bedlinens the only drawback being the all sound and smell travels in the Riad.  The staff will do their outmost to make the stay comfortable they can also arrange trips in the surrounding areas.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: We couldn't have had a better experience if we had stayed at La Manounia - this place is a gem.
Review_Text: The riad is ideal for accessing all local places of interest and it's easier to find your way once the staff draw you a map. We ate in once during our 4 night stay and the food was delicious and the service excellent. The rooms were authentic and comfortable and attention to detail added to the experience - petals on the bed towels by the pool etc. The warmth and hospitality of the staff was evident throughout our stay. "This is your home" their mantra. We are a family of five with children of 14 11 and 9 and it was so nice to be comfortable and at ease without compromising on luxury and nice surrounds which trois palmiers has in bucket loads  . All in all a fabulous riad an amazing city and a must repeat experience. Hope to see you next year!

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Kelly P wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: Taking advantage of the "VIP Special" Package we were picked up by Pat at the train station. Finding the Riad would have been a bit challenging on our own. We are a family of 4. Pat took the time to tell us the history of his hotel as he showed us around which in many ways mirrors the development of modern Marrakech. Breakfast was filling fresh and left us full. We had dinner at Trois Palmiers both nights of our visit each night opening a Tajine to a delicious satisfying surprise! Staying within the Medina was perfect as we walked everywhere we wanted to go including the Majorelle Gardens. The souk and the Djema el-Fna were an easy walk both there and back. (I get confused easily) The room was perfect in size for all 4 of us (9 and 11 year old boys + Mom and Dad) as they put in an extra bed. The bathroom was luxurious and the beds were really comfortable. The boys even swam in the small plunge pool. The roof-top is remarkable for it's views and comfort. This Riad is definitely a great choice for a short stay in this interesting city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Amazing Riad in an amazing city
Review_Text: My husband and I spent 2 nights here in mid October. We stayed in Beldi the smallest room in the Riad but also the cheapest with the added benefit of being on the terrace with direct access to a very lovely relaxing area. This Riad was recommended to us by friends who stayed in February and it did not disappoint. Having stayed in Marrakesh before this Riad was by far superior the communal areas are amazing and more than made up for the small room! The mint tea is free flowing provided whenever you wish. The service is attentive and they cannot do enough to help. Patrick and Mohammed were very welcoming. The Riad is close to the souks and 20 mins walk from the main square. We recommend visiting Cafe Arabe if you need an alcoholic drink in the Medina after a stroll through the souks it is only 5 mins walk from the Riad. We hope to return to Marrakesh one day and when we do we will also be returning to the Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: If you are planning to spend some time in the uncanny city of Marrakech the right place to be -undoubtely- is the Medina where you can find this Riad a gem in the middle of the frantic pulsing of the city heart. To stay in the Riad Les Trois Palmiers is like spending some time in paradise sorrounded by Moroccan tradition charm and some touches of luxury. The elegant quiet and cozy rebuilt ambient is owned by Caroline and Patrick excellent hosts that convinced us from day one to feel like ‚Äúin our own home‚Äù. The whole staff was ready to attend our needs and we always had a tasty mint tea as a companion. An excellent breakfast in the terrace was the right way to begin each day and we thank Khaled for his impecable service respect and some useful tips on the city. We didn't have time to enjoy all the services that the Riad proposes (like massages and cooking lessons!) but I will keep those in my to do list ready for my next trip to this unforgettable city and of course my second stay in paradise.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Dan J wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: We had a fantastic week in the Riad. The place was so peaceful laid back with fantastic service lovely big air conditioned rooms and a great sun terrace that you would not have known the chaotic city was so close. We'd also thoroughly recommend the food the best 3 meals we had in Marrakech were in the Riad.    Thanks again to Pat Ibrahim Mohammed and all the team for a great week.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Don't be nervous as you wind your way to this incredible riad. Although it might seem a bit disorienting at first Les Trois Palmiers is actually very centrally located in the medina of Marrakech and accessible to other parts of town. Upon entering the riad we were amazed by the beauty and the detail of the hotel which was only surpassed by the friendliness of the staff and the amazing hospitality of Patrick and Caroline. Rooms are beautifully decorated with comfortable beds and nice amenities. If you're in Marrakech for a few nights make sure to have a traditional home-cooked dinner by Fatima. Overall we highly recommend this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Lorna M wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: We could not have had a better experience for a first time visit to this beautiful city. This Riad is so beautiful and simply decorated you could sit there and just relax all day. The room was very comfortable the food good and the staff couldn't have been nicer and accommodating. From the pickup at the airport by Mohammed to finally leaving after 4days we were welcomed Moroccan style by the entire staff.  The location is perfect and there is nothing negative to be said about this place.  Perfect vacation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This gorgeous riad is in the medina and in a great location for exploring the city. The lovingly restored twin riad is perfect for a few days escape. We stayed for three nights and had a warm welcome from Patrick and his staff. The food was lovely the room comfortable and interesting and we very much enjoyed the terraces and outdoor space.    We had some terrible weather with heavy rain but even this did not manage to spoil our stay! We even got our bearings and learned how to navigate from the riad through the maze of passages in the souk. Perfect!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Nice stay on Morocco and very nice stay on this Riad.  A big greeting to all staff's crewthey have solved all the problems i met.  i have booked on another Riad but the owner is the sameand my fantastic journey is beginned with the discovery that this Riad was(still?) closed for an upgradethanks to this i have travelled with Youssef and his motorbike on the Medina and i have immediatly enjoied the atmosphere of Marrakesh.  if one day i will return on Morocco i will visit you againit's a promise.  Paolo  Italy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Paul B wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: We needed an overnight in Marrakech and selected this riad on recommendation from people in Essaouria where we were going the next day. The riad set up a taxi from the airport to the hotel which is a must because like most riads it is inside a souk; you cannot drive up in front. Instead we were met at an entrance to the souk and guided to the riad. Do not use riads if you have a lot of luggage because you are likely to have to haul it yourself.  The riad is isolated in an alleyway and very quiet. It is well decorated and contains several comfortable sitting areas which are essential because rooms are typically small. The room we had is tiny; the double bed just fit into the space. Neverthelesswe were comfortable and it worked for us. However I am not sure I would want several days in a room in which the suitcases took up most of the room.  You could also have a problem if you don't speak or understand French. I had communicated with people in English but no one was present at the riad who spoke it. However my wife is fluent so we managed well.  People are very nice and accommodating. Food is simple but excellent. Getting from the riad to the medina takes time; it would be easy to get turned around. We were given a hand drawn map. The worse part about Marrakech is if you look out of place someone with an agenda will try to pick you up and guide you. People are nice but typically they want money. They are difficult to shake so important either to accept and negotiate terms or be firm that you don't want help.  Finally the credit card machine did not work or the manager did not know how to use it. Have euros or dirhams.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed at Les trois Palmiers for 5 nights in early April. Patrick is a wonderful host (unfortunately didn‚Äôt get to meet Caroline). He had arranged for Ali to pick us up from the airport (which was a great help). Roads are busy and worse within the medina. The Riad is accessed through a maze of small alleyways but once Patrick gives you his hand drawn map there should be no problem. Staff are excellent very helpful. It‚Äôs just a perfect place to relax. The Riad was originally two houses and now has 12 bedrooms. We stayed in Idrisside right on the terrace smallish room but extremely tastefully done. Electric sockets are two round pin Schuko. There is free wi-fi but it does not reach the terrace. Breakfast is served in the terrace and is ample. The Riad does provide dinner to if you have booked with them. Money can be exchanged in the Riad or just outside at the local currency shop. The rates were excellent.  If taking a room on the top floor be prepared for the early morning call to prayers (sound like a million megaphones going off at the same time) one gets used to it after a while. Ear plugs are a must. We will definitely go back to LTP. April is a good month as the sun is not too hot and the rains have just finished. great restaurants near by.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: David M wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: Spent four nights in this beautiful riad with staff who could not have been more welcoming to us and children aged 10 and 7. Super oasis in the bustle of Marrakech. Great breakfasts - nothing was too much trouble. Kids enjoyed the pool and did not want to leave. Booking was easy - I e-mailed Patrick and all sorted very quickly. David Gosport UK
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Amazing retreat in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: A beautiful riad run by a lovely couple who have resurrected this riad from ruin. Friendly helpful staff made our holiday very special. Gorgeous decor lovely food. I would highly recommend their cookery course to learn how to make an amazing tagine!    I will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Excellent retreat in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in May 2013 and much like the rest of the reviews we were a bit overawed with the activity of the old city and the labyrinth of lanes and alleyways to get to the Riad. Do yourself a favour and arrange an airport pickup with the Riad. Entry into the Riad is like entering another world with luxurious surrounds waterfalls pools and comfortable lounges etc.  The staff are fantastic and very welcoming the driver Mohamed is particularly helpful and knowledgable and nothing is too much trouble. Eg. One staff member walked us out to the nearest main street(?) "Dar El Bacha" (about 150m) through the alleys and pointed out all the landmarks we would need to find our way back. Turns out it only looks confusing until you know what to look for.  We arrived late in the afternoon and had pre arranged dinner at the Riad to save the hassle of finding somewhere at short notice. Glad we did the food was local themed and excellent with tagine and several other courses. The nearby restaurants are also extremely good.  We were initially worried about walking after dark in the area but felt safe throughout our stay.  In summary an excellent place to stay with good facilities and great staff within a very short walk to the stalls and markets of the medina and about 10 minutes walk from Jamaa el Fna
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Joanna K wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: Happy days at the Riad Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: What a super home from home this riad is. The family who run it and their staff are delightful and attentive without being intrusive and the ambiance is that of tranquility and relaxation in the heart of Marrakech's bustling medina. It's beautifully decorated and restored by a couple who clearly love it and wish for their guests to be happy and comfortable.    I am already missing my mornings on the roof welcoming the sunshine and catching a chorus of muezzins from the surrounding mosques while enjoying a delicious breakfast and my afternoon Moroccan mint tea with a side order of French/English/Arabic banter. Definitely a place to recommend wholeheartedly and to return to again and again...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Louis C wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: This is a fabulous Riad! I was very lucky to be upgrade here and was given a beautiful room. When we were picked up from the train station and were going down all these very creepy alleys I thought Oh Dear but on entering it was like an Oasis! very tasteful and welcoming. We were given directions on how to negotiate the souk and got hopelessly lost but hey that's half the fun of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Lex B wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: everything about this place is excellent - it is a haven in the craziness of the old town of Marrakech. Our family of five stayed here for three nights and everyone loved it. Beautiful rooftop terraces for breakfast or evening drinks charming pools inside to cool down in great personal service and rooms with character. Would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Do yourself a big favor and just book your reservation to this riad right now! My husband and I just had a six night visit at this riad and we were so happy with everything about it. Yes it is down a long and winding alley but this is Marrakech after all! From the moment you enter you are made to feel welcome and at home. This open courtyard with the three palms the well trained and very friendly staff the beautiful furniture and stained glass windows and iron work and pools....and the relaxing and breezy and cool rooftop patio this is a place that is an oasis after navigating the souks and squares of Marrakech! Patrick and Caroline want you to feel at home...and do a wonderful job of attaining that goal. They will also set up day trips for you that are reasonably priced and adventurous and you will be driven by their friendly guides. So let Ibraham pour some hot mint tea for you....try out your ( at least in my case) rusty French... and Arabic and Berber....listen to the quiet from the roof and the water trickling in the pools in the courtyard and you will feel like you could stay here for a thousand and one nights!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Will stay at another place next time
Review_Text: I think this place gets good reviews because compared to its surroundings it is definitely a haven. When one walks in one is charmed by the decor the owner Patrick everything is so clean and fresh compared to the donkey poo small alleyways dust rubbish and loose pavements to get there.    My family did a short stay in March. The service by the staff is faultless. The breakfast inc is good though you will only get carbs and no protein. 2/3 beds were comfortable though the third bed was missing planks in the middle which meant the mattress sagged. The bathroom had an awful sewer smell coming from it the entire time. To top this all off you do not get a key or code to enter. Once you finally negotiate your way to the Riad you have to knock on the door or press the bell to be let in. You could be standing there for 10 minutes or more and this is what happened for many guests at 12-1am when I was trying to sleep.    Knock knock ding-dong ding-dong knock knock. If that's not enough local kids hang around the Main Street to help show you to the Riad if you are lost and then ask you for money afterwards. In fact I was harassed by the kids for 2 days about it.    It's a lovely Riad compared to where it is but probably not compared to other Riads and hotels you could choose from.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A very beautiful Riad only a few minutes walk from Djemaa el Fna. Since it is off a main street through some narrow labyrinthine streets it is a great place to escape the bustle and noise of the medina. The staff is very friendly and the food (both breakfast and if you want dinner) was great. We booked a very reasonably-priced excursion through this raid to the Ourika Valley and it was one of the highlights of our trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: J C wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: An absolutely perfect place to stay and immerse yourself in the true Marrakech. Service was first class from booking to being driven to the airport on departure. All the staff are very friendly and take a genuine interest in your comfort. Nothing is too much trouble from breakfast on the beautiful rooftop terrace to cool drinks delivered to whatever comfortable spot you have found to relax. Never experienced such attention to detail and service from an owner who obviously cares about how his guests are looked after and this passion naturally rubs off on his staff.  Ideal oasis of peace and tranquility from which to launch yourself into the hustle and bustle of the city. Would recommend being collected from the airport by the riads own driver to ensure you don't get stung by airport taxis and also to ensure you can find the hotel (all riads are tucked away in the old part of the city and need reliable local knowledge to find them).  Would recommend this riad without hesitation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Recently stayed here with my girlfriend for 4 nights. The Riad is fantastic service is first class and the food is brilliant! The staff are super friendly and you are collected from the airport by one of the Riad's drivers.    Booked a trip each day prior to arrival which was all organised by the owner and each trip was perfect. We have taken away fantastic memories and would recommend to anyone!

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Luxurious, friendly, quiet riad - an oasis of calm amongst the madness
Review_Text: Stayed in this riad for 5 nights in April. We had one of the best holidays ever made very special by the trip we booked through Patrick the owner before we went out to Marrakech. The owners Patrick and Caroline his wife are very welcoming and will do all they can to make your stay comfortable. All the staff are very friendly and so helpful and attentive without being over the top. Rooms were clean and comfortable tidied and refreshed with towels and essentials every day. We stayed in one on the terrace and were initially kept awake with the wind blowing the plastic cover for the courtyard. However once the wind dropped we were pleasantly surprised by how peaceful it was. The covers are taken off mid April once the threat of serious rain has gone. The breakfasts were lovely with freshly squeezed orange juice yoghurt (so creamy) eggs (if wanted) pastries coffee tea bread and jams and honey as well as fresh fruit every day. Every morning fresh covers were put on the sun loungers as well as straw hats for the guests use and the umberellas were erected for us. Room/terrace service was available all day and the final bill was very reasonable considering how many coffees teas and beers we had ordered and they all came with little treats! We were so glad we had arranged the 3 day trip to the desert prior to travelling out there. It was such fun seeing the beautiful dramatic country with Ali our driver who was a complete star. The camel riding is a bit hard on the rear but well worth it for the experience of getting into the sand dunes to stay in a bedouin tent. The hotel we stayed at during the trip was great as well and we were impressed by how smoothly it all went. No hitches no delays and it felt like a total Moroccan experience. We were picked up and dropped off from the airport with no problems. The only difficulty is finding the riad on first night on your own when everything looks different and the alleys all look the same! Get Patrick or one of the staff to draw a map and look for signs for riad daliah to get back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: David Ruddock wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: Our second trip to Marrakech and first stay in Riad Les Trois Palmiers. The ambience in this little oasis is terrific: from the cool tranquil interior spaces to the rooftop terrace with it‚Äôs shady niches the whole place is beautifully appointed imparting a feeling of exotic luxury. However I have always found that the most critical ingredients in any travel experience are the people you meet: Patrick & Caroline clearly understand the needs of their clients to relax eat & drink well feel secure and that their Marrakech experience lives up to expectation. They and their staff work hard to make sure you don‚Äôt have to.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Mike B wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: I keep meaning to write a review about this Riyad. My brother and I stayed here just over a year ago and were completely impressed by the service we received. We are Canadian and it was our first experience in Marrakech. Once you get through the winding roadways and into the Riyad it's like a whole other world - stunning sanctuary. Wonderful hosts great food lovely ambience and within a walk to everything in the old city. Also did the ATV excursion which the folks at the Riyad helped us organize as well. Can't say anything bad about this place at all. Again if it's your first time to Marrakech just keep in mind that there are some winding narrow passageways to get to the Riyad but this is the case with anything in the old city and it felt safe once you understood that (try to arrive in day light so you don't freak yourself out though!) Plus they have a driver from the airport to get you acquainted.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Our first trip to Marrakesh and after reading reviews on tripadvisor we booked a week's stay at Les Trois Palmiers. Was definitely a good choice. The riad also have a (free) driver service that picks you up from (as well as return to) the airport which is always a nice bonus. The garden roof terrace is absolutely gorgeous with a spectaular 360 view and it is where we had our breakie each morning.    Patrick (the owner) is tres helpful and is a useful knowledge source to tap into for any queries you might have. He also gave us a free upgrade for the last two days of our stay. Can't be bothered to write anymore about how cool and relaxing this riad is. BOOK NOW before you lose the room you wanted!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Alasdair D wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: The riad is a lovely peaceful haven from the wildness of Marrakech - warm and friendly staff and charismatic owner in the wings. Saadian and Pasha rooms both lovely bathroom especially nice in the former. Delicious dinners with particularly nice vegetable dishes a woman's touch in the kitchen. Only thing would change is some other way of keeping out the rain without a plastic hood over the beautiful courtyards ?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We have just returned for a 4 nights stay at this Riad we were a bit apprehensive as we travelled with two kids but the owner Patrick was very assuring over the phone when I made the booking and the driver Ali was there to pick us up and once we got to the Road it was beautiful and the staff especially Khaleed and Ibrahim were very hospitable and attentive we will definitely return to stay at this Riad for the full morocco hospitality !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Chris Seaward wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: The Souks of Marrakech are full on hustle bustle and barter and the Riad Les Trois Palmiers is a few minutes walk from the heart of the action. Yet is hidden away as a beautiful escape from the noise of the day and offers all you need from a boutique hotel. Patrick the owner and all the staff are very friendly helpful and attentive but give you the space and run of the hotel so you feel relaxed and at home from the moment you arrive. You can relax with a book in one of the many sofa nooks or up on the roof terrace and be served English Tea in silver pots whenever your in the mood. Patrick provides great advice on where to go and what to do and provides hand drawn maps to navigate the Medina.. You will get lost but that is all part of the charm of wandering around Marrakech. Full of fascinating sights and smells on every corner.. And when you tire you are only a few minutes away from the peace and tranquility of your hotel... Perfect !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: "Riad Les Trois Palmiers" is everything it promises to be. You feel relaxed and on holiday from the Mint Tea welcome through to the fond farewell from Patrick and all the staff.    We stayed for three nights for with our adult children and some of our extended family stayed longer.    The riad is well appointed with a great ambience and comfortable spacious clean rooms. The staff are very friendly and helpful and the food is delicous in a true Moroccan style. The riad is superbly located for sightseeing and easy walking distance to most of the Medina's main sights and with Patrick's directions we didn't get lost once!    Patrick went out of his way to help organise tours and activities for us both in and out of Marrakech and also assisted us with our travel to Fes. Local knowledge is essential in Morocco and he certainly had plenty of this and gave freely of his advice.    Without a doubt staying at this Riad made our trip to Marrakech and set us up well for our Moroccon adventures. We would have no hesitation in recommending it to any other travellers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We had such a great visit to Les Trois Palmiers. We were a group ranging in age from five to seventy-one and all of us had a great experience staying at this beautiful riad for four nights.    Patrick and Caroline have created a wonderful calm and welcoming space and provide a friendly and polished service. Generous with their time and information tirelessly providing maps and helping us with trips tips guides and travel plans they were perfect hosts. Perfectly positioned within the medina walls this is a relaxed and stylish riad with plenty of places to sit and chill out from the inner courtyards to the roof terrace it certainly ticked all of our boxes!    We had two rooms on the first floor they were clean spacious and comfortable. The bathrooms had walk in showers lots of towels robes toiletries and plenty of piping hot water. The food was great - amazing breakfasts with fresh fruit freshly baked bread and the most delicious home made yoghurt. We also ate dinner here. (twice the first one was so good we wanted to do it again!) We had a candle lit rose petal strewn table and thoroughly enjoyed incredible morrocan salads fabulous cous cous tender chicken fragrant strawberries and yummy pastries as well as copious amounts of mint tea.    There are so many great things to say about this place but the outstanding factor that made our trip so memorable were the staff at Les Trois Palmiers. Caroline and Patrick have put together the dream team! From Ali the charming and informative gentleman who met us at the airport the friendly and lovely ladies who cooked cleaned and cared for us to Khaled and Ibraheim who made us so welcome. Nothing was too much trouble they looked after us with such kindness and grace.    We can't wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Sally B wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: What a lovely Riad beautifully restored by Patrick and his wife. We stayed for five nights the Riad is in a great position for visiting the sights yet so quiet once inside. When Ali the driver first took us there we wondered where we were going until we arrived at this 'oasis'. The staff are truly wonderful and it was so lovely to hear them laughing whilst working and nothing seemed too much trouble! We really thank them for being so friendly and helpful. The terrace provides lovely views across Marrakech to the Atlas Mountains: what a lovely place to sit and chill after a hard day wandering around the souks. One thing not to be missed in Marrakech is a hammam and massage. Patrick arranged one for me and it was a couple of hours of sheer relaxation. We would like to thank Patrick and his wife for the lovely Riad but equally we thank the staff including Ali Ibrahim and all the other lovely people who really made our stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: John F wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: Our 7 day bed and breakfast adventure in Marrakech started as seamlessly and as efficiently as possible. Ali met us at the airport and whisked us to "Riad Les Trois Palmiers" giving an introduction to the city and Medina as good as any guide. The short walk through confusing narrow alleyways to the Riad gave us a taste of what was to come in navigating the souks and markets. Through a heavy door embellished with three brass palmswe emerged to a delight of a riad filled with the charm and authenticity Morocco is famed foryet the tranquility and comfort craved for at the end of the hectic days to come. Caroline and Patrick were the most gracious of hosts and together with attentive staff spared no effort to ensure that our every need was met They insisted that we treat the Riad as our home and it certainly felt comfortable to do so. Our room was comfortable and spacious with a bathroom complete with walk-in shower. Breakfast which can be taken in the calm of the inside courtyard or on the roof terraceenjoying expansive views over the Medina is a super continental feast that sets you up for each day of adventure and exploration. Riad Les Trois Palmiers is ideally placed for reaching all the attractions of Marrakech and with Patrick's hand written guide and street map you will soon navigate like a native. I will not bore you with details you can get from dozens of travel books but the highly recommended 'Cafe Arabe' and 'Souk Kafe' are both within a couple of hundred metres of "Les Trois" If and when I return to Marrakesh this Riad will be No 1 on the list.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: lesleyashfield a wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: we were collected promptly from the airport by Mohammed having arrived late at night in the dark after a day of torrential rain - not the best first impression. The driver dropped us as close to the hotel as the Medina would allow where another member of staff collected us and guided us on foot to the Riad. Quite an assault on the senses avoiding bicycles mopeds and pedestrians we were taken a short walk along the street then turned into a narrow low roofed passage stopping at the corner shop to pick up fresh bread for our evening meal. We were then lead down what seemed to be a maze of dark busy and narrow passages until we turned right into a very dark passage and were confronted with a big oak door. I felt very nervous by now not knowing what to expect. The door was opened the curtain drawn back and we arrived in an oasis of tranquility quiet but excellent service and beautiful surroundings. FABULOUS
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A Little Gem of a Riad
Review_Text: Firstly thank you Patrick and your team for making our stay very comfortable.    We were taken care of from the moment we arrived at the airport and back again. Nothing was too much trouble. The room was beautiful in pale green and everything fresh and turned down.    There was mint tea pastries fresh fruit and water ready and waiting. Breakfast was plenty tasty and alwasys served promptly. dinner was also good.    Patrick is a charismatic and dedicated man to the Riad and all his team are as such. We are looking forwards to staying with you again merci    Manda and Paul

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My husband and I have just returned from a weeks stay in Riad Les Trois Palmiers and we had and absolutely wonderful time. The Riad itself is tucked away down what can only be described as a 'backstreet' and to be honest you wonder where you are being taken when you first arrive as it doesn't seem possible that such a beautiful spacious place can be hidden behind the walls. We arrived quite late on a Tuesday night and were shown to our room and then sat down to a lovely first night meal which we had pre booked and I'm glad we had a going out into the Medina for the first time in the dark would have been quite daunting. I would definitely recommend a first night meal there anyway until you get your bearings.  The following morning we were greeted by Patrick who really is a great host and he drew us a map of how to get to the square and gave us a few pointers on what to look out for. Before we left for Marrakech I'd read many reviews good and bad and really wasn't sure what to expect and was more than a little apprehensive but I found the city colourful completely atmospheric and very friendly in the main. Yes you get people shouting at you to come and look at there stalls or eat their food or drink their orange but a big smile and La Shukran ( no thank you in Arabic) usually has them smiling back at you and being asked "maybe next time?" Or you accept their offer and see what they can offer you and in the shops you'll more often than not get offered some wonderful mint tea. And I usually ended up buying something! But this was out of choice if you don't want to buy move on....you are under no obligation. Two warnings I have are about the Henna ladies and the so called guides... The henna ladies grab you a lot and try to start drawing on you. A firm La Shukran seems to work better than speaking in English or French. And in the streets out of the square you will get lots of men start talking to you and then start taking you to either the tanneries or back to the square and then want paying for it....steer clear if you can they just want your money. We got totally lost looking for the museum and decided to use a guide who then took us to the wrong museum and it was actually shut (which he knew because the Berber market was on) and then took our money and ran. A lovely man then helped us and found someone to take us who didn't want a penny just a chat along the way.  The little things you must do! Drink the orange juice and mint tea eat in the square at night even if its only once. We looked for a stall with local people and found one along the edge (even though we'd been told to eat in the middle) and the food was great and try one of the egg sandwiches you see being made on the street the bread is wonderful and who knew that a little sprinkle of cumin on egg could taste so good!  There are a few trips you can take organised by Patrick and the day trip to the Ourika Valley and Atlas Mountains is a must. You stop to see how Argan oil is made and can buy some from a reputable source as most of the oil in the square and souks is apparently fake. You the take a trek in the mountains to see the waterfalls but be warned this is more than just a nice amble up the mountain. If you are unfit like I am (!) or infirm in any way you will struggle. It is hard work going up and down but worth it in the end. You then go to a Saffron farm where again it is safe to buy as the market has a much lower quality.  Back to the Riad the staff are brilliant and Halid looked after us particularly well. Always running up and down the stairs to the Terrace to see if we needed anything. We ate there 4 nights out of the 7 and each meal was lovely although we had a lot of orange salad for pudding....nice but repetitive. The Riad also has a small but nice selection of wines and spirits for those of you wondering if you will be able to get an alcoholic drink. Mint tea flows and is lovely and complimentary. We stayed in the Bahia room which although small was spotlessly clean and came with a private terrace so almost like another room. We ate breakfast on it and in the afternoon it caught the sun so perfect for chilling and reading or catching a few rays. It was hot in Feb when the sun came out though so I don't think I could sit there in the summer.  All in all we had a fantastic time and will be returning and won't even consider staying anywhere else. Thank you Patrick and all you staff for making our stay in Marrakech so great!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Linda H wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: The riad is beautiful but don't book Beldi - the room is very dark and cramped with a rather murky wet room. Other rooms are certainly much better. The service was excellent as the staff could not have been more helpful. Evening meals were a little repetitive so I would eat out to sample a wider range. The trip to the Ourika Valley was a must: stunning scenery and a great walk/clamber up to the waterfalls. If you go to Essaouira by bus make sure you book a return ticket in advance. The lady in the Supratours office wasn't the most helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Laura A wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: We are so glad we chose this beautiful Riad for our four-night stay and first visit to Marrakech. Just getting there was an adventure. We received a complimentary pickup from the airport and were met in a laneway by a friendly staff member. He then led us through a series of narrow winding laneways pointing out little features here and there so we'd remember our way next time (turn at the laughing cow sign left at the potplant etc). Around one corner was a tethered donkey around another zoomed a local on a motorbike offering a friendly smile. I felt like I had entered a Moroccan version of Alice in Wonderland. We arrived in a dim dusty lane knocked at a low heavy door and entered what truly was a wonderland. Gentle light filters into an inner courtyard chill-out music mingles with the trickle of water into the plunge pool and luxurious Moroccan decor provides an instant sense of peace and relaxation.We enjoyed a delicious dinner under the watchful eye of a resident cat and breakfast each morning consisted of delights such as homemade yoghurt warm flat bread freshly squeezed juice etc. Complimentary mint tea served in silverware is available at any time during the stay. The rooms are charming spotlessly clean quiet and private. We couldn't believe how lovely it all was especially considering the reasonable price. It's in sharp contrast to the dusty hot noisy chaotic atmosphere of the souk and the main square which is a short stroll away (maybe 10 minutes) but contrasts are part of the city's beauty.
