From the sweet and salty elements in the food to the simultaneous warmth and cunning of the market vendors and the calm of riads and day spas that takes over the moment you step off the street. Go with an open mind conservative clothes and a cautious eye and you'll appreciate the city for the fascinating marvel that it is.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: The best place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: We recently enjoyed a fabulous 3 night stay at Riad Les Trois Palmiers. It truly is a magical oasis in a fabulous location ‚Äì with all the comforts one could wish for and close to the hustle and bustle of the main attractions of the medina. The Riad is spacious with two large courtyards and a beautiful roof terrace with a fantastic view of the city. There is more than enough room for all the guests to relax! The wonderful friendly and helpful staff went out of their way to make sure we felt at home and nothing was too much trouble for them. Delicious fresh food and drinks are available to guests at any time. We would encourage anyone visiting this vibrant and colourful city to explore it from the Riad Les Trois Palmiers. We wish the owner Patrick and his team all the very best!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Huge  double riad in the medina. Clean very helpful staff. Every need attended to with a smile. Was cold at time of visit but staff attentive and provided heating promptly. Wifi a little intermittent which was frustrating at times. Food well presented and delicious. Within easy tho confusing at first-distance of Jamaa al Fna. Beds clean and comfy bathrooms roomy showers hot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Suzy B wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Title: A True Hide-a-way RIAD in the Medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: Jan.1-9 2013 my husband and I escaped the world at the Riad Trois Palmiers in the impenetrable old residental area of the Medina. We knew from Google Maps where we were supposed to be but it was a good thing to be met by the staff both at the airport and at the street end to be guided in through mysterious passages to the door of the Riad.  Much of the passage was covered how would we ever have found this place?  No matter by the next day we were experts.  Already an adventure to find the Riad itself was perfect warm and welcoming and beautifully restored and decorated by Patrick and Caroline our hosts. Our room the "Alaouite" room was exactly as pictured in the website but better. Heavy wooden doors and window frames with coloured glass panels opened onto the courtyard below.Totally charming and private. Great bed bathroom too exotic to believe we felt like VIPs. And that is the standard of the Riad; the best chef the wonderful staff who treat you like long lost family. We loved it. Forget going out to dinner or breakfast bring lots of books or read the books in the library nothing is lacking here.  The wines of Morocco are served in the Riad and in most restaurants that serve alcohol. We enjoyed the white and Rose wines and Patrick can suggest good choices. Patrick is the go-to person for advice on excursions out of Marrakech. With a comfortable SUV and driver Ali we made several trips one to the Atlas Mountains with a mule ride up the inacessible to a hilltop Berber village and a brilliant lunch in the sunshine overlooking valleys on two sides with snow a few hundred feet away. This is a must ask Patrick to arrange it for you. In fact ask Patrick what he suggests for places to visit in Marrakech. He always visits every suggestion made by guests to check out the venue for himself and his taste is impeccable. This also goes for places to eat although on review the Riads's chef was the best.  The location is ideal within the Medina and near the Souks and most historical must-see sites.  We walked everywhere and enjoyed exploring the city at a leisurely pace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Valdecy C wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: The best thing in Marrakech was the staying in this Riad. Clean good services and friendly warm staffs and owner I really recommend this Riad to stay in Marrakech..the staff are helpful. The first thing  you must ask for advice to start you journey there and they promptly give. Don't forget because it is so important.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Jennifer M wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: I went to this Riad following my sister's advice and have not regretted it! I spent a few days with my friends there and I must say we were so happy about the way we were treated. We had a really relaxing and nice time at the riad "Les 3 palmiers" the staff was lovely and made us feel like we were part of a big family. On the plus side they even picked us up at the airport explained to us the rules of the city and most importantly they were very understanding about our late hours‚Ä¶.  Many thanks for all your good advice and good job for your beautiful riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: The only way to see the real Marrakech
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at the end of December for a 9 night stay. We stayed in 2 different rooms during out trip and both were excellent I especially loved the traditionally tiled bathrooms one with amazing sunken bath. Like most of the other reviews here we also found the Riad to be a welcome haven from the madness and intensity of the Medina but with literally so much to see and do on your doorstep you do have to force yourself to slow down and relax inside.  We took several days to do just that and after a stroll around the Medina in the morning we came back to the Riad and spent the afternoon and a good part of the evening sitting on the roof terrace reading relaxing and drinking the excellent mint tea.  Breakfast was included in our package and we were able to take it on the roof terrace most mornings in the sun before heading out for the day.  We also had a tasting menu dinner the first night that we arrived and this was excellent and a really good idea to do on your first night there after a flight as it can be stressful enough trying to find your way around for the first day or two.  The staff in the Riad are the main highlight however the owner Patrick was a superb host and spent time with us sorting out restaurants and things to do to make our holiday perfect. The other staff are also so helpful and genuinely nothing seems to be too much trouble. Every evening we were greeted back at the Riad by Ibrihim and he always had a laugh and joke with us and was truly a delight to deal with he is a credit to the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Dave L wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: I would echo most other reviews. It is a beautiful home it the middle of a bustling town. As old American men we were forever saying no to the pushy shop owners in the Medina. So it was nice to get back to the quiet Riad.    Traveling with two friends it was a challenge to find rooms with three beds but the Almoravid room had 3 singles and while it was on the small side the entire three story Riad was common ground with couches small swimming pools tables and chairs ect.    The service was very good (it helps if you can speak some french) Patrick saved us by checking our departing flight and noticing it left an hour earlier than we thought. He then got us a driver (Ali-very nice fellow) who got us to the airport just in time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Wecome refuge from the intensity of the Medina!
Review_Text: Our family of 5 had a wonderful 6-night stay at the end of December. The staff was excellent and let us know that we were part of their family! The location was excellent and a welcome refuge from the intensity of the Marrakech Medina. Breakfast was included with our 2 rooms which included wonderful homemade yogurt fresh fruit and great bread and pastries. Eggs were served upon request. We enjoyed one dinner at the Riad which was ordered the day before; it was the best meal we had while in Morocco although it was also the most expensive. Thanks to owners Caroline and Patrick for a wonderful experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Safiya M wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: After working your way through the bustling Medina passing through dark alleyways you arrive at this tranquil Oasis so far from the Madding Crowd. From the time we arrived until we left 4 nights later we were treated like Royalty. The staff from Ali who picked us up at the airport to Khaled who was always on hand ready to please to Mohamed and Ebrahim who accompanied us to the Atlas and not forgetting the lovely ladiesto many to mention by name who always greeted us with a friendly smile and an eagerness to help in any way. We stayed in the Saadienne Suite which is huge and beautifully decoratedwith a very comfortable King bed and a bathroom with a shower and bath that was surreal. Breakfast was good and sufficient. This was the first time we stayed in a Riad and we were apprehensive but our fears were unfounded as it was memorable to say the least. We loved everything about it and highly recommend it. Will definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Fantastic, excellent and truly beautiful Riad
Review_Text: We decided to visit Marrakech for New Year for four days. We found the Riad on Tripadvisor - reading many five star reviews - and decided to book.    The level of service from Riad Les Trois Palmiers was exemplary; from its owner to its staff we were treated like king and queen. We were picked up from the airport given a history of the Riad and also taught (from the staff) how to make the famous Moroccan mint tea.    Patrick (the Riad's owner) is very welcoming very chatty and is always around to help and give advice from simple bargaining tips in the Souks to the best place for a memorable Hammam. The staff are very friendly and did their upmost to help in any way they could. We were told to treat the Riad as our home.    We stayed in the Saadiene suite which was beautiful. A huge bed decorated with rose petals on arrival. A comfy chaiselongue to put your feet up and relax and a very luxurious bathroom with his and hers sinks made with beautiful intricate mosaic and a huge shower area.    The food was amazing. We enjoyed breakfast on the terrace with freshly squeezed orange juice various breads yoghurts and eggs. We decided to stay in for two nights and had the set menu. three starters a tagine main course and dessert.... we rolled to bed on those evenings feeling very full!    I have been to Marrakech a couple of times before and different every time. If I were to go back again I would most definitely stay at Riad Les Trois Palmiers.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Excellent level of service - but need more staff at breakfast time
Review_Text: We were glad that we had read the reviews and arranged to be met at the airport as it would have been impossible to find at night. The staff are wonderful and were so ready to please. However I felt that they were some what stretched particularly at breakfast - this was not a problem if you did not have an activity planned and were happy to sit in the sun on the terrace.  A clean and convenient Riad. If you do not intend to visit places outside of the city I would suggest that 3 to 4 nights is enough based in Marrakech for an interesting cultural city break and a little winter sun!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Marrakech was such an eye opener for us. We arrived late evening not knowing where we were going. Greeted by the taxi driver we exchanged our currency as advised and followed him to the car park "my car is here" we walked amidst a fold of of Mercs then to the fiat oh heck! No need to worry. We had a journey with commentary to the riad and felt looked after then our first journey from the car down the alley to our accommodation we became quite apprehensive. No need to worry behind the door in the wall lay an amazing labyrinth of the riad. Moushine was an absolute star he made us feel like royalty nothing was too much trouble not only on our first night but every night. The meal waiting for us was excellent we wish we had been more hungry to appreciate it. Breakfast each morning was truly overwhelming (sorry ladies we could not eat it all).    Aidan is another star great guy. He led us through the streets of the medina towards the square giving us tips en route and pointing out places to eat etc. We felt well prepared to face the hustle and bustle on our own armed with our map with all the 'good things' to look out for marked clearly. The accommodation is superb a real home from home so relaxing. Everything we could need was provided including travel adapters - never known that to happen before brilliant idea!    Although escaping from Christmas in UK there was enough recognition that it was the festive season without being overpowering - a Christmas tree and minimal decorations. Christmas dinner for us was a 'take away' and champagne on the roof terrace. How different is that. But the best bit was when presented with champagne on ice mince pies and nibbles as we came out of our room in the evening. Wonderful. Thank you.    The riad made our stay in Morroco it exceeded our expectations.    We will definitely recommend the riad to friends and colleagues and would not stop anywhere else if we return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Despite the difficulty finding the place (we made a last minute booking and didn't arrange airport pickup or even look at the map before getting to the airport - losers) once we found it we couldn't fault it.    The intensive orientation course upon arrival was definitely needed (especially if you plan on wandering the souks and streets after dark - which is quite early in December) but the location is great for exploring!    Both Patrick (the owner) and the staff were incredibly helpful and friendly - we only wish we could stay longer!    Definitely worth a visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Great service and very beautiful place in the center of old Marrakech
Review_Text: We enjoyed our time in Les Trois Palmiers! It is situated in the very center of old Marrakech and it is a haven of peace in the sometimes noisy and crowded city.    The riad is an old house from the 19th century and fully renovated - very beautiful as you can see in the pictures. The owner Patrick is very friendly with a local team evenly friendly. The riad has a roof terrace where you can enjoy the delicious breakfast served (local delicacies).    Marrakech can be stressful sometimes but thanks to this place we got the rest needed in our holiday!

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Great Place to stay and experience Marrakesh!
Review_Text: This Riad is an amazing place with great customer service by the stuff Mohammed and Ibrahim as well as the ladies of the house under the direction of Patrick the owner who is totally devoted to the clients' customer service.  Location is great although hard to find at first an experience that seem to repeat itself all over the Madinas of this country.....Ask to be picked up and the problem will be gone! Great service by Ali the driver/guide who also took us on a trip to the Atlas mountain arranged through Patrick.  Rooms are comfortable clean and breakfast is great  served on the roof patio on a sunny day!  This is indeed a beautiful Riad not to be missed and a great value for your money!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Just me wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Title: Lovely Riad in a Prime Setting
Review_Text: We stayed here for a week and had a lovely time. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The owner Patrick was readily available to give directions advice on best places to visit and eat etc. Any trips you want to go on can be organised by the Riad too at a better price than elsewhere so this avoids the need to search around the numerous tour operators.  A great place to stay! Thanks to all the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I spent two nights at the Riad Les Trois Palmiers with my wife and my 2-year-old daughter. The Riad is beautiful and quiet giving us a well needed break from a day in the the motorcycle-congested streets of Marakech. If I were to rate the Riad itself without taking into account service I'd probably give it four stars (I'm very critical). However the staff working there including the owner Pat were so amazingly friendly and hospitable that I cannot give them less than 5.    When I say they go out of their way to help you I mean that in the most literal sense. For example my daughter was hungry one late morning and I was all out of food I went in search for something she might like at their kitchen but it was closed. not to disappoint us the caretaker left the Riad and came back 10 minutes later with some bananas apples and bread. My daughter quickly relished in the delicious fruit (as did I). Needless to say we were very pleased.    This is just one of many examples of the level of service we experienced at the Riad. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who's looking for a place to stay while visiting Marakech (with or without children).    Oh and I almost forgot. They have a stroller that they let us borrow during our stay. We knew this ahead of time so we left our stroller back home and used theirs instead. It was very convenient not having to drag one around with us during our flight to/from Morocco. Again fantastic service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Steve H wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Title: A beautiful oasis of calm in exciting Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Trois Palmiers for 5 nights and found it to be clean beautiful and well appointed. The owner and staff were really helpful providing drinks food adjacent and booking cars & trips efficiently.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Well located riad excellent service and staff. An oasis of calm in centre of marrakesh. We found it ourselves as drove to marrakesh. However we would have struggled if it had been night time as it is buried down several derbs.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My wife and I spent 8 nights in this gorgeous riad and will definitely return. The staff and owner Patrick made us feel so welcome and relaxed from the moment we arrived. We were told to treat the riad as if it was our very own home the staff made us feel as if it really was our home. We were so well looked after by everyone and can't thank them enough for going out of their way to look after us. The riad itself is beautifully restored full of elegant and exotic Moroccan charm. The staff and the beautiful restoration of this riad create the perfect atmosphere to relax in. This riad really is the perfect oasis from the hustle and bustle of the medina. The location of the riad is excellent with easy access to the souks the main square and to the road outside the medina walls. The riad is nicely tucked away down the enchanting alleyways which most riads tend to be this short mazey little walk gives you the chance to greet the locals before being mesmorised by the beaty that lies behind the riad doors.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: james s wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: We stayed in this elegant Riad for 6 nights in September. Easy to find fault  It is very well located and has an excellent staf organized by the owner Patrick who made a very helpful map for us at our arrival.  He also made a tour of his riad giving us a lot of informations about houses population museums etc.  We had dinner evry evening ther and it was an amazing food.  We did a day trip organized by the riad to the Atlas Moutains which was really nice.  We also used their services to book for us a hot air balloon with Marrakech By Air.  We highly recommend them all and Would not hesitate to stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Lovely peaceful riad in good location although without a map drawn by Patrick it could be quite difficult to fine so I would recommend getting an airport transfer or at least ring ahead to get some directions. We had food there on the first night which was also very good. The terrace has a good view and is particularly nice at sunset.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We were looked after so well by wonderful staff.We were met at the airport and delivered to the Riad at no extra cost. Our room on the first floor was beautiful very comfortable bed and there was always piping hot water in our huge bathroom. Lovely breakfasts always something different. I can recommend the massage and the manicure just make an appointment in the morning for late afternoon or early evening. Only complaint - wifi intermittent and impossible to get signal in our room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Maureen M wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Title: an oasis in madness of the medina
Review_Text: Fantastic location wonderful service - they could not do enough to ensure you enjoyed your stay. Having breakfast ( and how much of it there was!) - On that fantastic roof terrace every morning. We arranged to eat dinner on our first night and whilst we didn't eat every night- it wasn't because of the quality of the food it was just that we wanted to explore other restaurants.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Choose this Riad overany other - it is simply such a nice place with excellent staff
Review_Text: We stayed in this Riad on our first time in Morocco and Marrakech. We arrived from the airport via taxi and were shown the way to the riad by one of the local kids (tip: agree a price before you do anything - should be 20 DAM or so) The welcome we got from Khaled was very warm. Traditional Moroccan tea was served to us as he sat us down to take time to show us all the highlights and the route to find the place on the map.  Our room was very cosy and the place has a stunning roof terrace with great views. Very clean quiet and comfortable.  The breakfast was lovely each morning with traditional breads/crepes/fruit/freshly squeezed orange and tea or coffee.  The owner Patrick was most helpful too helping us in any way he could and taking time out of his day to talk to us and give us a couple of tips.  We intend to hire out the whole place with family and friends next year as our stay was so good and I am someone who never usually goes back to the same place.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A diamond in the midst of the medina. But first you have to Go past guards outside the walls of the Royal Palace at Dar Basha then you enter often-wet dark tunnels. Then you turn left and then right past an always overflowing garbage bin no signs. Three knocks on a door -- and you walk into a dream.  Patrick and his wife Carolyn converted two 350 year old side by side houses into two side by side riads. A riad is only as good as the people who take care of you. There is no finer group: Hisham Mustapha Mohammed dearest Habiba Dhalila Dhiba. Fatima Youssef Hasha Aziza -- i do hope i mentioned you all -- work tirelessly to treat you royally. Thank you one and all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: David Y wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: If you are looking for an authentic Marrakech experience this is it. Buried in the lanes of the Medina with all the great sites in walking distance and a staff that are intent on making you welcome and comfortable; you would be hard pressed to beat it. The only advice is make sure you are picked up at the airport as you would be hard pressed to find it on your own. That is part of the attraction.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Please stay here, it is as simple as that!
Review_Text: My Partner booked this Riad as a present for my 30th birthday as he knew I wanted to stay in the Medina and experience Marrakech properly. Les Trois Palmier did not disappoint us in any way. We arrived at 10am after being picked up from the airport by Ali and meandering through small alleyways towards the Riad. We were welcomed into the hotel by Patrick and Khaled. After being given traditional mint tea and small sweet/pastries we were shown directions on a map and then taken to our room which was simply stunning.    We instantly felt at home and settled in immediately. We came and went as we pleased and there was someone to help us if we needed anything at all. We arranged 2 excursions via the Riad with very little notice and both were immense (Marrakech by Air and Tour of the Ourika Valley).    We did not eat at the Riad in the evenings for no specific reason but even though they serve food we were still recommended where to go which I thought was good. However we did enjoy the breakfast; lovely and generous which is needed to set you up for a day in the Medina.    The Riad was comfortable with comfy beds it was spotlessly clean beautifully and traditionally decorated friendly informative multi-lingual and made our trip one extremely memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed at this beautiful Riad in July. Our onward transport was unexpectedly booked up and the staff went to great trouble to help us to arrange alternative transport. I have rarely experienced such helpfulness.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect location, fantastic service, wonderful rooms.
Review_Text: We have just returned from the most wonderful stay at this riad. Patrick and his fantastic team made our stay in Marrakech. The riad is a lovely peaceful place to retreat to after a busy day in the bustling medina. The rooms are lovely clean and comfortable with lovely attention to detail and the food in the riad was some of the best if not the best we had while in Marrakech. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful providing invaluable local tips and information and supply fantastic breakfasts on the terrace. Patrick also organised a great day trip for us. Couldn't recommend Les Trois Palmiers high enough and can't wait to return.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A lovely little Riad in Bar Dacha. Rooms are simply & elegantly appointed and guests are attended to by delightful staff and caring proprietors. Not much to say other than if you're looking for a relaxing and elegant stay in a Riad this is your choice!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Charming Riad with real personal service
Review_Text: This charming Riad is actually two side by side and sympathetically restored by the owners Patrick and Caroline. It is a cool and tranquil oasis with superb attention to detail and friendly discrete attentiveness. We received excellent personal service from all the staff we encountered. It is true that to find it on your own would be virtually impossible so ensure you have the riads driver collect you from the airport. The location is brilliant as you are minutes walk from the main square and souks. Make sure you take breakfast on the lovely rooftop terrace homemade yoghurt and freshly squeezed orange plus everthing else you could want.The room we had was on the middle floor and this would be the quietest area and the rooms are larger.Be prepared for a very hard bed though!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Fantastic Riad, ticks all the boxes
Review_Text: This is our second visit to Marrakech and after having such a lovely time at the riad last time we booked again. We were not disappointed picked up at the airport and we emailed Patrick the owner ahead to ask for dinner to be prepared in the riad. It was tasty as usual. We had cocktails and beers (yes alcohol is available and very reasonably priced. We had been upgraded to a suite which was lovely large bed fresh crisp white bedlinen robes products in the bathroom. Lots of hot water and a very powerful shower. Clean towels every day. Just what you expect from this type of riad. This riad is perfectly placed for all the local sites everything is walkable. A short distance from the main square. I cannot find fault with this riad and would always choose to stay there whenever we visit which we certainly will again. It is a wonderful little oasis amid the crazy but wonderful commotion of the medina...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I just returned from Riad Les Trois Palmiers and had the most wonderful experience. The ambience was lovely and peaceful and Patrick could not have been more helpful. One night I stayed in and ordered dinner which was perfect and a good bargain. Rooms are beautiful quiet and well priced. I highly recommend this riad which provided a calm haven in the sometimes chaotic medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Mary C wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Title: Very impressed with the hotel and the service
Review_Text: I really didn't know what to expect with a Riad but I read the reviews of the Riad Les Trois Palmiers and decided to give it a try. What a great time. This Riad was exceptional and Patrick and his wife were truly helpful. They both went beyond my expectations of service. Even after we checked out our train to Fes was cancelled and I called Patrick for help. He quickly provided advice and we were well on our way. The location of this Riad is great; only a few minutes walk to the heart of the medina. Stay at the Riad Les Trois Palmiers and enjoy a wonderful experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The rooftop terrace was spectacular. The two intimate pools were a welcome relief from the Kech heat. We found our twin bed bedroom quite large and the bathroom enormous by Moroccan standards. The a/c was powerful breakfast tasty and satisfying. The wifi worked best in the lobby and was not usable in the bedroom. The rooms people were friendly and helpful. The location was excellent: easy access within the medina but felt quite safe and secure. The airport and rail transfers were convenient and offered without hesitation. We had dinner there one evening and the tajine was delicious.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Riad Les Trois Palmeirs was a wonderful oasis of calm and hospitality amongst the hustle and bustle that is Marrakech. I stayed with my family there for 3 nights and I can say it is the best place I have stayed anywhere in the world. It would probably be impossible to find if you are on your first visit to Marrakech so I would highly recommend taking advantage of their airport pick up and drop off service that the Riad offers. We were met by Ali (the driver) and Mustapha (the manager of the Riad). Both of them were gentleman and we can not praise them highly enough. We had planned our break to Marrakech some months in advance all communication via email was answered promptly and clearly. The Riad offers excursions and activities that are well planned and cheaper then booking independently. We went on a day trip to the Ourika Valley and also camel riding both of which were excellent experiences and were well planned. The guide for the Ourika valley excursion Mohammed was excellent and more or less carried our 5 year old all the way. In terms of the Riad it was beautiful down to every detail. As other visitors have commented the roof terrace provided a perfect area to have a meal or just relax after a day in the city. However for us the staff were the highlight of our stay. Everyone was incredibly hospitable and considerate. As mentioned by previous visitors to the Riad. Nothing was to much for them and you genuinely felt like part of a big family. Mustapha is a wonderful man and went out of his way to assist us. Also he never stopped smiling what ever the time of day/night. Khalid's advice on all areas made things so much easier also his well practiced hand drawn maps to Jema El Fna where spot on. Ali (the driver) was always feeding us with information about the city as we drove around. He is also a pretty good singer with a love for power ballads!! The ladies behind the scenes were thoughtful and caring. We have a 5 year old and when we returned from a trip out of the Riad a glass of milk or a towel to have a quick dip in the pool would just appear. Dalia's cooking was amazing I would highly recommend having a meal at the Riad lost count of how many courses but everything tasted delicious and the service was second to none. For the quality of accommodation food and service Riad Les Trois Palmeirs was incredibly good value. We have traveled a fair bit but this is the first time I have felt the need to comment on how exceptional I have found a place. Marrakech is a blast to the senses coupled with 45C plus temperatures being able to come back to such a calm and tranquil place was prefect. In terms of Marrakech lots of positives but also some negatives the battering isn't for everyone. Lots of helpful people and also some not so. But my review is off the Riad and I have nothing but good things to say about it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at Les Trois Palmiers. The staff and owner were incredibly friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We were met at the airport by the Riad's transport - efficient and quick and once in Marrakech he parked and took us down what seemed to be endless dark alleyways. We were soon at the Riad and as soon as the door opened we could see the dramatic contrast between the mysterious alleyways to the peace and tranquility of the Riad.The owner has completed an amazing project in getting this to such a high standard. The breakfast on the roof terrace was excellent and the service excellent too. The room was very nice but at the time when we stayed the drains created a smell and the hot water system could not quite cope with the demand. It is not really a place to take young children as noise travels. A fantastic central location and the owner was really helpful in recommending restaurants and in fact pointed u in the direction (and booked it for us) a fantastic restaurant - our best meal in Marrakech.  Would recommend you to stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Rick M wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: I'd been to Marrakesh years before as a student and had loved it but this time I was coming back with my husband and two teenaged daughters. The reviews for the riad were fantastic so we mailed Patrick to see if he had space for 4 nights at the beginning of August. Commiunication was prompt and easy and brilliant double rooms were available.    Every single part of our stay at the riad was exceptional from our collection by Ali at the airport (we'd been delayed 2 hours at Luton and he'd had to wait for us when all others were breaking their fasts with their families) to Mustapha's kind care and smiling greetings at the door when we returned each evening. Our girls 17 and 19 were quite simply in love!    There were other nice touches - one of the employees greeted us with impromptu plates of watermelon when she saw how hot we were after a day's sight seeing in 50 degrees' heat. We were also helped with organising train times to Fez and road travel by Patrick who gently advised us to have a rethink about our intended travel plans as the guide book appeared inaccurate in its estimation of how long it would take to drive through the Atlas Mountains to Taroudant. As a result we did not attempt to do the 7 hour train journey from Fez pick up a car and drive the 6 hours (not 4) to Taroudant in one day - it would've been extremely dangerous to drive through the mountain range in the dark.    Added to this on our journey to Fez I realised that I'd left my credit card in the now open safe in our room. I called Patrick who retrieved it and took care of it in the riad safe until our return 4 days later. It really put my mind at ease and as soon as we returned Mustapha presented me with it again with a smile.    So ..do believe the reviews. They are genuine. I just hope that the riad isn't fully booked for when we want to return with other friends and family in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: daf s wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: My girlfriend and I were planning a trip abroad between 5/8/12 and 12/8/12 and wanted more of a cultural experience (apologies in advanced for the cliche) and Marrakech seemed to be the stand-out destination. We set about doing the necessary research on Trip Advisor and the Riad Trois Palmiers emerged as a main contender for accommodation due to all the excellent feedback and the outstanding value for money.    Right from the off the service we received was excellent. The owners were more than happy to answer our queries through email as we sought to confirm dates and ask questions about our visit. Free transfers courtesy of the Riad's main driver Ali (what a legend he was by the way!) were arranged to pick us up from the airport when we arrived and take us back at the end of our seven days.    When we eventually arrived at the Riad after a long day of travelling from the UK (Cardiff) Mustapha was on hand to welcome us and show us our rooms in a friendly and polite manner. I have to say that the staff at Trois Palmiers really made our holiday - they literally couldn't do enough for us. In particular Mustapha and Mohammed were amazing right throughout the week; preparing food for us organising excursions giving advice about the city. In short the service we received from the staff was 7* and I honestly could not fault them - even the cleaners were brilliant!    The Riad itself was exactly as expected; extremely clean quiet and comfortable. The room we had on the top floor was equipped with fully functioning air conditioning which was an absolute GODSEND as the temperature all week was an average 49 degrees. Basically what you see in the pictures is what you get so you won't be disappointed.    The holiday itself was exactly what we had anticipated and therefore I would recommend it to couples who are looking to get away and really experience something different. If you are looking for a holiday where you lounge by the pool all week go out in the evening for some cabaret in a British-themed nightclub followed by some food in a British themed restaurant then Marrakech isn't the place for you.    The city and country is amazing but certainly not for the feint-hearted. If you are visiting the square or the markets be prepared to be hustled! There's no point getting annoyed by it as bartering is a way of life over there. Instead try to embrace it with good humour and a smile on your face! Oh and remember that for every price a merchant requests they will usually accept a quarter of this price for their goods! Also remember that you are in an Islamic country so don't be surprised if you attract unwanted attention by dressing inappropriately.    Also for those of you wondering about Ramadan and how it will impact tourists then I would say it really had a minimal impact for us as visitors to the city in August. I would encourage visitors to be mindful.    Overall I would say that this Riad the people who work in it the location and the overall experience were truly outstanding. Would we return? Most definitely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Richard S wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Title: A hidden gem well worth a visit
Review_Text: We stayed here for four nights commencing beginning of August 12 and have nothing but positive things to say about this Riad and Marrakech.  I will keep it brief and to the point as you should read as many reviews as you can.  ...the owners are fantastic from the min you book till the time you leave they can't do enough for you.  ...the Riad is absolutely stunning and far better than any large commercial hotel you can stay in.  ...the courtyards are beautiful and the two pools are a relaxing break from the heat.  ...the photos online do not do the Riad any justice at all.  ...mustapha (night manager) is the nicest guy I have ever met and made us feel like we were staying with family.  ...the food is superb the breakfast is a wonderful selection of pastries pancakes and fruit with tea and coffee.  ...the rooftop is great in the day to sunbathe or relax but magical to enjoy dinner on at night.  ....they organized our trips to the atlas mountains and it was cheaper and better organized than the street sellers.  ...they recommended some beautiful restaurants to eat in and we couldn't fault any of their recommendations.  ...the airport transfers were great and without them I don't know how we would have found it.  Marrakech is an interesting place to visit and I would recommend it to everyone. We will definitely go back again but only if there is space at this Riad. It's like staying at a palace with lose family it's peaceful beautiful relaxing and wonderfully renovated. Try it I promise you won't be disappointed.    Now for the negatives:    There are none if it's 21 out of the riads in Marrakech I'd love to know how the other 20 have got it better cause this is amazing especially for the price.....don't hesitate book it now you'll love it...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Believe the reviews, it is a very good place to stay in.
Review_Text: We (family with a one year old) spent 5 days at the riad. From the moment we arrived until the second we left we felt extremely well cared for. Everyone at the riad went always out of their ways to help us and make us feel really at home.    We came across the riad by using trip advisor's ranking system and after booking on two other places (one intentional another by mistake: Make sure you book at the RIAD and not the HOTEL! they are not the same!). The reviews are correct and it is true that the riad is located somewhat out of the way of regular transit but do not let that put you off. After the first day out you will get accustomed to all the little streets in the medina so this is not going to be a problem even at night. The staff at the riad will draw you a map anyway if needed.    We did not experience any of the negatives mentioned on the other reviews: we had hot water we did not experience noisy neighbours and we were never disturbed by any sewage works.    The room was excellent. We stayed at the Almoravide (fantastic decor in the room just as in the pictures) with three beds plus a cot the owners provided free of charge so we had all we needed. The AirCon system worked perfectly which was good since we were at > 39 degrees average! Our bathroom worked fine no problems with drains whatsoever hot water running all the time. There is no fridge in the room but you can use space on the kitchen if you need to (for baby food for example).    The ryad has two pools which are fantastic to cool down after having experienced the medina in all its hot beauty.    The staff well we really fall short in our words to describe them. Bear in mind we had a one year old kid who has tons of energy to burn. They were all awesome. Kind helpful always paying attention to our needs and anticipating them (cold drinks after a day out cold watermelon in the afternoon preparing breakfast as soon as they heard our son stirring and making noises in his cot). Not only they provide excellent service but they were also giving us a hand with our son helping us get some rest as well.    As for the other amenities the terrace is beautiful the views are fantastic. Especially at sunset when the breeze hits and it is all fresh.    Do try the dinner service. You have to let them know in advance if you want to have dinner and it is fantastic. They also provide lunch if you ask for it (good for us to eat while the baby slept) and it definitely beats eating in the streets although there are lots of good small restaurants to choose from (do try the tajine kafta).    TV: yes there is no TV in the room but do you really go to marrakesh to watch TV ? if you want there are two tv rooms were you can sit in and have a drink while catching up with the world news.    Getting to and from the riad to the airport: The riad will provide a driver free of charge to take you to and from the airport.    Organising days out: Ask the staff at the Riad they will make good suggestions for you and arrange everything. Ask them before booking anything off the street there are a lot of stands offering excursions and when there are so many it is better to aks someone with experience.    In closing you will not regret staying in this Riad. it is a very nice place. Of course you can pay quadruple and stay at a top notch 6 star hotel but the experience will be completely sterile and different. Staying at this riad is a fantastic experience and its location so close to the jemma el fna plaza the souks the koutoubia the bahia palace the medrassa etc. (all walking distance by the way no need for cabs or horse-carriages or anything else) just makes it fantastic. we definitely recommend it and will come back to this place next time we get a chance. Thanks to all the staff at the riad for a great stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: What a wonderful place to stay. It was our first visit to Morocco and although it was a bit nerve-racking getting the the Riad the minute we walked in the door it was absolute paradise and relaxation. The staff was very friendly and informative (honestly) about everything in the surrounding area. We stayed in the King suite which had one of the best bathroom's in the world and I would return in a heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Jack S wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: We were recommended by friends of London who had been a number of times. The riad was in great order and the welcome was so warm and smiling.  There were loads of extra little touches such as home made pastries and fruits in our room and the bed was really comfy.  Staff are amazing nothing was too much trouble for them.  The owners are obviously really trying to make this place different they were enthusiastic about the city and helped with a walk route. Never forget their hand-made map it's really useful.  Try it !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Andrew E wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: This Riad is one of the most beautiful places that I have stayed - simply stunning.    From the beautiful roof terrace to both of the courtyards it was so very easy on the eye.    The only minor criticism that I could level would be is that it is not particularly easy to find if you are on your own. It does take a bit of finding but I guess that is Marrakech for you!    Breakfast is beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad, would recommend to anyone!
Review_Text: Stayed here for 6 nights and had the most amazing holiday! The riad was absolutely beautiful perfectly situated about 10 mins from the square but away from the hustle and bustle.It had a lovely outside terrace which had panaramoic views and was the perfect place to relax in the day/evening or have breakfast in the morning. The staff were so friendly nothing was too for them much. Patrick also offered great advice on what to do while we were there so we went on a 3 day trip (arranged through the Riad) to the Atlas mountains for one night and then stayed in the Sahara desert on the second night which was an amazing experience.    This riad is one of the best places we have stayed and cannot fault anything about it. Would definitley recommend this riad to anyone staying in Marrakesh. Thank you to everyone there for making it such a memorable holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My husband and I spent 4 days at this Riad. The staff and owners are wonderful and nothing is too much for them they made us feel like part of their family. The Riad is beautiful calm and the most relaxing place we have ever stayed. Meals are also a relaxing experience delicious and with excellent presentation. I would advise anyone staying here to have the evening meals and enjoy the ambiance. The owners and all the staff always went out of their way to ensure you were comfortable and had everything you needed even down to one day cooling our room down before we returned to the Riad form a very hot day out in the sun  We will definitely be returning and staying longer the next time. Val and Clarence Fearns
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Alexandra S wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: So well located i've visited the whole medina I think and this is really one of the best location 10 minutes from main square and only 2 minutes from taxis. In the heart of the souks close to main sites and antiquity shops. Of course for your arrival take the pickup at the airport but next day with both hand made map by the owner and official map you'll find your way back.  Can't wait to come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Kathrine K wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: We were two adults and five adolescent girls staying at the riad in July. Although all of us have traveled a lot we all agreed upon that this was the best hotel ever. The service was excellent; the manager and his stuff made us feel welcome from the moment we entered the riad the rooms were nice the breakfast a feast and the atmosphere calm and relaxing. It is no question whether we wll come back or not. We definitely will.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Dimitri S wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: We're just back from two weeks in Morrocco and spent our 4 nights in this beautiful riad nice decoration very well located clean and calm best smiling staff we've had. Recommend to every one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: James N wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: We felt at home asz soon as we entered the riad warm and friendly atmosphere. The staff have been very helpful and very polite they made us feel welcome and safe at all times. The riad was amazing and captured our hearts.We will definitely return. A perfect place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Susan Y wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: Hi My 2 sisters and myself stayed at this riad for 3 nights from 15 June. What a wonderful place! The staff were all so helpful and could not do enough for us. It was well located although the directions took a bit of getting used to - listen and look for landmarks. The food was fabulous and very reasonably priced. Patrick the owner picked us up at the airport (worth paying for this because you will never find it). He also arranged a meal for us at another riad on the Saturday night - superb. Breakfast was served each morning up on the roof terrace and was delicious. We mainly sunbathed and shopped. We would definitely recommend this riad to stay in as in was luxurious but sympathetically modernised so all the traditional features were still there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Jim P wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: Best holidays we had since a long time. From the airport (free pickup) arriving at the door of the riad a warm welcoming smile from Kaled a mint tea and some pastries informations about history complete tour of the riad and rooms everything was perfect. Nice and clean rooms brilliant breakfast safe area in the middle of the souks. Don't hesitate to ask them advices about days trips.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is the only place to stay in Marrakech! I have been lucky enough to stay in some of the best hotels in the world but I can honestly say that Le Riad Trois Palmiers is a contender. Stylish original whilst retaining a sense of traditional - it is like arriving home as soon as you walk through the door. An escape from the hustle and bustle of an extraordinary city: this riad offers calm and sophistication. The staff could not have done more the food is outstanding and the French hosts Caroline and Patrick are charming urbane and knowledgeable. Thank you so much for four extraordinary nights. I will be returning soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: What an amazing place to stay!
Review_Text: My friends and I stayed in this riad for 6 nights in late June 2012 and could not fault it at all. From the moment Ali picked us up from the airport as part of the service we felt instantly at ease. On arrival at the riad Khalid showed us to our beautiful room with fresh flowers on the bed and petals as an added touch.....it was simply wonderful. We had asked for dinner on arrival and were given a five course Moroccan feast which was amazing and Khalid was very attentive and friendly throughout our first evening.    We had breakfast every morning which set us up for the busy outside world of Marrakesh. The staff at the riad were the friendliest and most helpful that we have encountered while on holiday. Mustafa went out of his way to recommend a restaurant one night to us and then unbeknown to us called ahead to let the restaurant know we were coming along and to take care of us on our arrival.....where else would you find such hospitality.    The riad is very central and only 10 minutes through the amazing wonderful souks to get to the main square. We felt very safe coming and going from our riad at all times of the day and night.    I would not hesitate to recommend Riad Trois Palmiers to anyone who visits Marrakesh and they even organise wonderful trips for you....we spent a day at the Atlas Mountains courtesy of the riad's organisation and were amazed by this wonderful trip and the sights we saw.    This riad was a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh and chilling out on the rooftop terrace after a hard days bartering with the souks is just sublime.    We would like to thank all the staff especially the lovely ladies in the kitchen Mustafa for taking the most amazing care of us and Khalid for making our first night very memorable. Mr Patrick completed our holiday by presenting us with lovely bracelets on our departure and we were all very sad to leave the riad and Marrakesh but have vowed to return time and time again!    Thank you all for your lovely hospitality and kindness which will stay with us for a long time!    Jackie Caroline & Claire (the Scottish girls)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Suzan W wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: Thank you to all the staff at this beautiful riad. Thank you Caroline and Pat. We have had a lovely stay and everyone was so welcoming. We felt at home as soon as we entered the riad such a friendly atmosphere. We have never experienced such hospitality. Hope to be back once and it will be a pleasure to recommend to friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect, made a relaxing stay even better
Review_Text: I would seriously recommend this Riad for people wanting to stay in Marrakech. It get top marks from us and you should stay there too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Carlo C wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: Don't hesitate go there !!! Very well located riad we spent there 7 nights and really recommend the area of Dar El Bacha safe clean nice shops only 2 minutes from taxis. Amazing staff nice owners great rooms nothing was too much for them definitely recommended and hope stay here soon again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Sue O wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: We stayed there 5 nights in the Almohade room  great room on the first floor. We took our breakfast every morning on the terrace at 11.00 they always said no problem sir you're welcome !!! where do you find such a service.  The hustle & bustle of the main square and the souks are just a few minutes away from the riad but when you enter the Riad it's wonderfully quiet a welcome retreat from all the noise of the city.  Special thanks to the owners Caroline and Patrick who told us about Midlife Crises...  Special thanks to Ali the driver who met us at the airport transfers were free.  I cannot recommend this riad highly enough. Top service excellent rooms courtyard  a great roof terrace and probably the best (and free) mint tea we were served throughout our entire stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Best riad we stayed at in Morocco
Review_Text: This riad was by far the best riad we stayed in Morocco. The courtyard was comfortable and beautiful and the rooms were clean and romantic. Best of all the staff were polite and wonderful. They even taught us and let us cook tajines with them in the kitchen. The owner was superbly helpful in our non-existent plans to drive from Marrekesh to Merzouga and then to Fez and recommended a great driver (his name is Mohammed Gouaghi and is a funny very nice guy). I also leaned against the wall and accidentally knocked off an antique looking gun to the floor breaking it but the owners were so nice and understanding! A great place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect place to relax and enjoy the crazy Marrakesh
Review_Text: What to say that hasn't been said yet? This riad is amazing! The location in the Medina is perfect and the rooms are comfortable and beautifully decorated. However what makes this place so special and impossible do dislike is all the staff who works there: Mustafa Khaled Fatima Dalila and all the other lovely ladies. Always around making sure I had everything I needed offering the refreshing mint tea e the delicious traditional biscuits. I felt at home. I will definitely go back to Marrakesh and no shadow of a doubt will stay at the Les Trois Palmiers again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Jessie P wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Title: A little peace haven in a hectic city...
Review_Text: I honestly cannot praise this riad enough. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left I just felt so welcome. The owner greeted us on arrival and said "treat this as your home" and thats exactly how we were made to feel. I spent 6 days there with my niece and it was absolute bliss. The staff at the Riad are so friendly and Khalil is such a sweet man. Nothing was too much trouble for him. The ladies at the Riad were so helpful too. Our room was so pretty. The bathroom was clean aswell as the room the lighting in the room could have been better.    Breakfast was nice but I would have liked a bit more variety. Also I would have liked to have Wifi access available in my room so I could stream movies in the evening as there was no entertainment system in our rooms (no TV or music player).    The walk to the main square was short (about 10 mins) but a little hectic as the streets are so busy. I would definitely recommend this Riad to anyone staying in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Emily A wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: Excellent breakfast and a generous hostess who allowed us to stay in our room until 5:30pm on the day of checkout- really valuable to be able to shower before heading to the airport after a hot day wandering around. The staff were generally friendly though when asked for a dinner recommendation one of the staff unhelpfully suggested the riad itself. Our room was tiny but immaculate and air conditioned. Location is good- lost in the alleyways but very convenient for the souk.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: MohammedAli S wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: + The hotel service was excellent especially Mostafa He did all his best to make our stay as comfortable as he could.. The room we stayed was very clean and the attched bathroon was evry nice and has all amenities. The breakfast service was really nice and filling and the service given by all staff was excelent especially Khalid.  _ The location was very hard to find at the begining. and you have to walk quite a distance to get to the main road and further more to get to the nearest place for a car.  My room did not have a televisionor music player.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Amy N wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at this Riad. The staff was the best Khaled and Mustafa and all the other great women working there made the stay feel like home. The rooms were clean the ambiance was a great escape after coming from the hustle and bustle of the souks. The fresh roses everyday throughout the hotel is a great touch to the elegance of the place. The breakfast on the terrace was heavenly... even when we woke up late we still got something to eat. The location is ideal to walk anywhere and safe. It is a bit tricky to find if you don't get a ride from the airport but other than that we will be coming back next year and hopefully with more people. Thanks Patrick and everyone who works there. Inshallah we'll see each other soon.  I could write a novel about this place but for now I'll stick to spreading the word :)    Cheers  Amy and Keston
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: from the courtesy car from the airport to the welcoming mint tea and traditional pastries ..this simple elegant restoration of two houses is very relaxing aided by comfortable beds the snowiest bedlinen ..hot showers .bathrobes thick towels .sparklingly clean ..roses and fresh flowers every where... a calm sanctuary after a day in the souk or museums ....the people who work here really make the place so good nothing is too much trouble for patricks people especially Mustapha .Mohammed .Khalid ..and the discreet ladies who make all the practical thigs happen  i highly recommend this riad ....    ps ..dont be alarmed by the dark alley way to the riad with the bakery en route ...it is very simple to find and completely safe as i am a loe traveller ..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Marie E wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay there last April with helpful staff nice owners really nice located riad clean quiet will recommend to every one. We had a large room Almohade on the first floor we took breakfest every morning on the terrace with a stunning overview on the Medina. Hand-made map was really helpful. Ali the driver made pickup roundtrip at the aiport for us and they were free.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Nicholas T wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Patrick your hotel is just lovely. I can not tink of any where I would want to come back too more than here. Your staff are attentive the accomodation was excellent and the location brilliant. If your reading this I would recommend the riad without doubt. Don't expect a balnd-no-name-multi-national feel here. Traditional features lovely food and the home made maps are invaluable. Just remember to take cash for everything NOT travel cheques!!!! Eat at the night markets barter in the markets get ready for the smells of the tannery and above all buy the local goods there worth every penny. Can wait to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Right in the middle of the active old city lies this comfortable safe hideaway with many niches and private patios. After our busy day in the city or off on a road trip it was always great to come back to our Riad home. All the meals we ate here were wonderful and the staff was extremely helpful and accommodating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Oasis of tranquillity in an exciting city
Review_Text: This riad is like a home from home - if you have people waiting on you hand and foot - extremely helpful staff - remember to take euros or enough dirhams to pay in cash it save Patrick a lot of commission! The view from the roof of the sun rising behind the snow capped Atlas Mountains is unforgettable. My 87 year old mother was delighted by the experience reminiscient of her youth in 1940's Lucknow.  The rose petals strewn on the bed is a nice touch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Best to have one of the staff meet you at the airport or another location and guide you to the riad the first time. It is down several narrow alleys and only marked by the the three palms on the doors there are two. There you may be fortunate to be greeted by Patrick a charming Marseilleaux expat who will orient you to the neighborhood and the top sights of Marrakech. Patrick can also organize tours to the mountains or desert. The people who had our room before us spent a week here and took excursions organized by Patrick. Patrick and his wife Caroline bought and refurbished this riad about 8 years ago. To retain the style of the riad a quiet but grand family home in an otherwise anonymous location they have no signage other than the trois palmiers on the door so that you can be certain you will ring the right bell when you arrive unattended. There are twelve friendly and attentive staff and the service is to a very good standard. The breakfast is very nice and of continental style with good coffee. You can have it on the rooftop terrace if you wish and this is recommended. The rooms and bathrooms are very nice. Although hard to find it is nonetheless not far from the Djemaa el-Fna - the main square - and you can learn to navigate there and back on foot with the instructions that will be provided. It is also close to the Marrakech Museum. You can walk to the Jardin Majorelle in 20-30 minutes but we took a taxi. Navigating around the Medina area can be difficult and there are very few signs and many turnings. It is a good idea to start out with many 10 and 20 dirham coins and bills so you can hire a young man to guide you from point to point if you deviate from the well-known routes. Have a great time in Marrakech and stay in Riad Les Trois Palmiers if you can. Watch out for the scooters and small motorcycles that share the narrow passages with pedestrians but attempt to go much faster. The scooters are the biggest problem with the old town of Marrakech. I would also recommend dining out at the night stalls in the square. Try the soup the dates the desserts the snails etc. It's all delicious and very cheap.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: You can feel a little shell shocked landing in Marrakech... but being whisked off to the trois palmiers (dont worry when you get lead down a series of covered alley ways to get there!) really helps you deal with the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The contrast between the Riad and the city outside could not be more stark. Inside les trois palmiers Mustapha and the gang take care of your every need in the stunningly renovated Riad... mint tea becomes quite addictive! Outside the Riad the fun starts about 10 mins walk from the main square (i would not advise residing to close to this area as you want a bit of distance) you have have all the colour hustle an bustle of central Marrakech... book this Riad as you wont regret it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Tom M wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: Tranquillity away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech!
Review_Text: Superb Riad that has been decorated in beautiful Moroccan style. The owner Patrick couldn't be more welcoming in inviting you into "his" home. The staff are lovely and can't do enough for you. As we stayed for 4 nights we were picked up FOC by the Riads driver. So as soon as we landed in Marrakech our great holiday started as we didn't need to worry about taxis.    We would definitely come back to this amazing Riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: S P wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: Five stars well deserved!!    Instead of staying in a gerneric hotel my boyfriend and I chose this traditional riad - we were SO happy we went for Les Trois Palmiers! Patrick and Caroline the owners have chosen their staff very well indeed. Immensely polite and helpful we always felt at home in this wonderfully renovated riad. As we had not planned much in advance of arriving in Marrakech we relied upon the staff to help us arrange excursions and things to do etc. They promptly booked us a great cookery course a trip into the Atlas mountains and also sorted out coach tickets to the coast. Just wonderful!!    Breakfasts on the roof terrace were fabulous but the dinners were even better... you must eat your evening meal there at least once during your stay.    Top choice for Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Andrew S wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: Cannot recommend the Riad highly enough. I had the advantage of stopping in two of the rooms as I had to move due to some work being carried out. both rooms were excellent but the first one with its own roof terrace was outstanding. As others have said the staff cannot do enough to help you. All the meals were excellent and there was a really good atmosphere during dinner with guests sharing experiences and ideas of where to visit. The location is great and it gives you a peaceful retreat when things outside become too hectic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The Riad was everything we'd wished for and more beautifully decorated in traditional morrocan style luxurious yet so relaxed and spotlessly clean. Its in a great location minutes from the souks and main square. The staff are wonderful genuinely friendly and really eager for you to enjoy your stay with them supplying maps and directions how to get about always welcoming when you return and offerring refreshments.  The Allouite suite we stayed in had a fabulous bath room enormous step in bath we loved it. The food is simple and delicious breakfast on the terrace perfect start to our days. Dinner consists of about four courses fresh bread salads small savoury pastries tagines couscous  and dessert all excellent. Caroline and Patrick the owners have definitely got it right and we  would reccomend this Riad to anyone who appreciates quality and service with attention to detail ......airport transfersfresh flowers mint teaorganizing trips etc etc etc
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We loved the Riad its been beautifully renovated and it's a tranquil place to stay. All of Patrick's staff are amazing Mustapha Khalid and Dhalia to name but a few they cannot do enough for you. The breakfasts are lovely (especially the pancakes!). We ate at the Riad on 2 nights and the food was excellent. The location is great and the views from the terrace across the city and to the Atlas Mountains are stunning. It was a perfect break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We were a group of 8 and stayed here for 3 days. The riad came as a complete surprise to me. It is very well maintained great for groups and the owner and staff have been the kindest I've met. We were helped through our entire stay right upto the point where we got onto our trains for our journey onward.    The riad is palatial and full of character and exceeds European/American hotel standards in this price range. The place was a very important part of our visit to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I felt good about signing up to stay here right from the initial set of email exchanges that we had with Patrick. He is very responsive and since our booking was sort of last-minute this really helped to finalize our accommodation quickly. Our big group landed in Marrakech with no prior plans hoping to figure things out once we got to the Riad and Patrick helped us do just that very efficiently. The folks at the Riad were extremely hospitable and ready to help. The ambiance of the Riad was very impressive it has been restored well and you could almost feel the story of the Riad (as told by Patrick) reverberating off the walls. The rooms are huge and beautiful. We also loved how the Jama' el Fna was a short walk from the Riad so we could just go when we felt like to experience the rush there. The Riad was certainly worth staying in and if I go back to Marrakech I would be thrilled to go back here. It felt a lot more personal to leave the place at the end of our trip because it feels like you are leaving a friend/family's place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Deb K wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: WOW WOW WOW!!! Completely and utterly lovely. Not your modern boutigue riad that i have seen on the internet but utterly charming and full of character and history from the actual riad to the host Patrick and his wonderful staff. You can't help but fall in love with the place. We can't wait to go back as soon as possible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Jen M wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: My friends and I loved Riad Les Trois Palmiers! The owners and staff are so friendly and accomodating. It's like staying with a family. It's location is great just a short distance from the square. I am already planning to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: PAUL P wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Title: Behind the door in the wall lies a world of peace
Review_Text: Goodness! What can be added to all that has been said? I too stayed here and cannot praise this well run calm and peaceful escape from the madcap world outside the door. I had a room down on the ground floor and loved it. It was enormous and perfect for my requirements. Suffice to say that I did not worry about padlocking the door as I felt as easy as if I had been in a friend's home. I was drawn a map and I have to admit that getting through the Medina is a bit of a challenge but once get the hang of it - no problem. I felt safer walking than I do in parts of London. I was lazy and ate all my meals at the Riad. As I am alone - it is actually more convenient than going into a restaurant. I am not mad on Couscous so I was given something else. One night we had grilled meat on skewers - they just kept coming. The lovely motherly chef Dahlia took pride in what was served and I loved everything that they put in from of me. Patrick and Caroline are simply delightful - it is clear that pleasing the guests is their primary concern. Wifi is available but you'll need to surf on the ground floor as the signal is somewhat limited - I understand that they may be doing something about that - but to me it was no big deal at all.    Do be aware that payment is in cash - and they do tell you this very clearly in their email. They will arrange for you to be collected and dropped back to the airport. Please also be aware that in all cases you are dealing with people both staff and owners who are intrinsically kind. I would trust them totally and left feeling as though I was leaving a good friend. I would think of setting foot anywhere else should I return.
