The highest compliment I can pay were Patrick's last words to me as he stopped in the alleys as he sailed along on his moped "P if you need anything - anything at all - call me at once on my mobile - whatever it may be Please do not hesitate"    I was no longer his guest and yet I had no doubt that he would have helped me had emergency or mishap occurred. What more can anyone ask?    I commend and recommend without hesitation
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: The Swan King wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: I've stayed in Marrakech a few times before now each time trying something new. But this is the Riad I shall always stay in from now. The rooms are not the largest I have stayed in but they are well laid out clean and very cosy and 'happy'. There is one mark dropped on the rooms because we had booked a room with a private terrace but were actually placed in a different room. The hotel did make this up to us with a free lunch and the room we were placed in was a very nice room anyway.    The staff and owners of this Riad quite clearly love what they do and want you to be happy. All staff will always acknowledge you as you or the walk past but not in an overly intrusive fashion. They have that perfect balance of discreet but attentive service a balance that is very hard to strike IME.    We ate here every night because the food is superbly cooked in a timely fashion and served in the lovely courtyard of the riad. Also with breakfast you can either take this downstairs in your room or on the terrace. Nothing is too much trouble.    The owner wrote us a very useful map to and from various sites and one thing I wish I had done is to take the offer of the riad's own transport from the airport because it's a bit tricky to find and you will get hassled on the walk to the hotel.    I personally will not even bother looking at other options when in Marrekech in future I have stayed in places three times this price and not been as happy. It's a great little riad and I am sure you will be as happy here as we were.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed three nights at the Les Trois Palmiers. We had a wounderful time and were made to feel like family Nothing was too much trouble for Patrick Caroline and their wonderful staff.    The bedrooms were spotlessly clean and we appreciated all the little extra touches.    We ate at the riad during our stay and the meals were outstanding my husband is now expecting five courses every night !!!    Thank you to everybody who made our trip so memorable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Kenneth M wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: Four fantastic nights in a beautiful riad just minutes away from the hustle of Djema El Fna.  Patrick and Caroline have achieved a monumental task in transforming two riads into a gorgeous and luxurious place to stay while visiting Marrakech.  Ably assisted by great attentive staff. I'd be back in a heartbeat!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for a 5 day city break. It was our first time in Morocco. This riad provided an ideal base for exploring Marrakech from the new town to the old. Once you get your bearings it is not hard to navigate from here. It is within easy walking distance of the Majorelle Gardens with a comfortable half hour walk or short ride in a petit taxi to La Place with all the hustle and bustle of the souks.    The riad itself was attractive clean and comfortable. The staff were helpful and polite. There was free wifi in the lobby. We had a good sized fridge and a safe in our room. The breakfast is basic but perfectly adequate with good coffee and fresh pastries. There are plenty of shops cafes and restaurants nearby. The maid created some lovely bed and towel art for us. We would definitely recommend it for people like us who go off exploring all day and just need a decent place to crash at the end of it. In fact we are planning a return visit in May.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Me my husband and my two year old daughter stayed at rid les troops palmiers last week and it was the best decision of the whole trip. During the planning stage Patrick was very helpful and always promptly replied toy emails.  Once in morocco we were glad we had taken advantage of the free transfer as we wouldn't have found the riad otherwise. The riad was beautifully decorated and layout was well thought with many different areas to chill out. The terresse was amazing and having breakfast there on the first morning in the sunshine was great. All the staff were very helpful and nothing was too much especially mustafa. I would definitely return to this riad and recommend it to friends and family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: a wonderful Riad in the heart of Marrakesh close to everything but on a quiet road. It is by Bacha street which has some of the most exquisite Moroccan antiquity shops. The staff is very professional just let them know with enough time if you want to have a meal there... if not it can take for-ever!  It is a beautiful place very relaxing and a retreat from the craziness of the medina!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Adri K wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: Riad Les Trois Palmiers is such a wonderful place to stay just in the heart of the city. The architecture the interieur is so beautiful luxurious and very cozy at the same time. The staff is very kind and helpful I was treated like a princess:) It is not just a place to sleep but a real experience.    Returning from the busy and crowded city this hostel is a real island of peace. We spent a lot of time just relaxing reading in one of the lounges or on the roofterrasse just to enjoy the athmosphere of the house. I think I might have taken more photos of the house than of the city.    I really recommend it to everyone who is planning a trip to Marrakesh to stay at this Riad I can't imagine finding better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Liz A wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: Thank you Patrick and Caroline for a truly wonderful Riad. A perfect oasis in a city of noise. Your staff Mustafa Khallid Mohammed and 'the girls' were brilliant. Please pass on our thanks to them all especially to Khallid for his map which I gripped for safety as it was a lifeline to get us from A - B. The first day in Marrekesh an experience like no other - Ive coped easily with Egypt and Bangkok - but WOW the Souks! The motorbikes the donkey cartsthe dust the fumes the bicycles the people and the kids trying to get ' a buck' for telling you the 'Big Square' is in any direction they fancy Its mayhem but you follow your map back to Riad Trois Palmier you walk through that huge wooden door and.................. TRANQUILITY IS ALL AROUND YOU. The lounge with plunge pool. Our bedroom was blissful loads of hot water in a gorgeous shower. A drink or food is always available whatever you want the staff are always on hand to help you.    A fantastic day trip into the Atlas Mountains with 4 new found French friends was organised and Ali our driver was great for explaining so much along the way including visits to a spice producer and restful garden which grew Olives which we watched being harvested. We had such fun.    Our huge breakfasts on the sun terrace were such a relaxing way to start each day and set us up for our adventures. After walking to and from the Riad a couple of times you feel like a native. We always felt safe amongst the chaos so go and visit stay at Patricks lovely Riad have a couple of days in Marrakeshs madness and enjoy! One superb thing about the Riad is that you meet and get to know your fellow travellers if you wish to so thank you to our French friends for making our last night such a laugh we SO enjoyed your company Merci! Oliver Aurelie Celine and Fabien! We visited from 16th - 20th Jan 2012 - Liz and Peter.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: After being led through the anonymous twisting alleys of the medina the front door swings open to reveal the dazzling sumptuous luxury of Les Trois Palmeirs in the centre of Marrakech. Great personal service offered by all the staff delicious fresh breakfasts on the sunny terrace and fantastically cooked food in the evening. An unforgetable experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Abdelali B wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: My son and I stayed at Riad Les Trois Palmiers In Marrackech in December 2011. Mr. patrick and the staff were very professionnel and very helpful . If you want to have a good feel for the Moroccan traditions and culture  this is a must. After a day of sightseing when you enter Riad Les Trois Palmiers you feel at home . The staff is very attentive without being intrusive . I enjoyed particularly the terrace where one can view the city and enjoy the sundown . What else can I say? It is a great to place to stay in with an excellent location.  Dr. A. Benharbit
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Paul P wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: One of the Best Hotel's I've Ever Stayed in
Review_Text: My wife and I recently stayed in this riad in Marrakech. We chose it because of the great reviews it got on this site and we had pretty high expectations on our arrival. All of our expectations we exceeded and this was one of the highlights of our trip. This riad is absolutely beautiful.    The rooms were great and all unique. The courtyard was a great place to eat or simply relax. We enjoyed a fantastic breakfast on the rooftop terrace each morning. It was a great start to the day. It was also the best breakfast we had in Morocco.    The staff was friendly and extremely helpful. Patrick the owner was quite informative and made some great suggestions for places to visit around the city.    The food was some of the best we had during our two week stay in Morocco. I would strongly advise eating at least one dinner at the riad during your stay.    The only problem we had was finding the riad. I would recommend the airport/train station pick-up option. We had a rental car and so tried to use our GPS to drive to it (we got pretty close but the entrance is down a street too narrow to drive a car down).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Nice Riad in a crazy city!
Review_Text: My partner and I have just returned from a 3 night stay in the Riad Les Trois Palmiers and we can report that it rightly deserves its high ranking on trip advisor.    We had arranged with Patrick to be collected from the airport and we are glad we did although I can honestly say that the drive from the airport was one of the scariest of my life! Scooters (with no lights on) pulling out in front of us from every direction!    The Riad is down a few dark alleys so would be very hard to find if you were not guided to it. Once inside though we were amazed at how nice (and peaceful) the place was and the owner Patrick gave us a look round and then we had a nice meal in the Riad.    Our room Idrisside was on the top terrace and was very nice. There was a good shower and comftable firm bed. Only niggles were one of the bedside lights had no switch there was no hot water out of the sink tap during our stay and also there were no bath towels in the room until the second day of our stay.    One thing neither of us was aware of was that we would be awoken at 5am each morning by men shouting the prayer call from the local mosque so take ear plug unless you are a very heavy sleeper!    There were two very helpful guides - Mustapha and Halid at the Riad and they were always on hand to advise and help if needed.    We would recommend ‚ÄòDar Donab‚Äô restaurant just next to the the Riad in the adjacent Palace ‚Äì setting was lovely and meals not over expensive.    The Riad is in a good location - 10 minutes from the main square Djemaa el Fna if you go the way the guides advise or it takes a lot longer if you go through the souks!    We have never travelled anywhere where the locals are so keen to part you with the money in your wallet! Example whilst walking through the square a man came up to me and put a snake round my neck took a picture and then wanted 300 dirhams (¬£25) for doing so!    Be advised that any locals that try to help you especially if you look lost or even consult your map (which is fairly useless in the maze of alleys that is most of the medina) are either after a tip or will try and guide you to their Uncles/Fathers/Brothers carpet/spice/leather shop etc!!! Be on your guard is all I will say!    Marrakech is a city like no other I have ever been to and in all honesty our three night stay was enough for both of us! There are no pedestrianised areas. Cars scooters and people all share the same tight alleys and we did witness one women being hit by a car. The constant dodging out of the way of scooters did become tiresome towards the end of our stay. Make sure you have good travel insurance!    The city is also not set up for tourism - sign posts are none existent (this may be so that the locals can guide you for their fee!?) and the street names also didn't always correspond to the 3 different maps I had!    The main tourist sites like the old Koranic school museum and Bahia palace were interesting but only on a visual level. There was no information (in English at least) unless you wanted to pay for a guide of which there seemed to be plenty - not all official looking!    All in all it was an interesting short break in Marrakech - the whole experience was certainly an assault on the senses but it was definitely nice to get away from all the chaos at the end of it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Patrick and his staff are excellent hosts! They want you to feel at home and you certainly do - it's not like staying in a large corporate hotel at all. I can only compare it to the ryokan in Kyoto we stayed in once - personal service in a beautiful relaxing atmosphere. You can mingle with other guests or enjoy your privacy - the common areas are big enough that you can enjoy them undisturbed by others. We took advantage of the dinner service after our complimentary dinner the first night because the food was excellent and the atmosphere was so wonderful! We can't wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A restful haven in a chaotic city
Review_Text: My friend and I stayed in Marrakech over New Year for three nights and found Patrick and his staff to be helpful courteous and informative. Nothing was too much trouble which included being met at the train station the history of the riad resoration and a delightful banquet to celebrate the New Year.  The room was very pleasant on the first floor and we spent many happy hours on the terrace reading and relaxing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I booked this Riad on the internet after reading good reviews and decided to give it a try. I was pleasantly surprised to see the place was more beautiful than I expected it to be. The owner Patrick was incredibly friendly and from the moment we walked in made us feel at home. He gave us a tour of the Riad which is calming and peaceful and restored with great attention paid to the smallest of details. Patrick was very helpful and the first thing he did when we walked in was to have tea and pastries brought in while he explained the ways to get in and out of the place and even drew a small map so we would know to find our way back to the hotel. The staff are incredibly kind. Mustafa one of the staff members paid a great deal of attention to making sure we had a wonderful stay if we needed anything at all we just had to ask. We had a comfortable room with a private terrace and ate nutritious breakfasts each morning that included fresh breads jams home made yogurts coffee tea juice and fresh fruits and I was pleasantly surprised to learn that this was complimentary even though it was not mentioned in our reservation.  The Riad is very conveniently located in the heart of the Medina right next to the best antique shops in Marrakech. The Riad stay definitely added a great deal of value to our stay in Morocco and was the highlight of our trip.it did take us a while to check out like a few other reviewers have mentioned but that was largely due to the owner not being present at the time of our check out which does lead me to believe he is probably the only person who deals with check outs so make sure you check out the night before if possible especially if you are planning to leave before the afternoon.  overall excellent stay definitely go ahead and book this one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: When we return to Morocco, we'll stay at Riad Les Trois Palmiers
Review_Text: We'd previously stayed at another riad which was quite nice. But Riad Les Trois Palmiers was a cut above. It's got great reviews in Trip Advisor and it deserves them.    Patrick (one of the co-owners) and the primary staff (Halid and Mustafa) were great giving both good advice and knowing when to leave you alone.    Our room was delightful. The roof-top terraces were a refuge from the city while the interior court-yards were quiet and relaxed. The included breakfasts were standard continental fare with high-quality ingredients.    The location was great a short walk to Djemaa el Fna (the main square) and the souks.    For an authentic Moroccan experience with a touch of European flair this is the place to go. We'll be recommending it to friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect hideout in the middle of everything!
Review_Text: Riad les trois palmiers & Riad el Bacha are two connected Riads of the same owner (Patrick).  From the first moment we (family of 4) arrived until the moment we left we were well taken care of and felt like visiting family.  Every corner of the Riad is well thought of and even for winter time it was the only Riad we stayed which felt warm.    Absolutely positive for us was:  - the atmosphere in general  - ambient music (local style)  - personal touch by Patrick and his staff  - perfect decoration  - a safe peacefull haven in a world of madness (Medina & Djema el Fna)  - beautiful rooms nice beds  - many relaxing corners in- and outside  - panorama!  - the connection between the two riads  - feeling home scale on 1 to 5 (5 is best)= 5  - breakfast is great!    Room for improvement (almost impossible)  - eating with children starts really late (about 21:00hrs) but I guess if we asked it wouldn't be a problem to eat earlier.  - same music every day (although great for the atmosphere)  - dinner we thought was a bit overpriced for what was offered compared to other restaurants.  - Wifi only in the open area and not in the rooms. (for me and my kids as social network gadget freaks it is the first thing we check). Once you have reception it was fast.    Anyway all we can say is: stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My wife and I came to Marrakech to celebrate New Years Eve. We stayed three nights at LTP and found Patrick and staff to be very helpful. As soon as we arrived we got a fantastic history of the riad restoration and were shown to our lovely room on the terrace level. Location is prime near Dar El Basha next to many fine antique shops just around the corner.    The hotel unlike many others in the medina did not gouge guests on price or force them to pay for a New Year's dinner. We felt we got tremendous value for money and even enjoyed the company of the other guests.    Though we did get lost in the souks and the surrounding areas a few times we didn't mind wandering until we found our way back. Nothing beats the surprise of walking from a dark alley through a small wooden door into this heavenly riad. We loved our stay here. My only recommendation is to sort out payment/check-out a day in advance to avoid any last minute rushing to accommodate travel schedules.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We have been staying in the riad back in september but they deserve an absolute big thumbs up! The riad is indeed hidden away in some narrow streets which is the absolute charm of it. Itnis a breath of fresh air in a crazy chaotic city; a place to relax. We have been staying in 2 different rooms as we came back to the riad after our small tour around Marroc (essaouira and ourzazate). Especially the 2nd room looked like a palace room; beautifully decorated and very nice. It is was the honeymoonsuite which we were upgraded to. The food was also very good and the atmosphere on the rooftop amazing. Excellent friendly staff. An absolute recommended place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Piotr K wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: Not really great value for money
Review_Text: The riad is impossible to find on your own from the street (even though it is quite central). The building is hidden deep down in a labirynth of dark dead ends. Presuming it may be difficult to find we ordered a driver from riad to bring us from the airport (even though they asked 20‚Ç¨ for it). The driver has not turned up and we finally found a taxi outside the airport for 12‚Ç¨. Unfortunately once dropped off in the street we were unable to find the riad. One of the hustlers who live off tourists offered help and walked us through the of small streets labirynth for 4 or 5 mins. We offered him ¬£1 for a service but he was unhappy and asked for ¬£10 for it! When we refused to pay he became aggresive and in the end we heard "f*** you!". Very unpleasant start!! As one may say this is not directly related to the riad itself (although for me it is) further issues included:  - limited hot water (which is something you DO NOT expect when you pay 125‚Ç¨/night). We stayed there over 3 nights and I complained about not having enough hot water after the first night but it only helped for one night and on the last night we had to take shower in lukewarm water again.  - small cold and dark room  - no TV  Nice building but grossly overproced and - in honesty - I would not stay there again. After this experience we decided to stay outside the medina in Ibis which was 60‚Ç¨ and offered unlimited hot water with no surprises like "f*** you!" instead of "welcome!"
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Naila London S wrote a review Dec 2011
Review_Text: We had the pleasure of staying at the Riad for 6 nights in December and had an amazing time. Patrick and his staff were so helpful and attended to our every need. My husband and i travelled with our three month old daughter and parents - we stayed in two beautifully decorated rooms and enjoyed breakfast in the courtyard. The staff were so helpful and sterilised our daughters milk bottles every day. We enjoyed an evening meal at the Riad and two of the ladies offered to look after our daughter whilst we enjoyed the meal. Khalid Mustafa Mohammed Hafsa Deba Fatima and many other ladies were so great. Ali the driver that picked us up from the airport also took us to the Atlas mountains and the trip included a stop at a true Berber carpet store Saffron Gardens and he was more than happy to stop for us to take photos. Khalid was great and drew us a simple map to get through the alley ways to the big square and it was perfect to help us get around. Do not be worried walking to the hotel as the alley ways might be dull but the Riad is truly beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: I had a wonderful stay here with my girlfriend at the end of November. The Riad is beautiful with amazing traditional artesian furniture and lots of thought having gone into its decoration by the owner Patrick. It is truly an oasis of calm situated in a great location in the middle of the bustling medina. The staff are wonderful and make every effort to making your stay as relaxed as possible - from serving Moroccan mint tea on demand to giving you fantastic tips of things to see and do around the city. A highlight was certainly the breakfast on the roof terrace in the sun each morning and we ate dinner at the riad one night which was probably one of the best meals we had during our stay in Morocco. I would certainly recommend staying at this riad and we hope to return at some stage in the future.    Dominic
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The chilled out atmosphere and the friendly staff made the experience a wonderful experience. Extremely happy with the stay and the breakfast on the roof terrace made the morning a very relaxing start.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I visited this Riad last december to escape the snow in England. It was my first trip to Marrakech and we were not let down by our choice of accommodation. We were collected from the airport and met by the owner and his staff on arrival. After a welcome pot of tea and treats we unpacked before Ishmael briefed us on the city and things to do places to eat etc. He was very helpful as was Patrick the owner.    We ate at the Riad on two nights; traditional Moroccan tagines that were of excellent quality.    The Riad is a beautiful oasis from the busy city of Marrakech!    The location of Les Trois Palmiers is close to the main square (10 minute walk) and you get there via streets of souks. We were also advised by the Riad staff on how to haggle and a rough price that tourists should expect to pay.    Would stay here again if we returned to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We spent 3 nights at this Riad two at the start of our trip and one at the end and Patrick Caroline and the team could not have done more to be helpful and charming and make us feel welcome and at home. Literally everything about it was excellent from the airport pick-up to the individual and tastefully decorated rooms the fabulous roof-terrace and gardens discreet hospitality and advice mint-tea at just the right times hours of help finding and booking a car and suggestions for shopping. The location is central a little hard to find but that is not unusual in central Marrakesh. I highly recommend this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This was a great hotel for the new town but equally only a 20minute walk to the jemaa el fna (main square and market place). The staff were really helpful and firendly i felt really looked after during the first few days when i was by myself.    We were given a really nice room with fridge and a nice balcony on the back of the hotel the pool area was nice to have as i know not all hotels in marrakech have one.    It was a shame that the safe was 3 euro's per day but the room was really safe anyway.    Overall i felt comfortable straight away and enjoyed a pleasent week here with my partner it had a laid back but attentive feel which is a perfect mix for a weeks hol when you are undecided if you want to chill all day or run all over the sites!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The French owner of this lovely riad was incredibly helpful to us during our stay. We also enjoyed an excellent meal on the first night (book in advance) - and catered for a vegan! Our room was lovely. The staff were very friendly and provided a personal and very high standard of service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad amongst the Souks - perfect for first timers
Review_Text: My partner and I spend 4 nights in Riad Les Trois Palmiers in September.  We had a free airport transfer included however I would recommend that anyone staying at this hotel arrange their transport with them....it would be near impossible to find alone.  It is in the centre of the Souks down several winding alleyways. On arrival the staff will draw you a map so you won't get lost.  The Riad itself is beautiful. The rooms are stunningly decorated comfortable and very quiet. We had a room on the 1st floor which was spacious with a beautiful shower-room.  The continental breakfast was served on the roof terrace (weather-permitting) which was lovely. We also spent many hours sunbathing on the terrace making our city break particularly relaxing.  The staff are very accomodating and are happy to hep you out in any way they can. They were particularly helpful with restaurant recommendations....our favourite was Terrace des Epices just down the road although Cafe Arabe and Dar Moha were great too.  The location of the Riad is perfect as it's right in the middle of the Medina (old town) so everywhere is within walking distance.  My only criticism of the Riad was the wi-fi strength. There were routers on the ground floor in each half of the building however due to the stone walls wi-i could only be picked up in the communal areas of the ground floor. I'm sure if routers were added to the 1st and 2nd floors this wouldn't be a problem.  Overall though we loved Marrakech and the Riad Les Trois Palmiers made the experience even more special. We will return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I stayed at this Riad for 3 nights as a gift for my mums 60th and we had a lovely time the Riad was beautiful and the staff were so helpful and so friendly it was a mixture of staying at your best friends house versus actually feeling like royaltyi really felt they went above and beyond everytime! Which was perfect for my mums birthday (but not intrusive.) eg - we turned up with an hour to meet our guide for our afternoon trip and due to my lack of french language and last minute booking had not properly received a confirmation so Patrick (Owner of Riad) happily called and arranged a place which would be suitable for us to meet our guide also they let us have our room until 6pm on our last day and the breakfast pancakes were better than those our chef cooked on our cooking class.  It was a most relaxing place to stay and after a busy day shopping there are so many places to go and relax reading a book complete serenity.  Would be perfect if you were travelling alone as they are friendly and so helpful or would be ideal for a nice trip with the other half due to the rose petals on the tables and cosy atmosphere.  The location is central enough that you are close to the busy souks less than 5 minutes but close enough to the main roads for any excursions . I would recommend getting the transfers that they offer to ensure you find the Riad the first time though.  I would recommend this riad to any friends and would definately use this Riad if i go back to Marrakech.  the only downside was the weather our weekend so we didn't get to use the roof terrace but we had a look and the view was amazing!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is a lovely riad in a fantastic location. No more than 10 minutes from the souks or the famous square and several of the other cultural must sees are easily walkable including the Majorelle Gardens. The staff are very friendly and helpful and take plenty of time to ensure you get your bearings in the maze of alley ways before you set off sight seeing.    Our room was very comfortable and spotlessly clean as was the whole building the roof terrace is beautiful and we were lucky enough to eat breakfast there even in November there are plenty of sun loungers and seats and lots of space to find your own little bit of peace.    All the food we ate at the riad was excellent and they do serve alcohol as well. There was some noise at times from other residents but it did not really bother us I think this is unavoidable when staying in this type of building.    Marrakech is a fascinating (and very noisy city) and even though we returned to the riad very late at no time did we ever feel concerned about our safety. We felt we were very well looked after during the whole of our stay and would remommend this riad to both first timers and returners to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Les Trois Palmiers for 3 nights and it's a lovely place to stay so beautifully decorated - the staff were so helpful t felt so welcoming & relaxing when you returned from days outIts in a great location for exploring the city. The breakfasts are delicious we had ours served on the roof terrace which has beautiful views of the city. I will definitely return to this Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Haven of tranquility in the middle of the Medina
Review_Text: We fell in love with this riad immediately. Well-hidden yet very central this wonderful house became our haven of tranquility during our stay in Marrakech. Everything is set and decorated beautifully and the rooftop terrace is just lovely. We spent many warm October evening sitting there and enjoying the sights and the silence. The breakfast was impeccable the service even better. The staff is amazing they really make you feel like you're at home away from home. Unfortunately we had dinner only once in this riad - it was the best dinner during one week in Morocco. We will certainly return one day.    The only reason not to give 5 stars is the fact that the room in which we stayed the first nights didn't have a door to the toilet/shower (which was luckily "around the corner"). After we took a trip around Morocco we had another (a bit more expensive) room and there we had a separate bath. So if you like privacy remember to check that out.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad, great location, fabulous staff
Review_Text: We stayed here last christmas and had a magical time. The location is perfect the staff are so nice and are always willing to offer you advice guidance ad help. The food is amazing and the tours organised by the riad were cheaper than we could find online. A minutes walk from the Riad you are surrounded by shops stalls and beautiful marrakech. Our room was small and on the very top floor which was fine for us but I would not advice anyone elderly to stay there. The riad itself is welcoming warm and an oasis you love coming home to in the evening after a day sightseeing. Thank you to the staff for such and memorable stay. We hope to come back to visit some day    Rachel and Rowan
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: gary g wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: In April 2011 our family of three had the misfortune of staying in the Alaouite room on the 1st Floor Les Trois Palmiers  During the first two nights of our stay we had only mildly warm water in which to wash. It was not until our third night that the water was a reasonable temperature and finally on the last night the water reached an acceptably warm/hot temperature for a good shower. One can appreciate the difficulty in shaving without hot water.  The drain in our shower was continually blocked. After an evening shower the water would not drain away until at least the middle of the following day despite our efforts to disperse the water as advised by the manager. It was not a nice feeling to be standing in water that failed to drain away.  Three out of the four evenings/ nights we stayed were plagued by power failures. I‚Äôm afraid I reached the end of my tether when the power failed while was in the middle of a late evening shower. Trying to find your way out of a shower in the darkness is not only daunting but downright dangerous. Unfortunately I not only slipped in the bathroom as I felt my way around I also sat on my reading glasses causing the frames to distort and be almost unwearable. Lucky for me that no serious damage was sustained.  On a positive note I would like to stress that the staff were excellent - they were courteous kind and always helpful. We reported these problems to them during our stay on a couple of occasions in the hope that some remedy could be found but they did re-occur. We then had a longer conversation with them on our departure. However it seems that the problems were outside their control and it appears that the owners have known of these problems affecting the 1st floor for some time.  In summary Les Trois Palmiers is a very nice riad with good staff and at face value the tariff of EUR 130 is reasonable. However at that tariff I do expect hot running water on tap good plumbing and a constant supply of electricity ‚Äì things that we did not always get.  The owners have since offered two nights free accommodation as compensation however they have not replied to our emails requesting alternate compensation
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: rajendra c wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: We arrived in Marrakeckh from Rabat & were met by Hicham from the Riad who walked us through these little alleyways into this dark little alley to the door of the Riad. It all looked shady & dark & dirty until you step into the doorway ! It's a totally different world inside ! The owners Patrick & Caroline have created dazzling interiors in the Morroccan fashion with exquisite details in the archtecture ! Talented local craftsmen have decorated the tiled pools & doors with the most beautiful designs. Wonderful bathrooms & spacious bedroom. The terraces are lush with greenery & generous seating. Our breakfasts were wonderful & service by Mustapha was wonderful. Delila the cook makes food equal to restaurants that charge a lot more ! Fetima & the rest of the staff were lovely ! Great location near the shopping in the medina & the main square Jemma El Fna. Seems difficult but after simple map from Hichom we got around just fine. Thanks everyone for a wonderful stay !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at this Riad in Feb/March 2011 after reading amazing reviews - we couldn't have found a better place to stay! It was an oasis of calm but close enough to all the action of the main square. The staff - Mustafa Khaled et al were absolutely wonderful and couldn't have been better hosts. The rooms were always kept clean and the meal we had in the riad was fab - thank you for catering to our vegetarian needs! Breakfast on the terrace every day was a delight. The staff were also very helpful in helping us organise a day trip to the mountains - highly recommended.    Thank you for making our stay a memorable one and for making us feel at home!    Dipak & Anj
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Arrived at the riad apro 9.30 am Monday morning.  Our driver Ali was thare to meet us as planned. We drove to the medina where we then began to walk through the alley ways I have got to be honest I thought oh my god is this for real " have I really paid to come here" I was feeling a little nervous as I had never expierenced anything like it before "this was the real morrocan life"  We walked for a few minutes until we arrived at a small wooden door.The door opened very quickly for us to be invited into what we could only describe as a tiny piece of heaven.  This beautiful tranquil place is totally amazing and relaxing.  Whatever good comments you read on trip advisor" trust us you must believe."  The owner Patrick was there to greet us and did so with genuine warmth.  The staff at the riad were amazing you are treated with the upmost respect and looked after from start to finishnothing is too much trouble for anyone.  Dahlia the cook welcomed me into her kitchen and gave me a morrocan cooking lesson showing me all the wonderful spices that are used in a typical morrocan dish. Mustaffa was there every morning to greet us for breakfast with his lovely smile nothing was too much trouble for him.  The other staff who I will mention by name are Khalid Fatima salma Hichim Chiba Hiba and Ali they will all play a fantastic and important part in making your stay as tranquil and relaxing as they did ours. They are all amazing.  To sum up our stay. Next year we will be back proberbly at the end of the year when We are both feeling at our dreariest knowing that we will leave totally recharged.  Oh just to let you all know I had nothing to be nervous about. The medina is safeand the morrocan people are lovely.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Harvey B wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: We booked this hotel through Lowcostholidays.com and it was a very good choice;4 star very reasonably priced clean comfortable airconditioned room friendly helpful staff good food and a nice swimming pool. As well as the dining room it was very pleasant eating at the tables outside by the pool.  The hotel was well located in a quiet road and yet within easy walking distance of one of the main Plazas where there was a good choice of restaurents banks buses and the tourist information office. We thoroughly enjoyed our 7 day stay; the only complaint we had was the very cramped position of the toilet up against the vanity unit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Wonderful solitude from the hubbub of the Medina!
Review_Text: Riad Les Trois Palmiers exceeded our expectations in almost every regard beautiful room idyllic surroundings superb food and absolute solitude from the hubbub of the Medina.The standout feature was your excellent staff each morning we were greeted with a warm smile and engaging conversation. We would thoroughly recommend this Riad to friends and family! N&C

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Louise d wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: This really was the perfect Riad. The staff are amazing - they are so helpful and courteous without being over powering. the Riad itself was beautifully decorated amazingly clean and perfectly located. I would definately highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Do not stay anywhere else: this Riad is amazing.
Review_Text: We have just returned from 5 fantastic days in Marrakech made perfect by staying in this beautiful Riad. About 5 minutes after we made the booking we received an email from Patrick and Caroline the owners asking us for our flight details (as they'd be picking us up from the airport) and would we like to order some dinner as we were arriving late. Every email after that was answered very promptly and everything was "not a problem".  When we arrived Isham was waiting for us at the airport. We were whisked away to the Dar El Bacha (the street). We walked down a short alley off the main pedestrian street and up to a large wooden door. Upon entering we found the most beautifully restored Riads (two made into one) that exceeded all expectations. Our room had been upgraded (for free) and was truly lovely with much needed aircon. The communal areas of the Riad were stunning: we spent a fair amount of time on the roof terrace only venturing downstairs to take a dip in one of the 2 plunge pools. We ate breakfast everyday on the roof. Breakfast consisted of more food than we could ever eat. We were served bread pastries orange juice coffee english (or Morrocan) tea fruit pancakes jams honey cheese yoghurt and more!! Mustafa carried this huge tray to our table everyday and made sure we had everything we needed. Just what you need to set you up for a mad day in the sooks and markets. Isham had hand-drawn us a map of the local area and the best routes into the Jeema El Fna (the main market).  The Riad is ideally placed for everything. It's a 1 minute walk out onto the main streets. Then 5 minutes to the main markets sooks and tourist spots. All the time you are passing beautiful shops and street sellers whilst trying to dodge the many mopeds that scoot past you as you walk!!  A few recommendations.....  1/ the cafe Arabe. It's a few minutes from the riad (Isham will draw it onto the map for you). The food is Morrocan and European. A welcome change from the Tagines and some lovely pasta for a vegetarian. The food is good but it's the roof terrace that makes this place. We booked on the afternoon as we walked home from the market. It's worth it to book a spot on the roof. We ate sat on lovely comfy sofas with lanterns hanging over the tables. Beautiful setting. There is a bar on the roof if you don't want to eat but fancy a beer in a great setting. We went back a few nights later to do just that!!  2/ The Comptoir restaurant in the new city. It's about a 20 minutes walk away (we walked back and got a taxi in). Great restaurant not cheap but not really expensive and well worth the visit. The food was amazing and we were treated to a proper belly dancing show right in the restaurant!  3/ Don't change any money in the UK. The exchange rate is about 10 Dirhams to the pound. It's about 13 in Marrakech. Isham will pinpoint a bureau de change on your map and it was always open and about 5 minutes from the Riad.  4/ At the top of the street to the Riad is a small kiosk with a picture the laughing cow logo above it. We bought water from here but my partner noticed that the top didn't appear to be intact and we wondered if the bottles were just filled with tap water. We weren't ill at all during our visit but we stayed away from ice in drinks brushed our teeth in bottled water and always made sure we had a bottle for drinks in the room. This seemed to work. I would buy water from one of the many other little shops and just make sure the seal in unbroken.  5/ Take comfy shoes and something to cover your shoulders with (ladies only!). Our guide book said no shorts but every tourist was wearing them. I tried to make sure my knees were covered and didn't take any short skirts or dresses. Everyone was so friendly and helpful during our stay apart from one very minor incident where we encountered a guide (a passerby who wants to show you to wherever you want to go for a fee). We tried to say that we were fine and I put my hand up to wave him away. He reacted to this by shouting the word "woman" and continuing to address my partner. We ignored him and walked away. He wasn' intimidating but it sets the tone for how some western women are viewed I think.  6/ As you leave the alleyway from the Riad you would turn left to head to the main areas. If you turn right there were a few shops with one we visited in particular. It was a shop full of tagines and ceramics. The prices are fixed so it's great if you don't like haggling or good for gauging prices so you know how much to pay if you want to try your hand at Marrakech negotiations! We did both!!  7/ There are cats everywhere in Marrakech. It's actually quite upsetting as mostly they are street cats and look in need of a good meal and a comfy bed. I'm an animal lover and a bit prone to letting these sights upset me. If you are the same prepare yourself. On the plus side the stall holders do seem to feed them and apparently there is a UK charity that is trying to help keep the population down.  I hope this review helps. We can't recommend this Riad highly enough. Thanks mainly to Patrick Caroline Isham Mustafa Dalalia and all of the other lovely members of staff that made our trip truly wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Paulo F wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: This was my third time in Marrakesh. First was 25 year ago during an 'Imperial cities' tour just 1 day here. Second was with a company event; 5 days in a 5 start hotel and quality entertainment through the stay. In both occasions going into the Medina was like leaving our western view of the world and stepping into something that was somewhat strange to us that you watch as an external observer.    Therefore this time I wanted to see it from the inside out. Find a nice hotel inside the medina have to find your way through the narrow alleys eventually get lost and from there come out to the streets. Believe me you see Marrakech with very different eyes I would say the right ones.    The riad was beautiiful the owners Caroline and Patrick very nice hosts who provided us with the essential what to do and how to move around. Mustafa was particularly helpful in every detail and requests. And the food was excellent (thank you Dalila for that and for the quick cooking course).    I don't know if I can be back once again in the future but I will surely recommend it to all my friends.    Thank you for the unforgettable stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Joan C wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Our stay at this Riad was fabulous! The owner Patrick and the entire staff took such good care of us. We felt we were with family! The food was delicious the room was wonderful the courtyards and various other sitting areas were so comfortable. We were with a group of 11 people and we stayed 9 days. Every day was wonderful coming back to the Riad. It felt like home! I highly recommend this place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We just spent 9 glorious days in Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha Riad in mid-September and it far surpassed our every expectation! I began contact with Patrick the owner of the Riad back in March since I was bringing 11 people with me on a retreat to Marrakech. Every email I sent was promptly returned and everything I asked for was answered "not a problem." We rented out the entire Dar El Bacha side of the Riad (5 rooms) and 3 rooms in Trois Palmiers.    The Riad is located in a fantastic area of the old city called Dar El Bacha where there are wonderful antique stores and a fabulous Hammam called "Hammam de la Rose" just 2 minutes walking. We all walked day and night back and forth to the famous souk and Jemma El Fna square without any problem. With the hand-drawn map they provided it was easy. The Riad itself is beautiful and the pictures on the site don't do it justice. It's earthy very clean has beautiful tile work with stunning fountains lovely flora and fauna with sitting nooks everywhere to relax or be social. There were always fresh flowers in our rooms which all were decorated differently and made each room unique. The bathrooms and showers were great and the shampoo gel and lotions were some of the best I've ever smelled. The staff at the Riad were unparalleled and took care of our every need with such grace and kindness.    Our group had yoga classes on the roof amazing daily group breakfasts mint tea and pastries each afternoon and we had 2 dinners and 3 lunches there as well. The food is magnificent some of the best we had in all of Marrakech. Making sure that 11 people are well cared for was made much easier because of Patrick's help and the fantastic staff attention to every detail. I will definitely be going back there on my own as well as taking another group in the near future- Inshallah! Thank you to the entire staff for making our stay one we will never forget!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Patrick and his wife have created a magical reprieve in the middle of the medina in Marrakech. It was like being in a fantasy. Attention to detail was superb as was the service. Simply wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Kirstie G wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: My friend and I were fairly well travelled but had never been to Morocco. We had read lots of guide books but I still don't think I was really prepared for what Marrakech would be like. The roads were chaos and on entering the medina soon became too narrow to pass in a car. We unloaded our luggage into a handcart which was pushed down ever narrowing alleys full of donkeys souks with their salesmen and scooters until we stopped at a dark door. This door opened into an open courtyard with a deep pool and sunloungers. No matter how hot dusty and noisy it was outside the other side of that dark door it was always cool airy and quiet. In fact the only noise came from the other guests.  Our room was always clean and airy and we didn't need the aircon even in June. Getting the flow and temperature on the shower could be quite complicated but the free products were lovely.  We took our breakfast and sunbathed on the roof terrace which was luxurious with sunbeds towels straw hats and magazines. The view was amazing with rooftops and satelite dishes minarets and in the distance the Atlas mountains.  The staff took care to make sure we had instructions that made sure we could get to the landmarks and back without getting lost. They were always there but not obtrusive and served us beautiful breakfasts and a traditional evening meal. They also made excellent recommendations of places to go and the swallows at sunset on the roof of Cafe Arabe whilst drinking cocktails is pretty much unbeatable.  This is a well placed riad from which we did almst everything on our huge to do list without coming home exhausted. I would definitely stay here again either to visit Marrakech again or to use it as a base to travel further.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: The Best Part of our Stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: My husband and I were on our honeymoon visiting Morocco for the first time. The staff at Les Trois Palmiers could not have been more attentive and helpful. From pick up to departure we felt right at home. The location of the riad is perfect; it is a great retreat from the craziness of the Medina. The rooftop terrace is a great place to relax or have a meal.    A big thank you to Patrick Caroline Hicham Moustafa Khaled and all the ladies for making our trip a memorable one!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Caroline B wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Trois Palmiers for three nights in early September as we were attending a wedding in Marrakech. The Riad is beautiful very clean and well kept the location is excellent very central and everything is accessible but the best part has to be the staff who are incredibly friendly welcoming and helpful. They made our stay in Marrakech very easy and relaxing and I will definitely go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed at Riad Les Trois Palmiers for 3 nights and it's absolutely fantastic. It's beautifully decorated in a great location for exploring the city and the staff could not be nicer.  The breakfasts are delicious we had ours served on the roof terrace which has beautiful views of the city. We had a free upgrade to a lovely room which was very comfortable with a huge bathroom air conditioning etc.The Riad itself is down a few windy streets but the staff are more than happy to draw you a map which was very useful.    I would recommend the Riad arranging your transfer to and from the airport as it works out cheaper than flagging down a taxi.    Overall i could not recommend this Riad enough and would definitely stay here again if I ever return to this fantastic city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I have been here only for one night during a business trip in spring time.  The location is perfect in the hearth of Marrakesh old city. This means you can get lost if you don't memoryze the street of your hotel! But this is something tipycal in Marrakesh!  When you entr just a small door you will find inside a wonderful tipycal riad with sevel floors a nice court with free internet.  Rooms are very nice it makes you think about how was a bedroom in the imperial Marrakesh! Bathrooms are the best part!  The only negative point is that the wook door and windows are not very well insulated: this is not a problem on summer but in winter is a little cold.  The rooms are very clean and the staff very well trained friendly end high-class.  Definitively suggested!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this riad and would recommend it to anyone staying in Marrakech - we'll definitely stay here again if we ever come back. The decor is lovely though simple and understated; breakfast was excellent and the staff will serve it whatever time you wish - the same goes for dinner.  The biggest plus about this riad is the staff. They really cannot do enough to help and genuinely seem to want you to feel at home here. We arranged a pick-up from the airport - I'd definitely recommend this as I don't think we would have found it on our own. Before we ventured out into the city one of the staff Hicham sat us down to give us some foolproof directions to the main sights of Marrakech - this was invaluable. The riad is well located - it's only a few minutes walk to the Djemaa el Fna square and the main souks. Any time we returned to the riad the staff were on hand and were keen to chat about where we'd been and how we were enjoying the city. Mint tea and Moroccan pastries were also provided! The staff were so friendly and helpful and really did make us feel at home .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The hotel was hard to find in the Marrakech labyrint but the moment we entered the 1.50 m high door we entered an amazing palace. Everything was taken care of by Isham and Patrick. We felt like sultans! When we are back in Marrakech we will definately stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I have been meaning to get the chance to write a quick review since coming back from Marrakesh. Me and my wife had a fab time there we found this Riad excellent as we were newly weds and I had spoken to the owners we were given a lovely surprise when we arrive they had upgraded our room for free :)    All the staff are brilliant there especially Khalid Mustaffa and Ishmail. Just want to thank you guys again for being so great!    Location was great a bit scary at first as pretty hard to navigate around alleys but the hand drawn map was brilliant. Getting lost is all part of the fun there :p    Best wishes Keval (UK)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Stayed at this riad for the last night of our Moroccan adventure - a touring holiday with our teenage son. Patrick the owner met us at the end of the road and led us to the riad down windy streets. Beautiful surroundings with attention to detail and a serene and calming atmosphere. Wish we had started our holiday here and spent more nights. We had the ground floor room which was plenty big enough for 3. May be a little noisy at busy times as sofas right ouside the 2 windows and also close to one of the breakfast areas but not a problem when we stayed. The roof terraces were truly beautiful with many plants. This riad is joined to the equally charming one next door. Plunge pool impressed our son as quite deep. No complaints at all but if we we were being really really picky the one thing we commented on was the jugs for milk water and coffee in the morning as they were not in keeping with the quality of the furnishings in the riad. Would love to have stayed longer!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Global Dragon wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Text: We stayed at the Les Trois Palmiers for 3 nights and we changed two rooms while there. The first one (Beldi) was quite small but very nicely furnished and the second one (Koutoubia) was fabulous! Lovely bathroom (massive bath) great ceiling and comfy bed.    The Riad as you can read from other reviews is on a dark and dingy hallway and so the first impressions are not the best. Once you get used to it though you realize that Marrakech is like that everywhere and it is quite safe. We had no issue with safety and the staff were really helpful on advising us what to do and where to go.    I loved the style it is really tastefully done both courtyards are really pretty and tranquil. The food was great they accommodate us at the last minute and they prepare a fantastic dinner. Breakfast on the roof was lovely; everyday we had different Moroccan food and continental food so it was a great mix.    I would definitely recommend it to everybody who is willing to explore Marrakesh and looking for a almost authentic experience in the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Becky L wrote a review Aug 2011
Review_Title: Amazing riad - we will definately be back!
Review_Text: We made a booking for Riad Depices - a different property owned by the same people but we were 'upgraded' to this Riad at no extra cost. This is one of the best places we have ever stayed the staff were absolutely fantastic polite friendly and very helpful. In particular a man called Mustapha who welcomed us on our first night and drew us a brilliant map that stopped us from getting lost! Breakfast was lovely lots of variety fruit pastries jam cheese etc. and home made yogurt that was delicious. Our sheets and room were cleaned and changed every day and the whole place is immaculate. Beautiful decor - everything is of the highest standard and all local crafts have been employed in the decoration.  On a night this riad was very quiet but if you are a very light sleeper take some ear plugs wherever you are in Morocco to avoid being woken by the call to prayer. I liked hearing it but it might bother some people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed for a few nights during our honeymoon in Morocco and thoroughly enjoyed our stay! The staff could not have been more helpful or friendly - nothing as too big an ask. The riad is down many little alleys but is just a beautiful tranquil escape from the business of the city. Only a 5/10 minute walk from the main area's of town yet so peaceful.    Lovely big rooms well equipped with en-suite air con tv safe etc.. decorated in a beautiful and traditional way a true Moroccan experience!    Would highly recommend this riad for a stay in Marrakech great base to explore a fasinating city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We had stayed here last year for several nights and just loved it.    This year we returned to Morocco but only stayed a night in Marrakech. Nevertheless we simply had to make that one night a stay at Les Trois Palmiers.    The room (upstairs) was great with a wonderful bathroom the service was fantastic the food excellent and dinner on the roof-top terrace is a must for all romantics.    Can't wait to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay at this Riad in May. We had a room on the "El Bacha" part of the Riad.The room was on the roof terrace and had its own private terrace which was great to enjoy a bottle of wine in the evening (brought to us by the wonderful Mustapha). The kindness and helpfulness of the staff and the owners are what made our stay at this Riad such a special and memorable experiencel. We highly recommend this Riad and will definitely stay there again if we ever go back to Marrakech..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is an authentic and comfortable Riad located just off Dar el Bacha at the northern end of the Medina and I cannot recommend it highly enough. Myself and my partner spent the week here in July and what really sets this Riad apart is the hospitality and friendliness of Imsham and all the staff to make your stay comfortable and hassle free. The beds are comfy and breakfast is served on the roof terrace and there's plenty of space to hang out and relax after a long day in the souks.    Don't be put off by the relatively low pricing... this place is an absolute gem.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Like being at home-without the housework
Review_Text: From the moment we stepped into the Riad we were made to feel at home the service could not have been better. Breakfast served up on the terrace was divine a relaxing place to escape the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.  We enjoyed a delightful meal in the Riad on our last night after a wonderful day in the mountains-organised by Patrick the owner  We will be back!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We booked a stay in this riad for four nights with my wife and we can warmly recommend the place. The location is excellent in the old city of medina. Upon arriving we were met outside near the riad since the place is not easy to find by yourself. Luckily you will get a small map to help you wander around the medina. The riad itself is a beautiful place with unbelievable work put to all the interior details. We ate a couple of dinners and lunches in the riad and we recommend those as well. The breakfast is excellent especially the yoghurt. The staff is very friendly and took a good care of us.    Our first room had trouble with air conditioning but we were immediately given another room with working air conditioning. This was essential with the scorching outside temperatures of 46C (115F) every day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Genuine friendliness and hospitality... you can't buy that sort of service
Review_Text: I only found out I was off to Marrakech a week before I was going so had no time to do my usual research of somewhere to stay. So a surprise trip the Riad had been chosen and I wasn‚Äôt disappointed. Right from the start the staff were outstanding. My bag had been left at Gatwick but Pat the Riad owner was soon on the case and although he couldn‚Äôt make it get to Morocco any quicker he made a call to a guy he knew at Air Maroc which meant that my details were taken quickly and we could all get to the Riad.  We approached the Riad down winding alleyways that we wondered how we would get out of (Left Left Right and a hand drawn map from Hicham!!) stopping off for a look in the local bakery on the way and finally being welcomed by staff with sweets and Moroccan tea. No time to waste Pat showed us around his lovingly restored Riad with photo‚Äôs on the wall traditional furniture and descriptions of the painstaking creative detail of the making of the mosaic in the Palm filled courtyard behind the plunge pool.  We were taken into each room but one had a young Muslim couple in there which I felt shouldn‚Äôt be disturbed. But Pat ushered us in only to my utter surprise and amazement to find that this couple were my friends!! My partner had been arranging this trip for seven months and Pat and his staff made sure that they added to the surprise: they had acquired some traditional Muslim dress for my friends to dress up in!  We then toured the three flights of stairs with rooms off the inner courtyard as Pat led us each to our rooms. They were all beautiful with nice touches of fruit flowers and petals scattered on the bed as well as wall hangings artefacts and rugs and amazing bathrooms. They had also allowed my friends in to decorate the room with birthday paraphernalia. And so it went on‚Ä¶.  We had the whole Riad to ourselves and we were told to treat it as our home which the thirteen of us did. Breakfast was served on the terrace and each day we had fresh bread from the local bakery yoghurt honey jams fruit cheese a variety of teas and coffee and each day something different such as pancakes donuts and crumpets.  We were waited on by the staff who were more than just polite ‚Äì they were positively friendly genuine and remembered our names as well as being able to have a laugh and a joke with us. They never once seemed to tire over our endless requests for drinks (up three flights of stairs) ‚Äì even in the early hours of the morning as our festivities continued and I really thank them for that as other places may not have treated us so well.  I also thank them for the effort they put into my birthday meal. To start with there were drinks and nibbles on the terrace as I opened my presents and cards followed by a meal for us all in the courtyard. The table setting was brilliant (Pat had to stop me walking in on the staff setting it so as not to spoil the surprise) a little gift left for each of us the great food lovingly prepared by the ladies in the kitchen who came out for an applause at the end the wine flowed and everyone had a great time and then the lights were dimmed when they brought out my birthday cake. I was well and truly spoilt not just by my friends but by Pat and the staff at the hotel.  I would wholeheartedly recommend this Riad and aside from my very subjective view it‚Äôs location is also good only a 10 minute walk to the square with restaurants and bars along the way. Coming back after the heat traffic and souks to this Riad was truly welcoming ‚Äì a tranquil and serene place in the middle of the medina which made it very hard for you to leave at times as you had everything you needed there. Sunbeds adorned the top terrace and we were waited on for all our needs and a plunge pool in the courtyard meant that cooling off wasn‚Äôt an issue after a few hours in the sun. Pat even got a driver to take me back to the airport to collect my late baggage. This place really knows how to treat its guests with genuine friendliness and hospitality and you can‚Äôt buy that sort of service.  Thank you Pat Mustafa Hicham Haled and all the staff at Riad Les Trois Palmiers ‚Äì you made my birthday five days very special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect Hotel, faultless in every way!
Review_Text: Myself and two girlfriends went for a 4 night stay to Marrakech on 5th June and stayed at this Riad.    Upon arrival in Marrakech it was pretty much as I had anticpated with the traffic different modes of transport (and ways of driving). There were carts donkeys horse and carriages cars motor bikes (among others) driving any direction they pleased and moreso on the pavements!!............ quite funny when you look back!    The approach to the Riad is very weird in that it is just dirty alleyway after dirty alleyway all meandering in different directions. If it werent for Isha coming to meet and greet us and take us we would definitely not have found it. Albeit when we did approach the alleyway to where the riad's two front doors were I was a little apprehensive. But oh my goodness when that large wooden door opened there were smells of yasmin orange and incense wafting through the door. I couldnt believed what I was walking in to. It was like a sanctuary a spa a haven of tranquility!    We were shown around the hotel and to our room. We had a triple room (being 3 girls) and there was ample space in the room for us all. The bathroom was adequate with plenty of lovely hot water and bathrobes if we wanted them.    On the second evening we ate at the Riad. The food was really lovely beautifully presented served and cooked and very reasonably priced 22euro pp for a three course meal.    We were told by the people who worked there constantly to treat this as our home and to be honest we felt like it was our home for the time we stayed there.    If I do go back to Marrakech I will almost definitely stay at this hotel. The staff are without doubt the most attentive generous and genuinely kind people I have ever come across in any stay in any country in the world. Caroline and Patrick are very lucky they have such wonderful staff!!    Julie Thornton Hull England
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for four nights. The rooms are decorated nicely and the bed is comfortable. I would recommend earplugs for light sleepers. The other guests retired a little later than we did so there was some noise during the night. The breakfast included: fresh orange juice coffee or tea pastries homemade yogurt fresh fruit and bread with butter and jam.  Mustafa was very hospitable and helpful in recommending sights to see restaurants etc. He even drew us a detailed map so we wouldn't get lost. Thankfully we did have help finding the place. The people in Marrakesh are very friendly and more than willing to help you find your way if you happen to get lost. I highly recommend staying at the Riad Les Trois Palmiers.  Driving in the Old City was like a scene from an Indiana Jones movie. We didn't spend any time outside of the Old City except to drive from the Casa Blanca airport to Marrakesh and one time to drive around the city wall. Consequently we found our rental car to be very unnecessary especially since we could have flown directly into Marrakesh. The airport is just 7 miles away.  Lastly this Riad as well as most restaurants (Cafe Arabe was an exception) and vendors accept only cash payment.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Beautiful decor clean comfortable and tasteful accommodation. Very relaxing atmosphere. Walking distance to main sights but in a quiet convenient location.  Brilliant service - all staff very welcoming helfpul and friendly.  Tasty breakfast with fruit juices yoghurt tea coffee pastries jam honeypancakes and lovely bread from the local baker.  We also had an evening meal for a birthday celebration - again tasty ample and beautifully laid out.  There are many thoughtful gestures on the part of staff which made this suprise birthday visit a very special one for which myself and friends have some great lasting memories. Thank you to Patrick Caroline Mustapha Khaled Isham (probably all spelt wrong) and the ladies who cooked and cleaned for such a lovely stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I was here in November on a mother daughter trip to Marrakech. Staying at this riad completely made our trip. Everyone from the chef in the kitchen to the driver who led us into the riad for the first time treated us like family. Our room was well appointed and was carefully taken care of every day. The riad itself is beautiful and the owners have some very entertaining stories about how they remodeled and designed it from the ground up.    The best part of our stay was having breakfast on the terrace each morning and watching the sun rise over the city. While a bit confusing to find at first soon we were navigating the derb to the riad like locals and always felt extremely safe comfortable and welcome. We also had a very memorable meal there under the 3 palms which was delicious. The next day we were invited to the kitchen to learn how it was prepared which was just as exciting as any cooking lesson. This is a very special place a true home away from home in a magical city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: great choice with fantastic service and food.
Review_Text: ok.first of all very delighted with choice of riad.clean and tidystaff amazingmustafa and ishmel were fantasticMustafa if he was any more laid back he would never get uphahhaha which was a far cry from my place of work which is intense and uninvitingfood was brilliant and rooms were clean and tidy.location was spot on.breakfast on the terrace amazing everydaygenerally a great experiance in the bizzare world of marrakesh.food in the riad was spot on lovely tagines and great service and cous cous.we will be back with family within 2 years.well done team.and the drives who took us to and from the airport.loved every minute of our stay.thanksgreat time.never forgotten.10/10
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A great 5 days spent in a quality riad
Review_Text: We came here to celebrate my partners 40th birthday and stayed in Les Trios Palmiers for 5 nights. There were 13 in total in our party and we were made to feel very welcome indeed. Pat the owner came to the airport to collect some of the party and gave us some info about Marrakech as we headed to the riad which made us feel welcomed and relaxed.    The riad is located off a busy thorough-fare and down a couple of shabby looking alleyways which you get used to very quickly. Things suddenly change however once you get through the entrance door of the riad. You enter an ornate courtyard which has a small pool to one side and traditional seating areas in the open and in the smaller rooms to each side. A feeling of tranquillity descends once inside. The riad consists of 3 levels with an open terrace on the top floor (there is no roof). The first floor is where most of the rooms are with an additional two on the top and another one on the ground floor. The open terrace on the top is where we all took breakfast everyday as a group but I imagine this could be taken in the ground floor courtyard if requested.
