Breakfast was a continental affair with orange juice tea (English & Moroccan) coffee pastries yoghurt and fresh fruit. The bread rolls were from the bakery down the nearby alley ‚Äì very fresh.    There are also several sun beds on the roof terrace area and for those serious sun worshipers there was a final mini roof terrace right at the very top of the building up some steep wooden steps.    Detail is everything here and you see it in all aspects of the renovation. From mosaic tiles to authentic fixtures and fittings doors windows and ornate furnishings - lots of things have been meticulously thought about. Its not only the detail of the building that‚Äôs been thought about attention to guests needs seems to be the ethos of this establishment.    As there were 13 in our group we had ‚Äòexclusive‚Äô use of the entire riad and the staff were very accommodating to all our requests many of which involved ordering drinks late at night on the roof terrace. Our initiation into the riad was a tour of all the rooms and some history about its renovation from Pat which was followed by traditional mint tea for all. This was followed by a lesson in orientation of the local area using hand drawn maps from Hicham.    For the birthday celebrations I‚Äôd arranged a meal in the riad. Half the party were vegetarian and this wasn‚Äôt a problem for them to organise. The staff also added some nice touches as well by placing a gift for each member of the party at the table. Celebrations went on later after that and Mustafa was happy to keep pouring the wine and bringing beer throughout the evening. Not sure how much noise was made but having exclusive use of all the riad meant that we didn‚Äôt disturb other guests. The other riad (El Bacha) is next door and can be accessed via Les Trois Palmiers but we generally stayed in Trois Palmiers.    Overall the general consensus by all who came was that we‚Äôd stayed in an excellent well run friendly quality riad. All the rooms were of a high standard and were clean tidy and comfortable with different individual touches in each one. A definite recommendation for couples and groups alike and a memorable place for a birthday celebration.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We had an exceptional stay at the Riad and received exceptional service from all staff members. Moustafa was ready to prepare our early breakfasts before our excursions. The owners were very friendly and made it a must to meet and greet us personally everyday. Loved everything!

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: An absolute gem of a Riad - amazing location and staff - book it!!
Review_Text: Our first visit to Marrakech was truly memorable! Riad Les Trois Palmiers is an amazing peaceful and welcoming retreat after a day in the crazy city !!! The staff are fantastic who gave us unvaluable advise about the city and fantastic service.  The chef is a gem! served us beautiful food and we were greeted us every day with a smile ! The best food in Marrakech ! we tried else where but came back to Dalila and the  team ! Our room was beautiful and will return when we are ready to conquer the atlas  Mountains ! They even sorted our excursions out for us!  Thank you to all the team I will miss everything !!!

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Fantastic riad, real luxury, with a dissapointment in the end
Review_Text: Absolutely great riad fantastic Moroccan architecture and interior design. A lot of style at every single point giving a feeling of pleasure all the time. Beautiful room (ours) going directly into the patio great roof terrace where the excellent breakfast was served (except one day when the weather was not good). Very romantic dinner highly recommended. Location is OK about 10-15 minutes walk from Jemma El Fna. Staff very freindly (Moustafa was our favourite Hirsham also very good)  EXCEPT  that in the end offered to arrange a taxi and completely unnecessary and very disappointingly tried to earn couple of euros on us as the guests. For a taxi to the train station which is with the meter less than Dr 10 and without certainly not more than Dr20 (we took it several times) one of the staff arranged in a hurry to get it for Dr 70!!! Not really about money but about feeling of being cheated. Could have expected that from a taxi driver or anybody in the street but not from until then a very professional and nice staff. Even worse before taking taxi we were asked to stand behind a little truck in the street - we hoped this should serve to protect us from taxi charging much from obvious foreigners but instead it was the way to arrange with the taxi driver to charge more and probably divide later. Shameful!  However apart from this bad episode which left the bitter taste in the end the rest was really perfect and therefore the riad deserves to be very highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The staff of Riad Les Trois Palmiers understands the meaning of hospitality. From the moment you arrive until you leave the Riad the staff accommodate your every need. My wife and I recently spent five nights at the Riad and couldn't have been more pleased with the service provided by the entire staff especially Irsham and Mustafa. After having a flight cancelled due to a protest/strike by Royal Air Maroc these gentlemen welcomed us back to the riad without a reservation and worked feverishly to help us resolve our issues and book a new flight for the next day. The Riad is the picture of relaxation and tranquility just a few blocks from the hustle and bustle of the souks. The rooms are comfortable and decorated in traditional Moroccan trim. The staff provide excellent recommendations about sights/ restaurants/events to enjoy. We will definitely return to Riad Les Trois Palmiers!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: good, but nothing exceptional (as many people seem to believe)
Review_Text: Besides a minority of guests I see a real waste of superlative adjectives for this riad. And actually I selected it for the expectional wonders described here on tripadvisor but after having seen the riad and lived there...well I do not know whether these people is ingenuous or has hearing and/or olfaction problems or simply gets enchanted by some stylish piece of furniture. Probably most people tends to convince themselves that they had an incomparable vacation in any case. I do not want ti be misunderstood: the riad is very good from many point of views first of all the rich breakfast the kindness of the staff and the position but absolutely out of standard (talking about quality/price ratio) from other points of view. Which ones? For instance our bathroom emanated an intense sewer stink (and it was not a matter of the days I stayed there since there was an electric perfume permanently plugged in the wall socket) that reached the sleeping area the shower sink did not work properly the blankets were never changed in 6 days (and were not exactly snow-white). But the most annoying for us was the noise made by the other guests after dinner: we never managed to close our eyes before 12.30 AM: laughs and screams of excited guests (probably those that then write excellent reviews) in one case lasted until 1 AM without that nobody invited them to keep quiet (or to go back to Jemaa el Fna). And sometimes the show started again in the morning when some guest decided to have breakfast in the court at 8 AM (not exactly the top after having been waked up by the muezzin at 5.30 AM - but this is just normal). I understand that hearing other people is unavoidable in a structure like that of a riad but exactly for this reason the owners should impose clear and simple rules to be absolutely respected by their guests. I was in similar structures and this did not happen and it is not a matter of higher standard but of good sense. After two nigths I explained the situation to one of the guys of the staff and he told me that the guests were invited to keep silence after 11 PM but the night after the show continued. I thought I had reached a solution after having talked directly to one of the most screaming ladies but evidently other guests joined that same day to make my effort vain. And the truth is that I was not advised of this "rule of silence" when I checked in so I guess nobody is. Concerning the terrace it is really very beautiful. But please people do not exaggerate: other three friends of ours were in Marrakech in those same days in other riads in central position so we could visit their places. They spent less than us and in their terraces they could even had a bath in a sort of Jacuzzi. In conclusion I believe this is a nice and comfortable riad but really overrated: if you want stay here at all costs probably the best choice in terms of quality/price ratio is asking for the cheapest (and smallest) rooms on the roof that are likely also those less affected by noise.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My husband and I just returned from a 5 day stay at the Riad Les Trois Palmiers and highly recommend it. From the moment we were picked up at the airport until our departure we have never felt more cared for by any hotel staff. The rooms are really nicely decorated and comfortable and the rooftop terrace was fantastic. Breakfast was terrific too - coffee fresh orange juice yogurt & special Moroccan breads - and we loved eating it up on the terrace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A most enjoyable stay with friendly helpful staff
Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights in April 2011. Like a lot of riads it is located down a dingy alleyway and all you see is a front door. However through the door is a very smart light and comfortable courtyard with three palm trees growing (hence the name...) as well as a (chilly) dunking pool. There are about 8 rooms. Ours was very comfortable and fitted out in Moroccan style. The staff are really delightful. Breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace. Well located about a 10 min walk from the main square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A beautiful Riad surpasses all expectations. An aura of tranquility in the heart of the bustling Medina. Wonderful roof terrace with lots of nooks and cranies loved the touch of having straw hats provided on each sun bed! Service was friendly an excellent food wonderful breakfast was a real treat with freshly squeezed orange juice and real coffee. Hicham's hand drawn map and directions were so useful don't know what we'd have done without them as Riad is down a maze of dark narrow unmarked alley ways and there is no sign. Hicham organised a trip for my daughter and myself to the mountains in the Riad's own car with their own driver excellent day out good to get away from the hustle and bustle. This was excellent value. I would recommend this Riad to anyone who appreciates the finer things in life.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This riad was what made our first visit to Marrakech so special. We couldn't have asked for a warmer welcome or to be better looked after. The place itself is lovely location perfect for diving straight into the souks and the food is excellent. Definitely have dinner here at least one night (if not every night) - it was our best meal of the trip. You can always try lunch in lots of other places if you like eating out.  Can't recommend this place highly enough - don't look anywhere else - book this one!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We recently spent 3 delightful nights in Riad Les Trois Palmiers. The riad's owner Patrick was travelling but Hicham and Moustafa made our visit perfect. Their welcome and service were extraordinary. The decor at the riad is beautiful. Our room was spacious and lovely and there was a wonderful bright patio area right outside where afternoon tea or coffee and pastry were regularly on offer.    We ate all three of our dinners at the riad. The meals were delicious and served graciously. The hotel is a haven away from the manic fever of Place Jamaa El Fna.    We met Patrick on the last morning of our visit and he was a welcoming as his staff. In sum the riad was an important part of why we loved Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: The best place I have ever stayed
Review_Text: This was without a doubt one of the nicest places I have ever stayed. The owners and staff are so friendly and make you feel as if you are at home. The riad is beautiful and so clean it is like a little paradise within a crazy and busy city! It was such a pleasure to arrive back at the Riad each day. Birds were singing and flying around in the courtyard the plunge pool and palms give it an exotic and tranquil atmosphere and the many different rooms mean you can have your own space if you want it.    One piece of advice would be to eat at the riad in the evenings at least once! The food and service was incredible. The breakfasts are simple but lovely. The homemade yogurt with honey was delicious!    I couldn't recomment this riad more! Please go and enjoy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: An amazing break in a wonderful Riad in a great location.
Review_Text: We have just returned from an amazing short break in Marrakesh. We stayed in this beautiful Riad in El Bache which has been very tastefully restored and refurbished while retaining many origional features. The owners a french couple called Patrick and Caroline who speak perfect English- have created a perfect balance of the personal touch while allowing you the freedom to feel relaxed and at home during your stay. They were on-hand when you needed them as well as being very friendly and informative. Stepping through the origionally featured door from the dark alleyways into an Oasis of beauty and taste. The staff were all friendly nothing seemed a problem for them- as if they are honered to serve you. They can give you information of the local areas- provide maps hints and tips. Breakfast can be served to you where ever you wish. We had freshly squeezed juice coffee a variety of croisants breads pancakes yoghurt and fresh fruit. We had ours on the lovely roof top terrace or alternativly there are many 'alcoves' and rooms- some comfortable and others opulent. The room we stayed in was breath-taking with tasteful decoration high ceilings a very large comfortable bed.here was plenty of storage space for clothes and provided clothes hangers and a hairdryer. I travelled with my husband and we did not want to come home. I would recommend this to anyone. The only problem would be if you cannot manage stairs- unless you requested a ground floor room. The roads in the area prehaps may cause some difficulties to wheel chair users or baby's in prams due to many broken uneven pavements in the area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is very hard to find but the locals were very helpful (for a price!) The Riad is very peaceful and traditionally furnished. The staff are very helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Judie s wrote a review Mar 2011
Review_Title: delightful oasis with great staff - in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: This riad was just lovely. Patrick was very welcoming and gave us a potted history of the riad and its restoration. It is a typical riad with traditional rooms a sunny rooftop terrace and the highest viewpoint in sight- perfect for watching the sunset and listening to the evening call to prayer which is so fantastic in Marrakech. The food was delicious and the vegetables bought fresh each day from the vegetable souk. Everything was spotless and there were lovely Moroccan toiletries in glass jars in the bathroom. Everybody was so helpful and we could have not had a better stay. Isham (front of house) was very informative. We love Marrakech and we love this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: + location 10min from main square tea for free    - absolutely overpriced accomodation and food!!!  only one "receptionist" speaks english and it is hard to catch him siphon cluttered with hairs (disgusting) 3 power outages in one day ( only in this riad ) they will manage taxi for you to the airport for 100 MAD but they gave taxi driver only 20 MAD - incredible!!! Giant ants in room etc etc...bad bad bad    You can easily find better and cheaper accomodation in Maroco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect and peaceful haven in a great location
Review_Text: My friend and I had a wonderful stay in this beautiful riad in the old part of the city. The friendly welcome and the consistently attentive servce made our stay really special. The food both dinner and breakfast was delicious and the decor was traditional and spotlessly clean. Having spent a few days at the coast on Morocco we are coming back to Marrakech to stay here for another night! I wholeheartedly recommend it!

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfectly located haven of tranquillity in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I stayed at Riad Les Trois Palmiers for 3 nights. We were so glad we chose this riad out of the hundreds available! It is very conveniently located near both Jamaa el Fna and the maze of souks and it is easy to find once you have been there once (walk down Dar El Bacha from the taxi drop-off turn left down Derb Tizougarine [which is spelt differently - watch out!] Then take the second left then second right. It is either of the first two doors on your right on the same street as Riad Dalia.) I felt very safe in this area even late at night.    The place itself was wonderful. Look at the pictures and you'll get a good idea of what the Riad looks like. Open spaces filled with natural light beautiful Moroccan decor terraces that were made for sun lounging and separate living rooms on the ground floor where you can watch a DVD if it takes your fancy. There's plenty to do in Marrakech but if you are staying for a while I imagine it would be a nice change to chill out indoors with a good film.    The rooms are nicely decorated. Our room which was on the top floor was well worth the money and had everything we needed including a private terrace. We got the cheapest room available (¬£225 for 3 nights) but the rooms on the ground floor looked amazing and spacious - if you can splash out a bit more I'd go for one of those. The only problem I can envisage is the the ground floor rooms surround the dining area which could potentially be a little noisy at dinnertime and breakfast time. However from the looks of it the doors are thick and probably block out most of it and the Riad was never noisy when we were there We only ever really heard the occasional tinkling of cutlery.    Service was impeccable - our hosts were amazing and catered to our every need bringing us complimentary mint tea and little pastries if we wanted them. Breakfast was perfectly sized and varied (fresh fruit pancakes pastries yoghurt tea freshly squeezed orange juice).    The beds were very comfortable and we always got a good nights' sleep - however if you are a light sleeper you may get woken up very briefly by the early morning prayer call which can be heard all over Marrakech and most likely in every Riad. The only other thing is that one of the 'private' terraces is adjacent to the drying lines so staff often come in and out to hang up laundry which can be distracting. Saying that though there are plenty of other terraces to choose from!    Next time I go to Marrakech I will definitely come to stay here again. Riad Les Trois Palmiers has hundreds of good reviews for a reason!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I would stay here again in a heartbeat. The staff picked us up from the airport and from there on it was clear sailing. The Riad is located in the heart of the Medina and the souks are only a couple of streets away (frankly with all the chat you get in the souks I wouldn't have wanted to stay any closer)! Breakfasts were consistently fine and served either in the atrium or on the rooftop terrace and whenever you emerge from your room. The staff hand-drew a map for us and made sure we knew where we were and how to get back there-- a tougher trick than you might think! Caroline the owner showed us on a map the must-see spots and she certainly wasn't wrong. The food was FANTASTIC-- if you stay here have dinner in at least one night. The ever-present hospitality of Moroccan mint tea was delightful the service clean and friendly and everyone really strove to be helpful. I was with two other friends but I'd feel comfortable staying here by myself. The rates were super reasonable. If you're thinking of getting henna while in Marrakesh arrange it through the Riad-- the woman they have on retainer is BRILLIANT! You won't find an artiste of her caliber in the square and the cost is simply added on to your bill.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This tastefully restored riad was perfect. The rooms are beautifully appointed with high quality Moroccan artisan fittings and furniture. The interior public spaces were equally refined and the roof terrace is fabulous. The staff could not have been more welcoming and helpful. It was a real oasis of tranquility amid the hubbub of the madina. Do contact the hotel in advance of your arrival and they will arrange to guide you through the alleyways to the hotel - it would be difficult to find unaided.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The staff was wonderful here. The owner Patrick was especially helpful in helping us to navigate Marrakech and to plan our next destination in Morocco. The riad is extremely clean and the breakfast of fresh breads juices and homemade yogurt was fantastic. The riad is located centrally within the old city and is a short walk to the main square. I would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: If I could give this place a 3.5 rating I would. But trip advisor doesn't give that option and they weren't quite a 4. Truth be told i usually try to pick one of the top five tripadvisor hotels but due to my very late planning choices 1-10 were already booked. The location was fine- not as close to the souks as I may have liked but really not far either. The main facilities are truly lovely- everything you would envision of a romantic Moroccan riad. The food was good- the kitchen staff was impressive as a whole. I was unimpressed with my room and bathroom- it left me wishing I'd planned ahead for a nicer place- I'm always willing to pay a little more for comfort. The decor was nothing like the photos and the first night I  was freezing despite cranking up the heater. The owner did notice at the end up my stay that they had accidentally placed me in the wrong type of room- and I thought it was very cool of him to point this out and adjust the price. It's not like I would have known any better. Service was also spotty. Sometimes the staff seemed so nice and other times I was irritated. Examples- I had been told by the owner that I could pay with credit card. But the staff member who checked me in very pointedly told me I cannot pay with credit card. I told him I had the email right there on my iPad and he actually looked skeptical and made me show it to him! Seriously? If I tell you I have talked to the owner then just go check with the owner! Of course I then checked with the owner and he did apologize and confirmed that credit card is ok. He explained that credit card services are sketchy there- and he is right. Credit card machines often don't work in Africa. I once got asked by a major hotel in Tanzania if I could please pay them $1000 cash. A second example of questionable service- The first night I ate at the riad I asked if could sit at the table closest to the pool and the staff actually refused stating that they had already set two place settings at that table. Is it THAT hard to move a plate and cup over to the other table to make your guest happy? I was given the table that faced a bunch of trees instead. I overheard the owner talking to a nearby table that night and he said he really cares about what guests have to say. If that is  the case what I would suggest is to work out these kinks. Don't list on all the major hotel booking sites that you take credit cards and then have the staff telling people you don't take credit cards. Perhaps you could train the staff on consistent service. The same man from the table incident was actually really nice the rest of the time I was there. I actually think that everyone there means well. I am picky because I have traveled pretty much everywhere and stayed at most types of hotels. This one has potential- but as it stands I left not feeling quite happy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This Riad is very nice inside with good food and excellent staff. I would suggest that you take up the Riads offer of a pick up from the airport as even Google earth would not help you find it. It is indeed down a serious of alleyways with no signage whatsoever not even on the Riads front door.  It is very close to the main square and within easy walking distance of many of the main attractions.  I had a very enjoyable stay and would recommend it for a long weekend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed in the Riad in February this year we took our teenage daughter.  The Riad was fabulous! not in a 5 star luxury kind of way but warm welcoming traditional comfortable clean.  We were worried to say the least when we initially arrived we didn't realise that the entrance to the Riad was down a series of allyways until we arrived at a door in the ally wall. We would never have found this if we had arrived alone thank goodness for the transfer provided by the Riad.  A system of 'rights and lefts' allowed us to come and go quite easily after that.  The staff couldn't do enough for us the evening meal on the first night was traditional and really nice.  We had breakfast on the rooftop and relaxed there late afternoon while Ahled and Hicham were perfect waiters we wanted for nothing.  We had a trip to the Atlas mountains Hicham was our guide well worth the trip.  I would definitely recommend this Riad
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Caroline T wrote a review Mar 2011
Review_Text: My husband daughter and I stayed for one night in this fantastic Riad. From the minute we arrived we were shown such courtesy by the staff - to begin with a Moroccan tea from Khalid followed by a guided tour of the Riad by Hischam and it was impressed upon us that we should treat it like our own home. After sightseeing we returned in the early evening and sat up on the roof terrace where we were served drinks followed by a delicious meal.  We found the whole experience very welcome and calming after the extremely busy and crowded streets of Marrakech and were only sorry that we couldn't have stayed longer.  All in all a brilliant experience - I would certainly recommend it to anyone and if we visit Marrakech again all three of us said we would definitely choose to stay there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I recently stayed here for two nights with a friend. We are both young females and found are stay brilliant! We were greeted by a very friendly Isham who collected us from our taxi and carried our bags to the Riad. He then gave us a very detailed tour of the Riad and made us feel extremely welcome and at ease. We found everything to be very clean and well organised and all the staff extremely friendly. Our only criticism would be that the staff were unable to recommend a good place to eat!!.. perhaps this was because they would like us to eat within the Riad! So advise would be to research places before you get to Marrakech. I say this because we had a particularly average meal in a restaurant near the big square and this was a shame because we were only there for two nights and both of us enjoy and appreciate good food!    All the reviews on here are very accurate- i wouldn't disagree with any of the most recent ones. I would highly recommend staying here!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect Riad for our first trip to Marrakech
Review_Text: Just returned from a short break in Marrakech to celebrate our second wedding anniversary. Riad Les Trois Palmiers was perfect from start to finish - from the lovely man who collected us from the airport with a big smile and warm handshake the friendly Isham who gave us a guided tour around the riad and told us about the city the lovely waiters who served us our delicious breakfast (fresh bread fruit homemade yoghurt) and the very friendly owners Patrick and Caroline who welcomed us as their guests. The riad is ideally located in the Medina within walking distance of all the main sights.    We had a really wonderful weekend and are now back in cold England dreaming of breakfast on the sunny roof terrace of this riad.    Book this riad - you won't regret it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: All the other review are right - it IS excellent
Review_Text: We came to Marrakesh to escape the freezing Swedish winter and the warmth of the welcome and service at Riad Les Trois Palmiers were the perfect antidote.  Truth be told we stayed a week in Marrakesh and that was a couple days too many. Having taken a day trip to the charming coastal town of Essouria (a couple or so hours away) with the benefit of hindsight we would recommend spending 4-5 days in Marrakesh combined with 2-3 days in Essouria - a perfect combination.  But back to the Riad. All the reviews extolling the place are a bit repetitive but the praise is totally justified. The place is beautiful the location excellent (a mere 10 minutes' walk from the main square) and the proprietors and their staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful; it's perhaps unfair to single out anyone but special praise must go to Mustapha who also makes the most delicious honey. We had ordered half board and thus had our evening meals at the Riad. One of us (who likes Moroccan food) thought the meal were wonderful; the other - a finicky eater at the best of times - decided he didn't like the flavours of Moroccan cuisine and thus his view doesn't help as guidance. But even he agreed that the tiny meatballs served in a tomato sauce with eggs poached in the sauce was superb!  Finaly three criticisms:  1. the hot water in the shower was a bit erratic and sometimes only lukewarm;  2. it seems a bit cheap that the only cheese offered at the otherwise very enjoyable breakfast comprised triangles of processed cheese;  3. it is a great pity that there is no non-smoking policy in the Riad; with access to the wonderful roof terrace surely that would be room enough for the smokers. In this context the main polluter was probably the otherwise charming proprietress Caroline.  To close despite these criticisms the Riad is a wonderful place and highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Don't bother staying anywhere else in Marrakech, you won't do better than here!
Review_Text: Have just spent a fantastic 5 days here. Patrick and Caroline are wonderful hosts and couldn't be more helpful. The riad is beautiful the rooms spacious elegant and spotlessly clean. The location is perfect - quiet but close to all the sites. The food ( breakfast and dinner ) is the best you will find. The staff are exceptional - all of them! We are very well travelled and have never met such a helpful friendly and smiling group of people - we just hope Patrick appreciates what an asset they are - we are sure he does! Look no further in Marrakech stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Perfect stay in an amazing Riad!!
Review_Text: This is a really late review (we actually went last August) but we really needed to say how fantastic our stay at Riad Les Trois Palmiers was. Everything we imagined and more! Beautiful building in the heart of the old town friendly staff great food. Would highly reccomend it to anyone!!    10 mins walk from the main square yet it remains a quiet tranquil oasis. Thanks to Patrick and his wonderful staff for making our stay so enjoyable.    Rich & Ali
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: No words could describe what a fantastice Riad this is everything about our stay was perfect.    Don't look at any other place just book here and all the staff will make your stay go with ease. Beats paying the same money for a hotel out side the Medina. More impressive rooms and features better service and the magic of the medina!    Will be returning
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We went to Marrakech on the 31st January to celebrate my friends 50th birthdayand what a birthday it was we stayed at the fabulous Riad Les Trois Palmiers The hospitality was amazing we were welcomed with open arms by Patrick and his staff. Tha food was plentyfull and very flavoursome and the decor of the riad was beautifull and so authentic. The hot air balloon ride with Marrakech by air is a must Hamid is a fabulous pilot an experiences well recomended.  Marrakech is a fantastic city a mixture of old and new culture its like stepping back 300 years I can't wait to come back again hopefully very soon.    Lynn Cooper Carlton Nottingham
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Beautiful Riad, beautiful people, beautiful atmosphere.
Review_Text: 10/10 - my girlfriends and I all had an amazing 4 days at this gem of a Riad in central Marrakech. I had visited previously so this was a repeat visit and I wasnt let done one bit. We were made to feel very welcome by all the staff who never seem to stop smiling. We were looked after so well Patrick Isham and Khalid couldn't do enough for us and as a result we shall all be returning again this time with our partners. Perfect for couples wanting a romantic break or a bunch of girlfriends wanting a bit of Sex and the City action! A wonderful stay in a wonderful Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Our second visit to this Riad for three nights with our family who did not join us last year.    Again a fantastic Raid experience with amazing staff who it seems nothing is too much trouble.    Even my parents who are the wrong side of 70 thought it was wonderful...    The food is outstanding (you must book in advance for evening dinner as it is bought fresh in the day) and try the Panini's for lunch on the roof terrace.    We will be back again.......    Remember cash only for payment in Dirhams euros or sterling
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We arrived on 28 Dec 2010 for a four day stay and could not recommend it more it is in an ideal position for visiting all the sights. The rooms are lovely and so are the staff although we do not speak hardly any French we had no problems the owner Patrick and all the staff were great. We highly recommend eating in the riad the food was good and great value and if you like to drink alcohol with your meal it is ideal as a lot of the local restaurants do not serve it. For NY Eve they laid on a gala meal with local singers + a belly dancer  we were expecting to be a bit left out due to not speaking French but instead we really enjoyed the evening Patrick and his family and a couple from Brazil sat with us and we chatted and laughed until the early hours on the NY. I can recommend  Cafe de France for people watching and if you like to drink the upstairs bar of Cafe Arabe do nice snacks and a decent bottle of wine for about ¬£15. Try Narwarma Thai restaurant if you want a change just off of the main square near the Koutoubia but it is a bit pricy . We also had a spa day at Les Bains de Marrakech which again was a great experience but also pricy although they same treatments would have been far more expensive in the UK. Recommend Marrakech and this Riad to anyone and will visit again soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Our four night stay included transfers which were very welcome and negated the hassle of taxis and buses. We were dropped near the riad to be met by Mustapha who led us through the alleyways. At this time we wondered what we'd let ourselves in for but were absolutely delighted with what we found upon stepping through the door. Patrick (the owner) met us and took his time giving us a guided tour of the riad explaining it's history. He also recommended some places to visit the best advice being to sit upstairs at the Cafe France watching the world go by in the main square. We were worried about finding our way through the souks so the personal touch continued with a hand drawn map. Our room was perfect (we'd booked a room but were upgraded free of charge due to the place being so busy). We opted for evening meals at the raid too. These were mainly traditional Moroccan meals and not always to my liking but generally very tasty. All in all we'd happily recommend this riad to anyone looking for our opinion. Excellent accommodation and excellent staff.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My husband myself and our friends enjoyed a 3 night break for my birthday we were met at arrivals and only 15 mins taxi ride and we were in the medina we were met by Riad staff who led the way through the lefts and rights in narrow passage like lanes we were very curious as to where we were going and could never have imagined the peaceful haven beyond the unmarked door of the Riad what a lovely surprise the photos on the websites don't do it justice the complete renovation has been beautifully restored with wonderful craftsmanship. Patrick the French owner was there to greet us and give us the grand tourwhat a friendly welcome we were introduced to all the staff and we had mint tea and petit foursit felt like a big family everyone is so helpful and friendlywe were a litle nervous about venturing out on our own but after directions and a personal map had been drawn up we set off for the night market i must admit it was a little daunting Marrakech is like a maze i'm glad there were 4 of us to fathom our way back we did  and had alot of offers of help!!! The breakfast was superb up on the roof top terrace in the sunshine  with plenty of english tea breads croissant fruit yogurt we decided to arrange to have an evening meal and left it to the wonderful cook to freshly prepare delicious morrocan cuisine what a treat it was so..... good we ate in the next night too what a feast.We had beautiful bedrooms lovely comfy beds and bedlinens plenty of hot hot water fluffy towels and bathrobes i'd find it hard to fault anything in the Riad Trois PalmiersMarrakech is an intensley colourful narrow maze of souks cafesmarket placeshustly bustlywith bicycles motorbikes donkey and carts all loaded up the only thing i would say is it would be easy to get your foot run over so you need to be good at jumping out of harms way the call to prayers is intriuging!!! the architecture and artifacts are stunning Would reccomend a short winterbreak to see an amazing different culture and some lovely blue sky sunshine
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: First off I (Fred) or my partner Jen have never written a review of anything but after having stayed at Patrick and Caroline's Riad we felt compelled to do so . our short stay was arranged and booked by friends who accompanied us . A transfer was organised through the Hotel who took as far as we could go by car where we were met by a member of staff who walked us in the rest of the way through some small dark alleys to the Riad door . Best way i could describe it is Tardis ! what a contrast  Patrick explained later that the Morrocan way is not to display ones wealth but behind the Riad door is a true Gem . Best place we have ever stayed on any holiday.step out the hotel door and your in the heart of the old city souks and medina . Go up to the roof terrace and you look over the city soak up the sun dine al fresco but it's so peaceful bar the ocassional call to prayer. The Riad is immaculately clean  staff can't do enough for you  and make you feel so welcome  all rooms are beautifully decorated and comfortable . Could go on and on but best thing for us to say is just go you will be so well looked after . the only negative we can think of is the bath water drained away a bit slow !!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Leonardo G wrote a review Jan 2011
Review_Text: In Riad Les trois Pamiers you will find a wonderful place to stay in Marrakech. The rooms the food the ambient everything is absolutely perfect! But the best thing that you will find at this place is people. From the house keepers to the owners everybody is so nice and gentle. Stay there and share some moments with Patrick and Caroline the Riad Owners. The will make you feel like home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The best thing about Riad Les Trois Palmiers was the warm welcome that we got as soon as we arrived. Super friendly staff who couldn't do enough to help you and make you feel comfortable relaxed and completely 'at home'. The location is excellent as it's only a 5 minute walk from the main square but far enough away from the hustle and bustle to make an ideal place to relax. We couldn't quite get over how peaceful it was sitting having our delicious breakfast in the gorgeous courtyard on the first morning.    Our room was smallish but adequate and was positioned on the roof of the Riad which often meant we had the whole of the fantastic rooftop terrace to ourselves! Just like the rest of the Riad our room was beautifully decorated in a traditional style which added to the feeling of a 'real' moroccan experience. It was also extremely clean and our beds were made each day.    Mustapha very kindly gave us a guided tour of the Riad on our first day and it was great to learn about all of the renovations that had been carried out. He also drew us a map of the local area which we definitely would have been lost without and give us some sound advice on the best places to visit. The owners Patrick and Catherine also gave us some excellent recommendations on restaurants bars and clubs - we had a really great night out as a result! And as two young females in Marrekech we felt very safe walking back to the Riad at night.    As suggested in other reviews we would recommend using the Riad airport shuttle service rather than a local taxi. It was very reasonable and we would have really struggled to find the Riad without it. Plus it makes things much easier when arriving at the airport late at night.    All in all we had an excellent stay and would definitely recommend to everyone else!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: What a fantastic place the staff are wonderful they cannot do enough for you. The food is also very very good and I have never stayed somewhere so clean. The location is great not far from the square.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Just got back from an enjoyable 4 days in Marrekesh.  This riad is really excellent. Close enough to the centre of the Medina but far enough away for it to be quiet.  Patrick made us very welcome from the start and the rest of the staff just could not do enough to make our trip memorable.  We ate there 1 night and the food was very good and you can also help the cook prepare the meal if you want. No outside noise to disturb our sleep but the bedrooms are smallish but you really only sleep in them so it does not really matter.  Lots of areas in the riad to relax and a lovely roof area where we ate excellent breakfasts  Go there. You will not be let down
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This Riad is very good and the staff make it excellent.    WE had a great 4 night stay only to discover at the last minute that our return flight was cancelled due to the Spanish Air Traffic Controller walk out. The owner Patrick could not have been more helpful in trying to sort the situation. Their driver took us to the airport and just waited until we decided what to do and then took us back to the Riad where we stayed an extra night. Patrick then even got a friend who worked for Air Maroc to help us organize flights back to the UK.    We will definitely be returning next year as the stay was so relaxing and enjoyable.    Steve and Manda
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A delightful oasis in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: What a wonderful place to stay - perfectly located and simply beautiful. I have already highly recommended this stunning Riad to all friends family and colleagues. A treat waiting for you to enjoy!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakech and my friend and I were a little a little apprehensive. We arrived at night and the narrow alleyways leading up to the Riad seamed quite scary but we needn't have worried. Our guide from the Riad was delightful and we were soon finding our way around thanks to the fantastic hand drawn maps. We had a fantastic holiday thanks to the kindness and help we received from everyone in the Riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: The riad and the staff were lovely and very helpful. Our room was great and having breakfast almost at our veranda was terrific! The riad was close to everything worth being close to.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Sarah L wrote a review Nov 2010
Review_Text: I cannot recommend this riad highly enough. Mustaffa was the most kind gentle natured polite and helpful person I have ever encountered in my life and I have done a lot of travelling. He draws every guest a map which is essential in order to find the riad again as there are no 'street' signs inside the medina walls. I would definitely recommend getting an airport pick up which we didn't as we arrived in Marrakech by coach. I should make it very clear that a taxi cannot take you there and we would have been stranded with no idea how to get there if it wasn't for the locals who showed us where it was. Be aware though they will expect a cash payment in return. The rooms are stunning with high class finishes and gorgeous designs. The riad was relaxing and clean and after 2 weeks of terrible hotels and service across the country this place was a god send. My only complaint would be that there was no seal to the room in that there was a 5cm gap between the wall of the room and the door so you could hear noise coming from the outside. Despite this you should not hesitate to book this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Clara A wrote a review Nov 2010
Review_Title: Amazing place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I visited Morocco for the first time just two weeks ago. Prior to going it was recommended we stay in a Riad in Marrakech to get the "true" Moroccan experience. After reading the amazing reviews of Riad Les Trois Palmiers online I decided to book our stay there. I could say a million wonderful things about this riad and how wonderful our stay was there- but a few key things stick out. First the medina of Marrakech and Morocco in general is a unique place to navigate the staff at the Riad are so knowledgeable and helpful they truly made a difference in our ability to explore the city. Having a ride from the airport is crucial- our plane was delayed an hour and our driver was still there waiting for us. The riad is immaculate our rooms were refreshed beautifully every day- the place looked pristine. The complimentary breakfasts in the morning are one of the highlights- they serve until 11 am it's such a relaxing dining experience. The riad itself is very centrally located making it easy to see all the sights. Lastly during your stay- be sure to spend lots of time on the roof top terrace- day and night it's just wonderful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This magnificently and meticulously restored Riad in the heart of the medina is an oasis of calm and civility in an exotic and chaotic locale. Patrick and Caroline our hosts left no detail unattended. Their staff was efficient prompt and extremely gracious throughout. The premises were intimate quiet and respectful of other guests. There were numerous cozy spots to recline and lounge read visit and sip tea. There is no "restaurant" per se but there are meals available as you'd imagine at a Bed & Breakfast with a chef on the premises who will cook up a meal for any group with sufficient notice to make it to the market in time. Ingredients are farm fresh and absolutely locally sourced. I was treated with delectable tagines and couscous house-made pastries and mint tea at every turn. Breakfast is included and I enjoyed lunch and dinners there as well. This was the perfect spot to recharge my batteries for a couple days and explore the medina before heading out with friends on a longer adventure tour of Morocco. I would go back in a heartbeat!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A real gem in the hussle and bustle of the Marrakech Souks
Review_Text: During our 5 day stay we started our trip off by pre arranging to be picked up from the airport by the Riad driver Abdul this is a hightly recommended. We were dropped off near the riad where one of the staff members took us on a short walk through the hustle and bustle sights and sounds to the riad. Without this service you will not find the place as it is down a few dark alleyways and signposting is rare in morocco.  Maps and guide book routes will mean nothing in the souks but the riad owner Patrick will draw one that will get you to all the main sights to see keeping things simple. (if you do stray off his map route have some Dirhams handy as the local guides will want paying). The riad is in a great location and Patrick can arrange day trips to the Atlas mountains and other attractions.  The service at the riad is of a very high standard and the staff are friendly and extremely hospitable. We had a few meals at the riad and they were of a high standard you dont get a menu but will get told what each course is. Breakfast can be had in the main court yard or on the roof terrace and is very good to start the day with!  We had one of the smaller rooms but it was comfortable and well decorated and being on the roof terrace we had loads of space to enjoy the sun outside. Overall we had a great stay and highly recommend this riad as mentioned before by other reviewers they dont take credit/debit cards so you have to pay by cash or do an internet transfer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My sister and I enjoyed our first trip to Marrakech. The Riad was right in the heart of the Medina yet was a peaceful haven. Patrick and Caroline were both very helpful all the staff gave a polite and friendly service. The quality of the food was very good we enjoyed the breakfasts on the terrace and the evening meals were authentic and delicious such a lovely ambiencewith personalattentive service. I would recommend this Riad to all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: The perfect place to stay if it's your first trip to Marrakech....
Review_Text: We were picked up at the airport by a friendly driver who dropped us as near as possible to our riad. We were then escorted to the riad down some winding dark alleys to an unassuming door. Inside was a fabulous courtyard and a welcome reception we were given a guided tour of the riad including the roof terrace and given a bit of the history of the house followed by mint tea and then we were shown to our lovely clean traditional looking room with a beautiful ensuite bathroom and stained glass windows over the courtyard    The hotel manager Patrick gave us information about the best places to visit eat and enjoy the atmosphere of the city and it was good advice!    Breakfast was served wherever you wanted to have it on the terrace or courtyard by the ever friendly and helpful staff and consisted of freshly made pancakes/pastries fruit and breads.    You are also able to eat dinner at the riad if you book in advance and you are even allowed in the kitchen for a cooking lesson and help prepare dinner.    It was a very relaxing place to rest and unwind between trips to the hectic souks and the fun of the main square. Highly recommend a stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Lovely riad, lovely people. I'd be really, really surprised if you can find better than this
Review_Text: The riad is actually two interconnected riads each in a different style and located only a few minutes walk from the souks and Jemaa El F'na. They have been beautifully restored by the current owners Caroline and Patrick. We had one of the two rooms on the roof terrace which we thought particularly pleasant as you emerge into the sunshine on the terrace in the morning. Ordinarily we never ever eat in hotels prefering instead to try the local restaurants. However on this occasion we decided to try dinner at the riad on the first night as we'd been up since 4 and couldn't be bothered finding somewhere else. Suffice to say we ate there every evening thereafter. There's no menu you get what you're given (I think vegetarians are also catered for) but the food is excellent and plentiful. Most of the staff speak very little English but we had little difficulty communicating and nothing was too much trouble. And all this for a very reasonable price. Please be aware that the riad does not accept credit or debit cards only cheques or cash - this necessitated a few trips to ATMs to accumulate sufficient cash to pay at the end and they should really make this clear at the outset. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: This is a fantastic place to stay
Review_Text: We stayed at this Riad for 3 nights. We had the most amazing time in Marrakech and it was party due to this Riad. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful. The room was decorated to the finest quality I have seen in a long time. This place is excellent value for money but it has a luxurious feel about it. We loved this place and would recommend it to anyone!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Attractive and comfortable riad with extremely helpful staff makes one want to return to Marrakech
Review_Text: We were picked up at the airport necessary to find this lovely riad located in some twisty turning streets in the Medina. When the door opened and we saw Les Trois Palmiers  (the three palm trees) and the lush and tiled surroundings we knew we choose the right place.  All our prior communication with owners and hosts Patrick and Christine was confirmed. They beautifully decorated this riad with comfort in mind and excellent taste.  Icham welcomed us with the first of numerous mint teas and was helpful with our many questions about where and how to explore Marrakech. He hand drew us a map to locate several sights and how to return to Les Trois Palmiers..  Our room was spacious clean with a huge tile tub/shower. It contained all that an upscale hotel would have but included the charm of a riad.  Dalila the cuisiniere (cook) was talented and friendly. Although we ate at several restaurants we mostly enjoyed dinner at "home" in our Riad.  All the staff went out of their way to be helpful. We are thankful to Mustapha and Badr for all their care and also giving us a better understanding of the lifestyle in Morocco.  Other staff members that were kind are Habida Dhiba and Khadija  We say this is a place to return to.....and so we did! On our way back after visiting 2 cities in Morocco we happily returned for two more days.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Mark A wrote a review Nov 2010
Review_Title: Beautiful oasis of a riad in a fantastic city
Review_Text: Walking down the dark alleyways (even though it was the middle of the day!) to the riad gave us our first taste of the fascinating city of Marrekech. Our nervousness about never finding the place again on our own was premature as you soon get a feel for the city and get your bearings thats all part of the fun! Walking into the riad for the first time was a lovely surprise the photos on their website do not do the place justice. Patrick the owner proudly gave us a tour of each room explaining in detail how the place was renovated. The riad has been beautifully restored with so much effort and cost going into adding special touches and the furniture etc all fits in perfectly to the overall effect. The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly throughout our stay always with a smile on their face nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast on the roof terrace was lovely wish we had eaten at riad one night based on other trip advisor comments that will have to be next time! Please ignore recent rather negative posting some people are never happy! Although my only criticism does coincide with one of their moans plastic lining on sheet on the bed in roof terrace bedroom (I think other beds in riad did not have this) are a bad idea and resulted in poor nights sleep every night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Very Good Riad, watch out work being done in waste system
Review_Text: Agree with other travelers' comments about location and service. Patrick (onwer) and the gentlemen in charge (Mustaf√°) really try to go out of their way. Watch outs: 1) Work is being done in nearby waste system and it creates a really bad odor (at least in my room; El Bach√°) particularly early morning and nights - when you happen to be there. 2) Is allowed to smoke everywhere in the Riad so be careful if you happen to be sensitive to tobacco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A week in Les Trois Palmiers was our perfect holiday.Complete tranquility in the heart of the Medina.The staff could not have been more helpful and friendly.This riad has been most sympathetically restored and is a delight from the roof gardens down through the bedrooms to the patio with its poolthree palm trees and comfortable sitting rooms.This was not at all like staying in a hotel - it was more like staying with a friend.The food was delicious Moroccan cooking at its best.We cannot recommend this riad highly enough.We hope to return .  Alan and ChristineMuckhartScotland.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Having stayed in a delightful riad in Fez we looked forward to the same in Marrakesh. Riad Les Trois Palmiers has been restored in a clean cream style and the owners seemed to leave most of the care of guests to the very helpful staff. The main reason why we would not recommend this riad however is the fact that guests are able to smoke wherever they want and other guests are not able to get away - consequently we did not dine there and even breakfast in the courtyard was spoilt. Our room did not have a fridge the bed was covered by a plastic undersheet which made it uncomfortableand there was no computer in the riad that we could use. To top it all we were told that they would not take credit cards one day before we had to leave which made it extremely difficult to take out enough cash to pay the bill (had we booked through the website apparently we would have known this fact in advance).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I agree with almost every thing in the previous review by Helen Tilly with the exception of the room. Our room was on the ground floor and was very spacious and convenient but if you are after a double bed then this is not the room for you. It has 3 single beds in it.  We ate and drank at the Aruba bar on a couple of occassion and it was excellent.  The staff at the Riad are wonderful really helpful and friendly. Anything you want is not a problem.  It's a really centrally located Riad but not noisy at all.  I will be booking to stay there again shortly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We stayed in Marrakech for 4 nights at the Riad - would DEFINITELY recommend the airport transfer service as no way would we have found it without this!    The Riad is tucked away down a windy alley away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina great location for the main sights and not far from a nice bar / restaruant Cafe Arub.    The staff were beyond helpful - so attentive and friendly served a really lovely breakfast each day - we also chose to eat dinner here 2 nights of our 4 as the food was amazing (the best I'd say out of our 2 wks in Morocco) dinner up on the candlelit roof terrace was also a really lovely experience.    The only negative I would give for this Riad is our room was a little on the small side (it was up on the roof terrace can't remember the name) but was furnished and decorated to a very high standard it wasn't a problem at all - I'd go back here if we ever come back to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A group of us stayed four nights and found the owner Patrick and his staff both pleasant and helpful. The owners have restored the riad beautifully - it is in fact two riads joined together. This gives rise to two courtyards  two pools and two roof terraces to relax on so one can always find a quiet spot. As with most riads in the old part of town it would not be easy to find the first time so arrange an airport or other pick up. When you arrive Patrick will give you his hand drawn map which is very easy to use when finding your way to and from the main square. All the facilities work well including the bathrooms and there is plenty of hot water. Although the riad is located down some small pedestrian (or donkey cart) access only streets I never found any feeling of insecurity even late at night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Recently stayed for my sisters 40th and it was truly wonderful and memorable. Rooms -Merinade is a great sized room with an amazing bathroom and decor and great ac. Irissade is slightly smaller but on terrace which is lovely. The riad is perfect after a day in Marrakech which is very lively you return to a oasis of calm. The decor is great and attention to detail shows. Patrick and his staff are wonderful and nothing seems to much trouble. The breakfast are lovely and fresh and we dined in which is was also lovely and very authentic. Also dine at Cafe de Arabe which was good. Location is spot on not to far from souks and night market square.It is perfectly safe to walk around locals are friendly. I would just return and stay in riad next time there is a gorgeous terrace for sunbathing or chilling as long as Patrick doesn't change anything!  I have stayed in some lovely hotels but this up at the top 10/10 Thankyou Patrick and your staff
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Good riad, with a few quirks
Review_Text: Stayed here for 4 nights and loved the decor as well as the very nice and thoughtful staff. If you book for more than 3 nights you get transfers to/from the airport which was a godsend. Note that it is very difficult to find and it takes a few days to get your bearings via the alley ways but the staff will do everything they can to make sure you find your way back. We booked the triple room which is on the ground floor next to the courtyard which was fine for us two ladies but if you are a couple and want privacy ask for a room where other guest won't be sitting just outside your window/door. The bathroom was a dream as well as the lovely bath products that were addicting. The food was good and the service amazing but we cannot compare it to much else since we rarely ate elsewhere. We especially liked the attentive service and gentle nature of Mr. Hicham and the other staff given that we were two women travelers who were made to feel very uncomfortable outside of the hotel by Moroccan men in general. We did book a great camel ride (actually a dromedary) by the owner of the Riad and it was the highlight of our trip. The owner also booked us a guide (Mr. Riz) to visit the market (zouk) which I would NOT recommend due to him only speaking French taking us to his friend's shops talking on his cell constantly and walking so fast he lost us twice in the market; not to mention being sexually harassed at a shoe store while he took tea with the shop owner outside. Although this is not a direct reflection on the Riad it should be noted that any tour you book via the hotel has to be paid at the hotel which puts the responsibility of the extracurricular services on the hotel. They also booked us a private driver & guide to Ouarzazate for the day and although we liked it we were not told of the extra charges that were not included in the higher price (25 euro more vs. tours advertised on the back of the hotel given map) until we were at the sites. So make sure to ask for exactly what is and is not included in all hotel booked excursions. Most important note is to make sure you have enough cash at the end of your stay to pay the bill since they do not take credit cards and their exchange rate is not very favorable as that of a bank. All in all the place is very nice and the service by all of its staff superb.    On a separate note re shopping before you purchase anything in the market I highly recommend first visiting the "Ensemble Artisanal:" ‚Äì a government backed handicraft center. Prices are fixed and without pushy salesmen persuading you to buy overpriced Moroccan goods of unknown origin. It is about one block up from the Koutoubia mosque on Avenue Mohammed V. After the hassles at the market we found we got better deals here plus quality items minus the headaches from 2hr bargaining sessions. Also you get to see the craftsmen at work and some stores benefit women cooperatives directly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Date: Jason L wrote a review Sep 2010
Review_Title: Great location, friendly and helpful staff
Review_Text: The riad is a great starting point to explore Marrakech. It is well situated close to the Medina and a 5-10 minute walk to Jemaa el-Fna. Though it is initially difficult to find the staff of the riad will generally meet you when you first arrive to navigate you through the alleys. The riad is comfortable well maintained and the beautifully renovated. There are several rooms available and whilst the room that I had was small it was clean and very comfortable. The charm of this riad is the attentiveness and helpfulness of the staff. The staff were not overbearing and provided invaluable advice on places to visit eat and were a wealth of information. Overall I had an incredibly pleasant stay at this riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A superb experience which made our holiday
Review_Text: Our first trip to Marrakech was made special by staying at this Riad. Close to major tourist attractions in the heart of the Medina it is very well located. All the staff are extremely friendly and couldn't do enough to see that we were well looked after. Patrick the owner is a perfect host and keen to share details of his expriences as a Frenchman owning restoring and running a Riad in Marakech.    Our bedroom was large and comfortable and the double bathroom including 3 or 4 person bath was something special!    The alleyways leading from the main street down to the riad are scary at first but safe even at night but we were very glad we had booked a driver organised by the Riad to collect us from the airport as this meant we were met in the main street at the taxi drop-off point by the hotel staff and escorted the few hundred yards to the door. We woudn't have found it otherwise but once you know where it is and get your bearings it's easy enough.    Food taken either in the downstairs courtyard or the rooftop terrace was very good and some of the bast we experienced in the city including from those reastaurants (both higher and lower priced) recommended in our guide book. A varying set meal is served each evening with no menu and no options so a simple menu on the table decscribing tonight's meal would be helpful and informative! Breakfasts are "continental" but plentiful.    All in all this riad made our holiday in Marrakech and we would thouroughly recommend to to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We have just returned from a fantastic holiday in Marrakech. We stayed in Patrick and Caroline's Riad and it was a wondeful experience. The Riad is situated in a great location it really is an 'oasis' with amazing decor and very attentive staff. We will definitely be returning and recommend it highly. Gerry Thomas & Frank
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We had an absolutely fantastic stay at the riad.    Great location - just a few mins walk from the start of the souks 10 mins from main square. Some great restaurants just around the corner. It's nicely tucked away so peaceful and away from hussle and bussle.    Rooms very clean - faultless in this department. Great attention to detail by cleaning staff.    Staff very friendly abd helpful - everyone from Partick (the owner) and Isham the ladies in the kitchen the guy who looks like Nicolas Anelka and served our breakfast (sorry forgot his name!) - were very welcoming and could not do more to help make our stay more enjoyable. Thank you all!    The only grumble was regarding pick up from airport - they didn't turn up!  They claimed not to have received an email from us which confirmed our arrival time - even though they replied to it and we had it printed out! Anyway luckily we had their number so called them up and they arranged for taxi to pick us up from airport 40 mins later (after we had already waited 30 mins). So not the best start and first impression as you can imagine! So probably more 4.5 out of 5 rather than 5.    Be sure to take their tel number with you - otherwise no chance of finding them on your own if pick up does not turn up - as you will discover when you get to the old town! It's a maze!    It did NOT ruin what was a truly memorable holiday. My girlfriend has already booked to go back next year! Thanks to everyone at the riad again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Booked last minute 1 night stay paid appox ¬£80. Very central although was hard to find as dropped in medina by taxi and had to rely on local taking us down back lanes which was pretty scary. But once went through door was amazing! Typical moroccon riad built around an open courtyard lots of plants water features and plenty of areas to relax. Room was small but beautiful high ceiling comfy bed lovely decor very clean and biggest bath I have ever seen! Breakfast was served on the rooftop terrace nice food and great views. Only bad point was didn't have the best night sleep you could hear everything else going on in the hotel and were awoken by the call for prayer early on. But I think this is what you would expect anywhere in the medina. Overall was great value for money and would like to go back and stay for longer. Note that you have to pay in cash can't use debit/credit card.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: this is a great riad that has been restored with great attention to detail.the owners and staff were welcoming and provided excellent service throughout our 3 day stay.    would not hesitate to return for another visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This is a traditional riad with rooms situated around a central courtyard which contains the three palm trees. There has been a great attention to detail in the renovation of this characterful building. Rooms are luxurious. Nice roof terrace and a plunge pool on the ground floor. Friendly and helpful staff.  Difficult to find - it's in a maze of alleyways - but well worth the hunt.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Great Riad with warm and welcoming staff!
Review_Text: I stayed at this Riad for 3 days due to its great reviews on trip advisor. After staying there I can see why so many people gave this place such a high rating. The Riad is in a very quiet and calming street. It also commands a very good spot in the Medina so you are able to walk straight into the bustling streets and experience the most lively and interesting parts of the city. The staff helped to make me feel at home and nothing was too much for them. The owner Patrick summed it up when he told me 'that this was now my home and I was welcome anytime'. I would not hestitate to recommend this Riad and when I visit Marrakech again I will definitely be staying here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Our stay in this beautiful riad was delightful on all counts.
Review_Text: Riad Les Trois Palmiers is a haven in the midst of the medina. The bedrooms and lound spaces are beautiful the food wonderful and the service exceptional. Its location is ideal - extremely quiet but easy to find with excellent access to numerous attractions.

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Beautiful home away from home in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: This beautifully restored riad is really two homes in one -- connected at the ground floor and upper terrace. It provided plenty of quiet places to relax in the shade or in the sun in a room with other guests in front of a TV atop the rooftop terrace with a view of the city's many minarets or beside one of the two tiled plunge pools. The tireless and exceptionally friendly staff did everything from cooking delicious meals to bringing us wine on the terrace taking us to and from the airport and even shopping for the best deal on tagines and spices for us.    The rooms were well appointed and air conditioned which was necessary during an exceptionally hot week in July.    Returning to this cool peaceful oasis from the heat and chaos of the medina was like returning home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: We've just returned from a long weekend at the Riad Les Trois Palmiers - what a lovely place! The Riad is absolutely peaceful yet just minutes from the many Souks and less than 10 minute walk to the main square. All of the staff couldn't do enough to help and the room was fantastic and at a VERY reasonable price!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: Romantic, Relaxing and a Perfect Location to Explore Marrakech!
Review_Text: I chose Marrakech as our honeymoon destination. After a lot of research into the riads and hotels available I decided on Riad Les Trois Palmiers from all the positive comments.  Owned by Patrick and Caroline the moment we stepped into the Riad we felt at home. They were so welcoming nothing was too much trouble for them or their staff - especially Isham who was always around and very helpful. On our first evening we had a meal there and were not disappointed.  The room was beautiful clean spacious and relaxing. The adjoining bathroom was an added luxury. After a long day exploring the sights of Marrakech it was nice to come back to the relaxing atmosphere of the Riad.  The Riad is situated about a 10-15 minute walk from the main market square Jemaa el Fna  A special thanks to Patrick Caroline and Isham for making our stay that little bit special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This Riad deservedly holds it's high ranking on TripAdvisor.  Everything we experienced was perfect.
