The staff are friendly helpful and professional; the decor is beautiful and very serene; the food...well the food is simply amazing and excellent value; and finally the location is perfect right on the edge of the souks (which I personally found a lot of fun!) and in easy walking distance either of the sites themselves or somewhere to find a taxi to get you to further out places.  Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and any help you require is given with no problem at all from advice on whether you've been stung in the souks to arranging trips to restaurant recommendations to a cold drink.  The rooms are beautiful. My friend and I stayed in the ground floor triple room and it was comfortable and exceptionally clean. The bathroom had everything you needed and the shower was lovely. Outside our room was the dining area where the pool was also found and this too was gorgeous although the water was FREEZING! (Not necessarily a bad thing after toasting yourself on a sun lounger on the roof it's just what you want!).  Overall I really can't recommend this place enough and if I hear of anyone wanting to visit Marrakech I'll certainly be pointing them in the direction of Les Trois Palmiers. Perfect!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This was our first visit to Marrakech and we were delighted with our stay in the Riad Les Trois Palmiers. Situated handily in the busy Medina area down a rather unpromising series of alleyways it was a relaxing oasis of calm. Service was good the Riad was attractively decorated with plunge-pool and stunning rooftop views over the city to the Atlas Mountains. Our room with ensuite bathroom was clean comfortable and well designed. We ate dinner on the Riad rooftop one evening and both thoroughly enjoyed the Moroccan fare. Both of us would be happy to return in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: I picked this riad from a long list of many on the web. I had literally studied each and every hotel and riad in Marrakech since this stay is rather special. We were going to get married in Morocco. The location is unbeatable and it‚Äôs close to Djemaa el Fna. Well! I've been in some nice hotels in my time but this one is AMAZING! We enjoyed this riad hugely especially due to the large size of the suite compared to most places. Our room and bathroom (which was almost as big as the bedroom) were wonderful. The room was immaculate and comfortable. We had even got flower arrangement in our suite the day before the wedding. It was an experience that I will never forget!!!!!    Patric and Caroline was so charming and genuinely helpful. They helped us from hiring a shuttle the whole wedding day taking us to the embassy in Rabat for getting married to the bookings of the gorgeous restaurant ‚ÄúMaison du Gourmet‚Äù for our wedding reception in Casablanca to the bouquet for my wedding. It couldn‚Äôt been any better. They was also really blessed of having the most pleasant cheerful and polite staff. They was always helpful and had a smile on their lips as soon they saw us.    We had a really bad flight with Royal Air of Maroc from Milan and witch we also found out that they had another flight company called Atlas Blue that was hired instead (the same company Royal Air M.. are trying to get rid of bad reviews by trying to have Atlas Blue flying for them). Imaging to get the news from Milan that there have never been any flights between Milan and Marrakech when we were heading there for our wedding. But there was a flight to Casablanca. So we took it of course and actually it ended with RAM was flying anyways. Royal Air of Maroc and what they call their other company - Atlas Blue is pure scammers!! We had as bad experience with them on the flight back. This time was that they tried to cancel the flight since it was only 40 people booked. Anyways when we arrived finally in Casablanca our angel Patric had arranged a car to pick us up from the Airport in Casablanca to Riad Les Trois Palmiers in Marrakech. How sweet isn‚Äôt that!!!    From top to bottom everything in this riad is in perfect standards. The riad is gorgeous as other reviewers have said. We had our breakfast always on the roof with the delightful Moroccan mint tea. This is the one I would pick for a leisure travel. Internet was easy accessed by a code you get from the reception and it is for free. They arranged also car service for us to and from the airport which was impeccable and it was free too.    We where 5 people from the family and we stayed 7 nights. The stay was truly outstanding. I almost don't want to write this review in case everyone books it and we can't get in again ;)))
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A top riad actually two connected riads with two small pools and a great roof garden: Views to the Atlas and over the city several opportunities to sit down and rest or just enjoying the sun of Marokko. Also very much recommended with kids they can swim in the pools a bit. Patrique thw owner is a very friendly french and fully committed to deliver himself and his team a perfect service. Dinner has very high quality. It is located hidden in the medina without any sign and only 15min walk from the central place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: This was our first visit to Marrakech and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The Riad run by Patrick and Caroline was just wonderful. The room we had was spacious clean and very well presented. The bed was a little hard but we both slept very well after all the walking we did. The food at the Riad was very impressive and we regret dining there only one night. The staff we friendly and couldn't do enough to make our trip memorable and enjoyable. The Riad is located to the north and about 10mins walk from the square - we were very happy with the location. Patrick organised a private tour to the Atlas mountains which was a real highlight and worth every euro. Our guide and driver were magnificent company. Oh the Riad has wifi in the lobby area which was very handy for staying in touch with home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: If you travel to Marrakech you must stay in a riad to experince the Morrocan culture. Les Trois Palmiers is a peaceful and beautiful riad very conveniently situated for th souks and main square. The aiport transfer is an added bonus as the riad would be very difficult to find. Patrick and Caroline have created a very stylish and welcoming place which is apleasue to return to after the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the food was the bset we had in Marrakech. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. We wil certainly return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Title: A piece of Paradise in the chaos of Marrakech
Review_Text: We have just returned after 6 days in Marrakech staying at Les Trois Palmiers. The attention to detail and quality of the restoration are excellent the staff are superb friendly and helpful...nothing seems to much trouble. Patrick and Carolyine are fantastic hosts and you can also use the Riad attached next door as part of your trip which they also own.    We had a large room/junior suite which was fantastic very clean and spacious.    The food at the Riad is amazing. They were more than happy to book excursions for us and give advice (such as stall 99 in the market for food which if you like fish is a must...). Breakfast on the roof terrace in a morning is a great way to start your day and a bottle of wine or a mint tea up there after your day sight seeing is a great way to relax :-)    Hard to believe that the chaos of Marrakech is just outside the Riad doors when you are inside this beautiful and relaxing bit of paradise. If we go back to Marrakech we will book Les Trois Palmiers again....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: Stayed here for five nights and have to say that the Riad is a stunning redevelopment with such a fine eye for detail that its a must stay even for one night. Patrick the owner speaks French German Arabic and English and is a real professional along with his wife. We stayed on the terrace which was small but cosy with stunning views from the roof top. Only critisism is that in the middle of the Iceland eruption and the scrabble to get home we were told they only accept cash as a payment.  Don't think it mentions that on there web page. Despite this fully recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: A really excellent Riad. very firendly and helpful staff (particularly Isham who was so helpful and attentive). Beautiful rooms very comfortable and exceptionally quite and peaceful. Food was delicious - the best that we had in Morocco and dining on the roof terrace under the starts was a real pleasure.  Its secluded location makes it difficult to find without help so use the hotel car service from the airport. We would thoroughly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Hotel_Name: Riad Les Trois Palmiers El Bacha
Review_Text: My daughter and I stayed five days at the end of January 2009 in the Riad Les Trois Palmiers / El Bacha (they are next to each other and connected). We are from Switzerland and this was our first time in Morocco. We found about the Riad on the Internet. Our experience was wonderful. The Riad is in the heart of the medina some 15 minutes walk through the souks from Djemma el Fna. It is also within the walking distance to Medersa Ali Ben Yousef (some 10-15 minutes; a must!) and pretty much everything else most people expect to see in Marrakech: Mosque Koutoubia Palace El-badi Saadien Tombs etc. We walked to all these places which is really the best way to "feel" Marrakech. the Majorelle and Menara Gardens and the new city are a short taxi drive away. The Riads are perfectly placed to explore the city. The neighborhood of the Riads is very quiet and safe yet you are just few steps from the shops and excitement of the souks.  Patrick (the owner? manager?) was very kind and helpful. Besides the breakfast we opted to have dinner each evening in the Riad and that was an excellent decision: the food was delicious atmosphere very relaxed the stuff very courteous and helpful the cooks the first class and yet everything was affordable. The rooms were excellent comfortable spacious spotlessly clean as was the whole Riad. Patrick organized for us a car for a day trip to Essaouira and the driving through Marrakech was another unforgettable experience.  The Riads have great roof tops with chairs tables and plants and are very nicely decorated You can see the whole city from there the Atlas (weather permitting) and it is a great place to spend an evening when tired from the sightseeing.  The transport from and to the airport was organized by Patrick so we did not have to worry about that.  I warmly recommend the Riads Les Trois Palmieres and El Bacha and if we again go to Marrakech (which we hope to do) we will certainly stay there again. I'll be happy to give more information about the Riads and Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family
